Budi is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK. Budi is now requesting a new loan of 2,500,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Budi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


  


Budi S. (PK-00251) merupakan 42 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Pejarakan - Singaraja - Bali.  Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia balita.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Budi memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pangan.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuat & menjual makanan.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual makanan ringan & makanan kecil lainnya di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Budi sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 6 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Budi menghasilkan sekitar 500.000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2010, Budi bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Budi telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari MUK.    Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 2.500.000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli inventaris & modal kerja tambahan.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.  Budi berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir.

Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking..  "

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.en:
Blanca is thirty-four years old.   She lives in the village of Escute in the district of Olmos.  Olmos is an area in northern Peru, primarily populated by small farmers.   Blanca shares her home with her partner and their two children.

Out of the front of her home, Blanca manages a small general store.  She sells various basic goods including hygienic supplies, food, candy, and miscellaneous tools.  She is proud to be able to serve her community and reduce the time they must spend traveling in order to complete their shopping.  She has managed the store for a number of years now and has a loyal clientele. 

Blanca plans to use the loan to expand her merchandise.  She hopes to be able to obtain bulk discounts and improve her store’s profitability.  It is her dream to own a larger and more sustainable store.  She hopes this loan will hope her reach that growth.  Blanca is very well respected in her community and has good references.  Edpyme Alternativa is excited to be able to introduce you to her and to help her obtain access to credit.

loans.use: Expand her inventory

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Regina; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de granos secos y también ella trabaja en el área de limpieza en el restaurant turístico, los granos secos lo vende en el mercado de Viniocanchon que queda ubicado en San Jeronimo,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  granos secos como trigo, quinua y maíz.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "MAQUIMANTA PURISUN". The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco. The member's name is Regina. She is 30 years old, lives with her partner and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling dried grains and also works cleaning a tourist restaurant. 

She sells the dried grains in the Viniocanchon market which is located in San Jeronimo. She wants to increase her business and requests a loan to buy dried grains such as wheat, quinoa and corn.

Regina is happy about getting the loan and promises to fulfill her payments.

loans.use: This member requests a loan to buy dried grains such as wheat, quinoa, and corn.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis E. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin  Misamis Occcidental. He is 30 years old. Dennis is married and has one infant-aged children. To make a living, Dennis owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Dennis has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Dennis joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dennis has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Dennis is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 34th loan taken out by Dennis from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 57 años, queda separada de su esposo y vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de  sus 3 hijos mayores que tiene su familia. Desde hace muchos años, desde la ventana de su casa,  Luz vende gaseosas, galletas, frugos y cervezas.  Los fines de semana; son días muy arduos para ella, ya que vende cerveza hasta altas horas de la noche a sus vecinos y otros jóvenes deportistas de la loza aledaña a su casa, que le prefieren comprar a ella, por su buen trato y su gran paciencia, es así que capta  buenas utilidades; sin embargo la venta de las demás bebidas gasificadas no le genera muchas rentas. Por ello su anhelo  es instalar una puerta para el acceso de la gente a su  establecimiento, asimismo desea surtirla con todos los productos comestibles a  su bodega, ya que el negocio le gusta mucho y sobre todo conversar con sus clientes. Es el 12avo crédito con MFP, y como socia antigua se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente como hasta hoy, además en su banco comunal es muy respetada por su responsabilidad. De contar con el crédito que solicita, comprará cervezas y gaseosas por la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
Luz is 57 years old and is separated from her husband.  She lives in her own home with her 3 older children that have families of their own.  Luz has been selling soft drinks, candy, frugos [fruit beverages] and beer from a window in her house for many years now.  The weekends are difficult for her as she sells beer to her neighbors and young athletes from the sport courts in her neighborhood until late into the night.  They prefer to buy from her because she treats them well and has lots of patience.  This is how she makes a good profit as she does not make much from the sale of her other beverages. She would like to install a door so that people have access to her store, then she would be able to stock all kinds of grocery items in her store.  She really likes this business and most of all she likes conversing with her customers.  

This is her 12th loan with MFP and as a long time member she is committed to making her payments on time, as she has done in the past.  Additionally, her communal bank is very respected because they are so responsible.  With the loan she will buy beer and soft drinks for the summer season.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and beer

loans.name: Kurash

texts.en:
Kurash O. is 30 years old. He is married and a father of four children aged between five and fifteen. Kurash is a farmer,  farming his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five  years.

He learned about KADET from women who are already registered members of KADET LTD. This will be his  third  loan after paying back the previous loans successfully. He plans to spend the loan amount to prepare land and buy chemicals and fertilizer for his wheat farm.Because of the climatic condition and fertile soil, wheat has proved to do very well and also the market is readily available in the area for both retail and wholesale buyers.

Kurash hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. Kurash's dream is do large-scale farming and have his own farm machinery.  He is a painstaking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land and buy chemicals and fertilizer for wheat farm

loans.name: Joesela

texts.en:
Joesela is a married woman who lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  pig fattening and buying & selling dried fish. Her husband Deonilo, who is 42 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 8 to 20 years old.  Joesela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 22 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Joesela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 23rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to purchase additional piglets so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Joesela is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets

loans.name: Kenanga Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang A. S., as well as all the members of the Kenanga Indah Group, is getting her second loan. Ni Komang A. S. plans to buy four pigs and also feed if there is an excess of the loan money added to her own capital.

To support the family income, in addition to raising pigs every day, Ni Komang A. S. sells snacks. Her husband is a driver. Every day she spends 15,000 for the needs of the kitchen (food) and Rp. 125,000 to pay for electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy four pigs

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a married lady with four children.  She does farming so as to earn a living for her family.  She has been farming for fifteen years. She was previously operating a butchery and a green grocery.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to run her business and gained business skills.  She hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  She has requested 30,000 KES to buy a cow and sheep.

loans.use: To buy a cow and sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more cloth, thread and a sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Jose Geronimo

texts.es:
José, reside en San Carlos departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, él está dedicado a la compra y venta de ganado, también cultivo de maíz.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una vaca y pagar el alquiler del terreno donde cultivara este año, esta ayuda será muy importante para José, ya que tanto como su familia dependen del trabajo que realiza.
Su objetivo es tener una fuente de ingreso para dar a su familia y darle lo necesario.
texts.en:
José lives in San Carlos, in the department of Morazán, and his business is farming and ranching. He lives with his wife and children. He works buying and selling cattle, and he also grows corn.

He is requesting a loan to buy a cow and also to pay the rent for the land he will farm this year. This help will be very important for José, since both he and his family depend on the work he does. 

His goal is to have a source of income to give himself and his family what they need.

loans.use: to buy a cow and pay the rent for the land where he will grow corn.

loans.name: Los Amigos De Siempre Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Los Amigos D. Siempre”, esta ubicado en la zona D. Tahuantinsuyo, distrito D. Independencia, es una alcancía que trabaja con EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad desD. hace cuatro meses, esta conformado por 8 socios, asume el cargo D. secretaria la señora Ana María P. D. 50 años D. edad, casada, con 1 hijo D. 13 años D. edad, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. productos D. necesidad en su bodega llamada “GUILLE” desD. hace 10 años, negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, debido a que su madre se va D. viaje y deseaba cerrarlo es que doña Ana María da inicio a este negocio; su mayor anhelo es comprar una fotocopiadora y aperturar un pequeño bazar, el préstamo solicitado será invertido en la compra D. mercadería.
 Los socios están muy contentos y valoran el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a la devolución  del préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The “Los Amigos D. Siempre” [Friends Forever] community bank is located in the Tahuantinsuyo area, district of Independencia. It is a community bank that has worked with EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad for four months. It is maD. up of 8 members. Ana María P. is the secretary. She is 50 years old, married and has one 13 year old son. At present, she has worked selling basic necessity products in her store called “GUILLE” for 10 years. The business is located in her home since her mother was about to travel and wanted to close it and Ana María took the business over. Her greatest wish is to buy a photocopier and open a small variety store. The loan she has asked for will be invested in buying merchandise.

The members are very happy and value the support offered to them. They are committed to paying back the loan according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan sells beans, simsim (sesame) and maize. She is 26 years old, married and has 1 child. Susan is asking a loan to stock more beans, simsim and maize to sell. She hopes to open a shop in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more beans, simsim (sesame) and maize to sell.

loans.name: Luzmila Rufina

texts.es:
Luzmila de 59 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en la Perimetral. Esta casada. Ella tiene una ferretería.

Cuando su esposo salio de su ultimo trabajo recibió una liquidación con la cual pusieron esta actividad y trabajen juntos. En su ferretería vende cables a $2,18 dependiendo de las medidas, tubos a $5,10. labora con su esposo desde las 8H30 am a 18H00 pm diariamente. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea invertir en mas materiales como materiales eléctricos y tubos para sus respectivas ventas y surtir mas el negocio. En un futuro desea abrir otro local y ademas terminar de adecuar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 59 years old. She lives on the Perimetral (ring road) on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She is married and has a hardware store.

When her husband left his last job, he received a settlement that they used to start up this business, and they work together. In the hardware store, they sell cables for $2.18, or by measurement,  and pipes for $5.10. She works with her husband from 8:30 am to 6:00 pm every day. With the help of the loan, she wants to invest in more materials, such as electrical items and pipes, to sell and to stock the business better. In the future, she wants to open another location and in, addition, finish fixing up their house.

loans.use: to buy electrical materials and pipes for her hardware store.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Vision 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Zoraida is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres con Vision 3 & 4 (Women with Vision). Her story is not unlike others in her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican community, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti.

Zoraida's group is located in Puerto Plata, a city on the north coast. She makes her home here in a simple setting, with two of her three children and her long term partner, also their father. She said to us that her most difficult challenge is that she has a very rebellious child, and she need to deal with this. Everyday she pray to the Lord for him. In the meantime she enjoys to cook.

Zoraida is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling silver jewelry and clothes. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry and clothes.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 42 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming vegetables and rice in the Philippines. Nelia is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. 

Nelia has been farming vegetables and rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream – to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Roselline

texts.en: Roselline is a hard working 30-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with three children who are going to school. She provides for her family by selling green groceries. She wants, in the next five years, to have opened up another shop and her dream is to see her business grow. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ignacia Candelaria

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Ignacia tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tiene tres hijos los mismos que  estudian en escuela y colegio. El marido se dedica a la albañilería.

Ella tiene una pequeña granja donde cría chanchos y gallinas criollas, nos cuenta  que  compra los chanchos cuando están pequeños, luego los cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses y luego cuando tengan un peso adecuado los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su localidad a comprar estos animalitos para llevarlos a los mercados de otras ciudades cercanas, trabaja todos los días unas tres a cuatro horas en el cuidado y alimentación de sus animalitos, sus hijos le ayudan en su labor.

Va a utilizar este crédito para comprar alimento y medicinas para su mejor desarrollo. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque siempre con los créditos ella puede financiarse hasta vender sus animalitos.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in the La Sequita parish, which belongs to the Montecristi cantón, which is a prosperous cantón of Manabí. It is known as the birthplace of the “Old Fighter”, Eloy Alfaro. It is also famous for the straw hats that are well-known in and outside the country.

This is where we meet Ignacia, who is 35 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has three children, all of whom are studying in primary school and high school. Her husband works in masonry.

She has a small farm where she raises pigs and chickens. She tells us that she buys the pigs when they are small, then she raises them for three or four months. When they reach an adequate weight, she sells them to buyers to come to her town to buy these animals and take them to the markets in nearby towns. She works three or four hours each day in caring for and feeding her animals. Her children help her in her work.

She will use the loan to buy feed and medicines so her animals will grow better. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because with the loans she can finance herself until she sells her animals. 

Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her animals.

loans.name: San Miguel (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Miguel, está formado por 8 mujeres quienes son vecinas, amigas y viven en una misma comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, muchos también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes trabajos, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Son personas muy amables como nuestras socias que son mujeres amables y carismáticas y siempre tienen una sonrisa para regalar.

Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Señora. Mariana vive por un sector aledaño de la parroquia del Valle, es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años.
 
Tiene 30 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 12, 3 años  y su último hijo de 4 meses de edad, su primera hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil y también es ebanista, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad siendo el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal.

Doña Mariana se dedica al cuidado de sus hijas que aun son muy pequeñas y como pasa en casa se dedica a la cría de cerdos y pollos a los que los vende en su propia comunidad.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra pollos y  alimento para los mismos. 

Su meta es  terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta acabados.
texts.en:
The community bank San Miguel is comprised of 8 women who are neighbors and friends and live in the community which is part of the Del Valle parish. The parish has a cold climate. The people work in commerce, raising animals, and agriculture, and many also work at different jobs in the city. The people maintain their culture and their traditions. They are very nice people like these community bank members who are friendly and charismatic and always have a smile to give. 
One of the group members is Mariana. Mariana lives in the area next to the Del Valle parish and has been a member of the community bank for 7 years.
She is 30 years old, married, and has 3 children who are 12 years old, 3 years old, and the youngest is 4 moths old. Her oldest daughter is studying at the high school in the city. Her husband works as a bricklayer and is also a cabinetmaker. The house that they live in belongs to them and is the product of their joint work.
Mariana works caring for her daughters who are still very small and, while she is at home, she also raises pigs and chickens which she sells in the community. 
She will use her new loan to buy chickens and chicken feed.
Her goal is to finish building their house as it still lacks the finishes.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Bebelita

texts.en:
Bebelita is 50 years old and single. 

Bebelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store. 

Bebelita has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from video rentals. 

Bebelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico greatly enjoys life with his wife and child. An optimistic person hoping to someday provide a better living standard for his family, he plants and harvests rice to sell to village traders, usually earning a yield amounting to P16,000 twice year.

Federico is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy seeds and pesticides to prepare his farmland to produce an abundant harvest next season. In the future, he would like to achieve a better yield to save for any emergencies that might arise.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios got married at the age of 15. She is now 49 years old and happy with her husband and four children. Of her children, one is in the third year at college and the rest already have their own families. 

Remedios has engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store and meat vending for three years. At present, Remedios has temporarily stopped her meat-vending business because she has insufficient capital to continue this business. She spends her capital from the business for the education of her children. 

Remedios is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional goods to sell like eggs, beans, cooking oil and drinks for her sari-sari store. She hopes to earn a higher income and be able to continue her meat-vending business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
У Раисы двое взрослых детей: Александр и Наталья. Они живут в городе Мелитополе. Раиса торгует мужской одеждой на привокзальном рынке. Она занимается этим видом торговли уже 12 лет. На данный момент ее оборот составляет 9 000 гривен, а прибыль составляет 3 000 гривен.  

Раисе необходим кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар к осенне-зимнему сезону. За счет полученной прибыли она надеется дальше развивать свой бизнес и улучшать благосостояние семьи, а также закончить начатый ремонт в квартире.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Raisa has two grown children: Aleksandr and Natalya.  They live in the town of Melitopol.  Raisa sells men's and women's clothing at the market by a train station.  She has been involved in the retail business for 12 years.  Currently, her revolving capital amounts to 9 000 hryvnia, and profit amounts to 3 000 hryvnia.  Raisa needs a loan in the sum of 10 000 hryvnia in order to purchase merchandise for the autumn-winter season.  She hopes to use the resulting profit to further develop her business and improve her family's welfare, and also finish ongoing repairs in her apartment.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the autumn-winter season

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 48 years old and widowed with 1 child. Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Lilia has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as detergents, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 44 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Renato plants three hectares of rice fields in the Philippines. He has been a farmer for 28 years. He earns approximately PHP 100,000 per crop, but he only bring home half of that because after selling the products, he has to pay his obligations to the the traders from the private sector who lend money with high interest rates to small farmers from villages.

Renato dreams of improving his family's standard of living. He wants to borrow a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizers, seeds, and herbicides for rice farming. He hopes the loan will be a big help for him. This loan will allow him to not get a loan again from the traders. Instead of paying high interest rates to the traders, he will spend the money on food and education for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and herbicides for rice farming.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria vive en su natal Baranoa: Municipio del departamento del Atlántico que tiene un origen indígena, en un asentamiento de tribus arawak-caribes a orillas del actual Arroyo Grande y está ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Barraquilla.
En este municipio caracterizado por la festividades del Carnaval del Recuero y sus creatividad en las artesanías, Martha  tiene un taller de confecciones, donde elabora prendas  de vestir especialmente en tela Jean, en las líneas femenina e infantil; esta actividad la desarrolla  junto a su esposo y en temporada alta requiere mano de obra adicional;  la microempresa es su única fuente de ingresos, su clientela está situada  en la ciudad de Barranquilla y en algunos municipios del departamento del Atlántico,  donde venden sus productos por unidad y por docena; su clientela define las prendas de vestir que fabrican en el negocio de Maria como de excelencia y por eso mantienen sus relaciones comerciales de manera dinámica. Sus ventas mensuales le generan un buen margen de rentabilidad, lo que le  permite cubrir los  gastos del hogar, sus activos fijos son adecuados para el funcionamiento de su empresa.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su credikiva, comprará, materias primas e insumos para fabricar muchos productos encargados, pues se acerca una temporada de un gran impulso en las ventas, como lo es el mes de Diciembre y Enero y con su credikiva estaría lista para cumplirle a su creciente clientela
texts.en:
María lives in her native Baranoa, a municipality in Atlántico department, which was originally an indigenous settlement of Arawak-Caribe tribes on the banks of the present Arroyo Grande river. It is located 30 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. In this municipality, known for its Carnival del Recuero festivities and the creativity of its artisans, Martha has a dress-making workshop, where she makes women's and children's clothing, especially with denim. 

She carries out this work with her husband, and in the high season, she needs additional staff. This small business is her only source of income. Her clientele live in the city of Barranquilla and in a few municipalities in Atlantico department, where she sells her products by the unit and by the dozen. Her clientele describe the clothing that Maria makes as "excellent", and that's why her customer base keeps growing.

Her monthly sales generate a good profit margin for her, which allows her to cover her household expenses. Her fixed assets are adequate for the operation of her business.

Currently, she is applying for her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use her Credikiva loan to buy raw materials and supplies for making many special-order products, as the peak sales season (the months of December and January), is approaching. With her Credikiva loan she will be ready to satisfy her growing clientele.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies for making many special-ordered products

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 41 years old, married and a father of 5 children living in Hoima, Uganda. 

For 11 years he has been in the carpentry business. He started by being employed by someone but later on saved enough to start his own workshop. Now Jackson faces a challenge of late payments by his clients after his work is completed. He wishes to have a big showroom in the future. Jackson needs a loan to buy timber.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Ivannia

texts.es:
Ivannia
Puntarenas
500000
	Ivannia tiene un bazar Librería en la zona de Puntarenas, a pesar de lo cercano de la ciudad ella vive en un lugar de bastante pobreza y donde el comercio existente  es poco, le provee a los habitantes del lugar de servicios como fax, venta de cuadernos y accesorios para estudiantes así como regalos y juguetes para niños. El objetivo de este crédito es invertir en juguetes y productos para la época de navidad ya que las ventas se incrementan en esta época, al mismo tiempo se va a adquirir  ropa.
	Su día inicia a las 7 de la mañana ya que los niños que van para la escuela pasan a comprar varias cosas que van a necesitar  en su día o hacer fotocopias que es otro de los servicios que brinda. Al mismo tiempo en las tardes regresan  buscando materiales para realizar sus tareas por que el negocio pasa ocupado todo el día. Ella atiende también a su hija que estudia en la escuela de la localidad y a su compañero que se dedica a la  venta de mariscos.
	Entre sus metas destaca crecer con su tienda y ser una de de las mejores de la zona, por esto se empeña cada día en atender eficientemente a sus clientes, además su familia le brinda un gran apoyo  por esto desea superarse cada día más. 
	Su negocio ha caminado muy bien, ya tiene cerca de 3 años de trabajar en este, por lo que el principal problema  es la falta de dinero para trabajar, pero con la oportunidad brindada por Fundación Mujer con este préstamo se va a mejorar mucho la capacidad del negocio.
texts.en:
Ivannia has a general store in Puntarenas.  Despite its proximity to the city, she lives in an area of considerable poverty where there is little existing commerce.  Ivannia provides the local people with fax services and sells notebooks and supplies for students as well as gifts and toys for children.  The purpose of this loan is to purchase toys and items for the Christmas season since sales increase during this period.  She is also going to buy clothing.

She begins her day at seven in the morning as the children stop on their way to school to buy various things that they need for the day or to make photocopies, another service that she provides.  In the afternoon, the children return looking for materials to do their homework.  So, her business is busy all day.  She also takes care of her daughter, who attends the local school and her partner, who sells seafood.  Among her goals, she highlights growing her store and being one of the best in the area.  For this reason, she strives every day to serve her customers efficiently.  In addition, her family gives her a great deal of support and this motivates her to succeed more each day.  
She has been working on her business for nearly three years and it has been going very well. Her main problem is lack of working capital; however, with the support of this loan offered by Fundación Mujer, she will improve business capacity.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the Christmas and New Year’s season with the goal of increasing sales and responding to customer requests.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 21-year-old married man. He has been working as a butcher for nine years. Omar was only 12 years old when he started working. Because of his parents' bad financial situation, he had to be a productive contributor to the family's income.

Omar opened his own butcher shop in 2006. He is ambitious and a hard worker who has struggled to improve his standard of living. He also has a beautiful family, which he plans to expand after developing his business to ensure that his children won't face the same miserable childhood he had.

Omar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new updated and improved models of the machines his business requires. He will also try to perform some necessary maintenance on his shop.

loans.use: to buy machinery for his business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: El señor Wilson tiene como actividad el alquiler de servicio de amplificación,  esta actividad la realiza los fines de semana o cuando tiene contratos esta  actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para el y su familia ya que esta compuesta por su esposa y sus tres hijos de 15, 10 que se encuentran estudiando y una pequeña de 1 años, la esposa también ayuda en los gastos del  hogar con pequeñas ventas de temporada de distintos productos, el destino del crédito es para la compra de juego de luces para aumentar el equipo que posee , logrando de  esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y poder consolidarse en su actividad, ya que por estas fechas tiene mucho trabajo, el Sr. Wilson es joven y trabajador con muchos deseos de superación quiere brindarles a su hijas un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilson runs an amplifier hire business which he conducts on weekends and when he has a specific contract.  This is the main source of income for his family which is comprised of his wife and three children, ages 15 and 10, in school,  and a one-year old.  His wife also helps with the household expenses by selling different seasonal products.  

The loan will be used to buy lighting to add to the equipment he has, with an aim toward increasing income and consolidating his business.  There is much work at this time of year.  Mr. Wilson is young and hard-working, and determined to get ahead so he can provide a better future for his children.

loans.use: To buy lighting for his amplifier hire service.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past year, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her son. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to stay in the business and improve it. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Agnes's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save her money.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Santos Pablo

texts.es:
Santos Pablo es una persona muy trabajadora de 27 años de edad, casado con tres hijos de 2, 3 y 5 años de edad, vive en Manatapa  Intibucá.
Santos desde pequeño ha trabajado la agricultura junto a su padre, actualmente tiene sus propios cultivos, desde hace diez años produce papa, maíz y frijoles. La zona es apta para estos cultivos. Tiene más de una manzana cultivada y la producción la vende en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicito es para invertir en compra de semilla de papa y abonos, con esto él espera ampliar su nivel de producción y obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en: Santos Pablo is a very hardworking 27-year-old.  He’s married and has three children who are 2, 3 and 5 years old.  He lives in Manatapa, Intibucá.  Since childhood, Santos has worked in farming alongside his father.  Currently, he has his own fields and has been growing potatoes, corn and beans for the last ten years.  The zone is appropriate for those types of crops.  He has more than a manzana [Central American unit of land measure] under cultivation and he sells his crops in the local market.  The loan he requested is to buy potato seeds and manure that he hopes to use to expand his production level and obtain more profits.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and manure.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.  Nuru also takes care of her elderly parents.  She lives in a home that she own with access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.  Nuru has a retail pharmacy shop, a business that she has been involved in for 10 years.  She works 7 days a week. Nuru also generates additional income through selling piped water.  Her main business challenges include defaulters, thieves and seasonality.  

Nuru requested a 1,500,000 UGX loan from Kiva partner Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy additional boxes of syrup and drugs to sell.  Her business aspirations are to own a fully stocked pharmacy shop and build rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy additional boxes of syrup and drugs to sell at her pharmacy shop.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 42 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 4 and 19 years, they all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been farming for the past 5 years. With the loan from kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvested beans. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested beans.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en: Samnang is a 19-year-old orphan and a freshman who is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in electricity engineering in the city. He lives with his sister and a brother in law in from the Kandal Province in Cambodia. His sister works in a factory and his brother in law is a motorcycle mechanic .Samnang is lacking the finances to pay his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, so he would like to request a loan. With the loan, he will be able to earn the bachelor’s degree successfully with skills to build his future. For his plans after graduation, Samnang hopes to work in a company with a decent salary, so he will be able to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Patricia Winnie

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Golden Crown group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Patricia does her printing business in her residential house. This enables her to look after her two children and husband who is ill. Due to high demand she has an idea of starting a small workshop in the nearby trading centre.

In year 2002 she joined a women self help group where she got a loan of Usd 139 for a period of 6 months earned a profit of Usd 70 which she ploughed back to the business. She was given a 2nd loan of Usd 277 for a period of 10 months, purchased printing materials and earned a profit of Usd 208. She got a 3rd loan of Usd 139 for a period of 8 months, this was not enough for the business but due to her illing husband she feared that the business would go down.

Patriciaâ€™s business is doing well and she is able to repay loans extended to her and take care of her family when her husband has asthma attacks.

Given a loan of Usd 425 she will be able to expand her business and acquire a stall in the nearby trading centre.

loans.use: To purchase paints and T- shirts

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
My name is Francisca H., and I sell new women's, men's, and children's cloting. My business is 3 years old. My clients are very good because I sell high-quality products at a good price. I want to sell a lot and with the earnings be able to make improvements to my house and also provide food for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre Francisca H. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva para dama, caballero y ninos, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que vendo producto de calidad y lo mejor es que lo vendo a un buen precio, deseo vender y con las ganancias que obtenga poderle hacer mejoras a mi casa de habitacion asi mismo alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's, and children's clothing

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda started working at the market 6 years ago. She is married and has three children. She started with men’s underwear and socks. Over time, she expanded her business and now sells men’s clothes. Her goods are mainly brought from Kyrgystan. She considers the spring and end of summer to be the best time for her business. She gets the most profit from sales during this time. Mavluda also noticed that men today spend more money for their clothes than they did several years ago. She likes her job as she likes the interaction with people.  Summers are very hot in Tajikistan, and that’s why she wants to buy a large number of T-shirts to sell during the next couple of months.

loans.use: Purchase of men’s t-shirts

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Muhayo started her business over 6 years ago. She is renting space in an open-air market of Khujand. She is married and has children. She lives with her parents-in-law. They are pensioners so she is responsible for them.

The turnover of Muhayo's business is fast. She started receiving loans 5 years ago. Step by step, she has increased the loan amount from 100 USD to 1000 USD. Her father helps in her business. He sells fruits like apples, plums, cherries and strawberries. She sells vegetables like tomatoes, cucumbers. Farmers from close districts supply Muhayo with vegetables and fruits on a wholesale basis at cheaper price.

Muhayo wants an additional 1000 USD to expand the business together with her father.

loans.use: Increasing the turnover of products

loans.name: Luigui

texts.es:
Business Description

Luigui started his business a year ago, and he sells clothes such as pants, shirts and underwear. He does this everyday from 9am – 6pm.

Loan Use

Luigui needs a loan in order to buy more and newer clothes so that he can offer more variety to his clients.

Personal Information

Luigui is 20 years old and he is single. He lives with his parents and he sells his wares walking around the neighborhood where they live. He hopes to grow and improve along with his business so that he can offer more support to his family and their household.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Luigui inicio su negocio hace 1año. Los productos que vende son: Prendas de vestir como pantalones, blusas, conjuntos e interiores. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 9am-a -6pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Luigui necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de más y nuevos modelos de ropa. De esta manera ofrecer nueva variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Luigui tiene 20años. Es soltero. Vive con sus padres. Sus ventas la realiza de manera ambulante recorriendo varios sectores cerca de su hogar. Aspira mejorar y crecer junto con su negocio. Para de esta manera lograr brindar una mejor ayuda a su hogar y a sus padres.

loans.use: To invest in new styles of clothes/Invertir en nuevos modelos de ropa

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin A. is 26 years old. He is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Agdam region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. Right now he lives with his family in Sumgayit, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.

He started his business in 2001, when he purchased a small variety of handbags. The work is interesting, but the salary is not enough to cover all of his family expenses.

In 2005, Elchin borrowed US$ 400 to add to his own savings of $250 and purchased different sorts of handbags for women. Since January 2006, prices have doubled. It has hurt Elchin’s business, too. He wants to overcome this obstacle.

He needs a $700 loan in order to further develop his business, to buy other handbags and expand the size of his shop to increase his business and to improve his family’s living conditions with this additional income.

loans.use: To buy handbags and expand the size of his shop to increase his business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María is a loving mother who works diligently every day selling a wide variety of candies, cookies and sodas. She travels around to market her products using a cart that she outfitted for this purpose. She has labored at this endeavor for five years, an activity she conducts with great optimism and happiness given that it allows her to meet her living expenses. The wish of this enterprising mother is to offer her products at wholesale, an effort she feels will bring her increased financial benefits with which to improve the standard of living of her 85-year old mother, Petronila, and most importantly, provide continued education for her 21-year old son James. María asks for a loan to help her reach her goal, and is thankful for your assistance toward her cause.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

María, es una amorosa madre que diligentemente trabaja a diario vendiendo gran variedad de golosinas, galletes y gaseosas en forma ambulatoria en una pequeña movilidad que acondicionó para dicho trabajo, esta labor a la que se dedica hace cinco años la esta llenando de optimismo y alegría, debido a que le permite apaciguar satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su hogar.El deseo de esta emprendedora madre es ofrecer sus productos al por mayor, negocio con el que ella cree que obtendrá mayores beneficios económicos, para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su querida y anciana madre Petronila de 85 años y sobre todo estudios superiores a su hijo James de 21 años de edad. En esta oportunidad María solicita un préstamo que le permitirá cumplir con su propósito y agradece gentilmente tu disposición de colaborar con su causa.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise (candy, etc.) to offer at wholesale and increase earnings for the benefit of the family.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa Isabel belongs to the "La Amistad" communal bank and lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Moyabamba. Her home and business are located in the same house and she sell grocieries.

With a loan from Manuel Ramos she increased her start-up capital and with subsequent loans she received was able to increase her investment in the business in accordance with her customers' demands.

With another loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy rice, sugar (in sacks), milk, eggs and other products such as sweets, which are requested daily by her customers.

Rosa Isabel is 58, she is separated from her husband and lives with her older daughter, who is a great support. She is a joyful woman, creative and very enterprising. Her next project for the short term is to be able to have a poultry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito D. Moyabamba, su domicilio y negocio están ubicados en su propia casa y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes al por menor.

Con el apoyo del préstamo D. Manuela Ramos ha aumentado su capital inicial D. su negocio y así como el primero los demás préstamos que recibió le sirven para ir incrementando el capital del negocio D. acuerdo a la demanda D. sus clientes.

Con el préstamo, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar (en sacos), leche en cajas, huevos en javas y otros productos como golosinas, las cuales diariamente son solicitados por sus clientes.

La señora Rosa Isabel tiene 58 años, está separada D. su esposo, vive con su hija mayor quien es su gran apoyo. Es una mujer con mucha alegría, creatividad y muy emprendedora, su próximo proyecto en el corto plazo es poder tener una pollería.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, milk, eggs, etc.)

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es:
Julia Mercedes is a single mother with two children still living at home. She sells sandals, slippers, children’s clothing and wrapping paper in the “Station” market in the state of Leon. She began selling these type of items 21 years ago as a street vendor. Since then, due to the fatigue associated with selling in the streets under the hot sun, she decided to apply for her own space within the market. When she obtained a stall within the market, she was faced with the new need to fully stock the fixed location.

Through the years and the help she received from Ceprodel, she has been able to more fully stock her store and obtain better returns than before she instituted her business inside the market. It is necessary to emphasize that up till now Julia has received 29 small loans, all of which she has paid on time and in full.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Julia Mercedes es madre soltera y con dos hijos a su responsabilidad. Tiene ubicado su negocio de venta de sandalias, chinelas, ropa de niño y papeles de regalo en el mercado la Estación del departamento de León. Su actividad comienza hace 21 años cuando vendía ambulante estos productos por las calles de León. Sin embargo, debido a la fatiga de vender en las calles por la exposición al sol, decide solicitar su propio puesto en el interior del mercado. Al obtener el puesto se le presenta una nueva necesidad que es el surtir de productos su negocio ya que con lo que vendía ambulante era muy poco para surtir su negocio en su nuevo local.

A través de los años y con la ayuda que le ha brindado Ceprodel ha logrado surtir mas su negocio obteniendo mejores utilidades en comparación a las que percibía antes de tener su local. Es necesario destacar que hasta este momento la señora Julia ha realizado un total de 29 créditos pagados satisfactoriamente en tiempo y forma.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (sandals, slippers, and children's clothing).

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en:
M. Erkin is 22 years old. Unmarried, Erkin is supporting his parents.

For the last three years Erkin has been involved in baking the national bread called “lepeshka”. Erkin is a rather hard-working young man. He runs his own bakery and dreams of generating the sufficient income to marry.  Erkin plans to have a spacious and convenient shop for baking the “lepeshka”. He would like to purchase more flour and coal for his business. At the same time he needs to repair the current bakery. He requests a $600.00 US dollar loan for the term of 12 months. This is Erink's first loan and he promises to be accurate and prompt in loan repayment and thanks all for their support.

loans.use: To buy flour and coal and repair the bakery.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam rents a place on the Ave of Buenos Aires in the district of Cota in the city of La Paz. Previously, she used to sell peanut products but that did not go well. Then, she decided to sell something different. Now, she sells CDs, which has improved her income. The loan she seeks is to increase the amount of capital, which is to buy more CDs and stabilize her business. Her credit history is very good and qualifies her for a new loan. She has been a client since July 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

La señora Miriam vive en alquiler en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de Cota de la ciudad de La Paz; anteriormente su actividad era la venta de maní pero no le fue muy bien entonces decidió cambiar de actividad ahora se dedica a la venta de CD negocio con el cual mejoro sus ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más CDS y estabilizar su negocio. Su antecedente histórico es muy bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Ella es cliente nuestra desde Julio de 2007.

loans.use: to buy CD's

loans.name: Danijela

texts.en:
Danijela was born in 1978. She is married and she lives with her husband with their two children in the town of Lukavac. One child goes to the primary school. Her husband has a full-time job and he works in a forwarding firm. His monthly salary is 2,000 KM.

This is Danijela's first loan at the MCO WWI in the amount of 1,200 KM. Danijela will use this loan to buy chicken, because her wish is to breed poultry and to use her free time in a good way.

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda belongs to the Las Laboriosas Community Bank 2, located in la Calle Caballo Cocha 127, in the Calleria District in Ucayali, Peru. She is a 24 year-old mother of 2 children. Her husband is a mechanic. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to start selling beauty products.

Now she continues her business, and in the mornings she tidies her house, prepares food, and takes her kids to school. In the afternoon, she sells her products at other households.

With this loan of $300, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy cologne, perfume, lipstick, powder, jewelry, nail polish, mascara, etc.

Lucinda is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving women the opportunity to start their own businesses, and to move forward for their well-being and the well-being of the ones they love the most.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lucinda pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Laboriosas 2, ubicado en la Calle Caballo Cocha 127, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es mecánico, es así que Lucinda con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

En la actualidad continua con sus negocio, para ellos por las mañanas asea su casa, prepara su comida y lleva a sus hijas a su escuela, por la tardes se dedica a ofrecer sus productos a domicilio y a la vez cobra los créditos que deja a sus clientas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: colonias, perfumes, labiales, sombras, talcos, joyas, esmaltes, rimel, etc.

Lucinda esta agradecida a Manuela Ramos por que da oportunidad a las mujeres de poner su propio negocio y salir adelante para el bien de nosotras y las personas que mas quieren.

loans.use: Merchandise for sale

loans.name: Hamidan

texts.en:
Hamidan baji, wife of M. Ramzan, lives in Kasur, Pakistan, a city that is famous for its sweatmeat. Hamidan baji is a housewife. She also embroiders decorative dresses, scarves, and shirts; a God-given skill. She tries to work on her skill and improve the quality of her products. She has been doing this work for the last 5 years. Now she considers it to be her profession. She needs a loan to fulfill the orders of her customers.

NOTE: "Baji" (elder sister) is an Urdu term of respect for women.

loans.use: To expand her embroidery business

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Fotima A. is a resident of Qurgan-Tube city. She has a big family. She is married and has four children. She has a specialized-middle school education and was trained to be a nurse. She works as a nurse in a polyclinic. In addition, in her free time, she sells vegetables and has a stall in the city market. She brings products from small villages, buying directly from the farmers and selling at a reasonable price. She would like to take out a loan to increase her commodity turnover. She plans to pay back her loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Ашурматова Фотима Шарифбоевна жительница города Курган-тюбе.имеет средне-специальное образование. По специальности медсестра. Работает медсестрой в поликлинике . Кроме того в свободное время занимается торговлей овощами. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города. Привозит товар из кишлаков , скупая у дехкан. Продает по более выгодной цене. Сейчас хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.У Фотимы большая семья. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: Increase commodity turnover

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 45 years old and married. She has been a cow keeper since 1995. Every day she works from 6 AM to 6 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Mwajuma now hopes for a loan to improve her business by adding the number of her cows and buying enough food for them.

loans.use: To increase her stock by cows

loans.name: Seamseng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seamseng C., 48, and her husband, Mr. Ngoun-ee Kry, 46, live in a small village across the Mekong River and about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1980 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of their children are married; one of them lives outside the family home and one is a silk weaver living in the family home. The other two children study at the local school.

Mrs. Seamseng has been a silk weaver since 2002, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been growing rice and vegetables since 1980 and has been a chef for six years as well.

Seamseng is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Gulovsha

texts.en:
Gulovsha I. is 36 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of three children. Her husband is unemployed.

About eight years ago, her family faced mounting financial problems, so she decided to become a cattlewoman. Specifically, Gulovsha buys calves at the market at a low price, feeds them, and then re-sells them at the same market at a higher price to generate profits. Her husband also works with her in this business. Gulovsha works extremely hard in order to make the business successful and to generate a sufficient amount of income for the family.

Now, Gulovsha is planning to purchase additional calves to raise and thereafter to sell for a profit. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting 1200 USD. This is the first loan she has requested, but Gulovsha asserts that she will not be delinquent in any way and will promptly repay the loan according to its terms.

loans.use: to purchase four calves

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
K. Zafar is 27 years old. He is married with two kids. Zafar is a market vendor selling men’s jeans, shirts, shoes and other clothes in the local market of Dushanbe city. Over five years of working at the market Zafar already has enough experience to do his work successfully and has clients who always come to him. Zafar is trying to satisfy the needs of clients with various tastes and income levels. Zafar’s kids are small now but already today he is working hard in order to give them a good education and to make them happy.

Today Zafar is planning to increase his working capital in order to purchase new goods for selling. For this purpose he requests 4000 Somoni (US$1200) for the term of 9 nine months. Zafar promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all for supporting him.

Your generosity can change his live and the life of his family. Be an important part of the growth of Zafar’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing additional inventory for selling.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 20 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su madre. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas en la escuela primaria del Distrito de Cabana un pequeño pueblito el cual es muy acogedor. A Vilma le gusta su trabajo, ya que sus clientes son los niños de la escuela, los cuales en al hora del recreo adquieren las golosinas que ella vende. El negocio es muy bueno, por ello desea expandir, hace 6 años trabajó vendiendo en la tienda de su hermana, pero hace 3 años se independizó, poniendo su propio negocio con el cual quiere forjarse un mejor futuro. Vilma se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor variedad de golosinas para poder satisfacer las necesidades de los niños a los cuales quiere ver feliz.
texts.en:
Vilma is 20 years old, single and lives with her mother. She sells candy and snacks in the elementary school of the Cabana District, a small, friendly village. Vilma enjoys her work since her customers are school children who purchase her goods during recess. Her business is going well and she would like to expand. Six years ago, she worked selling in her sister's general store, but three years ago she was able to start her own business in order to work for a better future. This is Vilma's first loan from Prisma Microfinance and will use the money to purchase a greater variety of candy and snacks to satisfy the needs of the school children who she enjoys making happy.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the variety and amount of snacks/candy she sells

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is a 54 year old widow who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon with her child. She has been working as a vegetable seller for forty years. She sells fresh vegetables, eggs, lettuce, mint and lavender. Houda has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise, more specifically vegetables and eggs. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time.
When Houda first started her business, she faced a lack of knowledge of sales. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Houda decided to do this business because she was a widow and had to make her living. In the future, she plans to increase her productivity.

loans.use: Houda needs the loan to purchase merchandise, more specifically vegetables and eggs.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn N. lives in Preak Traeng Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Nal Phun, are fruit sellers. Because their business is going well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Chanthorn N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan. 

She is 32 years old and the mother of three children. Two of her children are enrolled in the local school. The youngest child is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Del Barrio Kennedy Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of 17 women who work in the Kennedy neighborhood of the city of Caacupé.  It is currently in its 10th cycle of the Women Entrepreneurs program at Fundación Paraguaya.  Most of the women work selling goods in small stores and kiosks, selling cold drinks, selling clothing, making chipas, and cutting hair.  The 17 women are maintaining a line of credit with an average of 923,000 Guaranís ($185.00) per member of the group.  

With the loans they receive from Fundación Paraguaya, the women invest in the purchase of the products they need to keep their businesses well-stocked: ingredients for chipas, sugar, cookies, beef, oil, and men’s and women’s clothing. 

These days the group is also attending activities on the weekends, such as food fairs and raffles, with the goal of capitalizing its savings so that the savings can support members at times when they cannot make good on their payments for some reason.  

The representative of the group and the president thank and acknowledge all the supporters of Fundación Paraguaya for the support and training that they provide.

loans.use: Supplies for the various businesses, such as milk and sugar, and men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia A. is a fish vendor. She is  not only to selling fresh fish in the market but also markets dried fish which became her business since 2007. "When I started my business, I was afraid because I might have gotten myself into a wrong decision", she said. "But, I was wrong, my business has helped me earn more for my family and able me to send my children to school", she added. Marcia is 34 years old already. She wants to grow more her business by putting up a small stall where she could display her fish to sell.

She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. The more display she could have in her stall in the wet market, all the more profit she will get. Her loan will truly help her expand her business.

CEVI is providing her the credit assistance that she needs. She also enjoys free trainings and insurance coverage after she joined the CEVI credit program.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is the son of A. G.. He now lives in district 8th of Kabul, Afghanistan. During the war, Abdullah and his family migrated to Pakistan and subsequently, they returned to Kabul and settled in their own house which had been destroyed during the war. They have tried hard to live in that house in a way because they did not have enough money to repair it well.

Abdullah was informed by one of his friends about the lending process, so he came to AFS and requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for the term of 10 months to repair his house and solve his problems.

loans.use: buying construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Victor Enrique

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua el señor Victor R. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de pollo el cual posee desde hace 16 años siendo este ingreso el único con el cual mantiene a su familia compuesta por su esposa y por sus dos hijos.

Actualmente la razón por la que el señor R. ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere de un crédito para la compra del pollo para así ofrecerlo en su localidad y continuar mejorando su situación económica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua, Mr. Victor R. dedicates himself to his business of selling chicken. He has worked in this business for 16 years and it has been the only source of income to support his family which consists of his wife and two children. Now, he is coming to Ceprodel to ask for credit so that he can buy chicken to sell at the market, thereby continuing to improve the economic conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicken

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose P. is 58 years old and works as a farmer in their small village. He resides in the rural area of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. He has been a widower for sixteen years. He is blessed with two children; Mario, 37 years old and already married, and Rudelyn, 32 years old, a high school graduate, and now a widower also. Jose lives with his son Mario, and they help each other in maintaining their rice farm for their survival.

Jose P. plants rice and corn in his farm. But he doesn’t have enough capital to maintain his farm, especially for buying seeds and fertilizer. Thus, he is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP12,000 because he believes that it will help him in his agriculture business. He is already planning to buy inputs needed for planting like fertilizer, seeds and other miscellaneous. Jose P. is working hard for his children, and also his grandchildren. He helps support them in their studies. Jose believes that through his sacrifices and patience, he will be able to attain all his dreams in life. .

loans.use: buying inputs for his farm

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is an industrious entrepreneur living with her family in a rural community located at Barangay Pieza Villaverde, Nueva Vicaya. Married to Benjamin G., she is a mother of six children. Two of her six children have already finished college, while four are still studying in high school and elementary. Angelita stresses that “patience is the key to success.” This principle keeps her focused on maintaining and growing her business. Moreover, it has guided her through hardships and difficulties in life. 

She is a vegetable vendor with a small stall in her village. She patiently maintains her business to earn an income and finance the studies of her children. Her husband cultivates their farm where they plant rice and vegetables. Angelita is hoping to borrow a loan from lenders amounting to PHP5,000 for her vending business. She hopes to increase the volume of her sales to generate a higher income and help all her children finish their studies in college.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Victoria Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Victoria H. tiene 33 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos que cursan la primaria, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, su esposo trabaja como odontólogo por cuenta propia, el negocio de doña Victoria es la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos que inicio hace trece años, con ahorro y solo vendiendo cosméticos. Con este préstamo va invertir en la compra de perfumes y cosmético para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos. Es te es su noveno crédito y da las gracias Afodenic por que le ha permitido mantenerse en el negocio y ha podido sobresalir adelante en su vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria H. is 33, married, and has two children who attend elementary school. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. Her husband is a dentist who works for himself. Victoria has been selling clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. She started thirteen years ago with savings and only selling cosmetics. With this loan she will buy perfumes and cosmetics to offer her customers a variety of products. This is her ninth loan, and she thanks Afodenic for allowing her to stay in her business. She has been able to be get ahead and be successful in her family life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Meta

texts.en:
Meta G. is 38 years old, single, and lives at Maribojoc, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. The family lend a hand in farming, specifically in corn production which is their primary activity.

Meta G. has been a member of Paglaum MPC since April 2005. Now she is applying for Php 10,000.00 to buy farm fertilizers and pesticides. She has many plans for the future - to have a family, to build a simple house and be able to save money for the future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her corn

loans.name: Torcuata

texts.en:
Torcuata S. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 58 years old, married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Torcuata owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Torcuata is just starting this business.

In 2008, Torcuata joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Torcuata has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Torcuata is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo sells foodstuffs. She has been in the business for the past 20 years. Iyabo has been with LAPO for the past two years and it is during this period of time that her business has really taken off. 
Iyabo is 50 years old and married with five children. She lives in Lagos. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is forty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, one son and four daughters. All are still in school. She works very hard to help her husband to be able to provide for the family.

Gladys lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew on the street in her community in the mornings. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. Gladys has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace C. is 35 years old and married to a businessman. She has two school-aged children. Grace has a business selling food items and is requesting a loan to open a shop. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.
