BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia tiene 54 años, es una mujer muy cumplida y comprometida con el desarrollo de su familia, vive en su casa propia y su mayor anhelo es que sus hijas logren sus metas como profesionales. La venta de helados es el trabajo al que se dedica, lo realiza con el apoyo de su hijo mayor, quien trasporta la mercadería desde el centro de la ciudad hasta la casa de su madre, donde tiene cuatro congeladoras y refrigeradoras, conservando los helados para luego distribuirlos en los mercados y tiendas de su localidad. Su gran habilidad de socialización y la alegría de Otilia le han ayudado a ganar clientes, resultándole muy rentable su negocio, más aún cuando vende en los cafetines de los centros de estudio, donde hay mayor concurrencia de personas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es degustar los deliciosos  sabores de helado que vende, siendo éste su postre favorito. Es por ello que más de 15 años viene realizando esta actividad y considera que la parte más difícil es trasladar su mercadería, ya que cuenta con una sola movilidad y requiere de otra para agilizar su trabajo. Para el futuro desea elaborar sus propios helados y dejar de comprarlos en la ciudad, por tanto tendrá que prepararse y capacitarse para ello.
Este es su catorceavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, por tanto sabe que su puntualidad y cumplimiento de sus pagos son indispensables para el desarrollo de su banco comunal. Otilia necesita la cantidad de mil quinientos soles para comprar una congeladora, para que con ella pueda aumentar su mercadería y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, que en su mayoría se encuentran en los centros educativos.
texts.en:
Otilia is 54 years old and is dedicated and devoted to her family. She lives in her own home and her greatest wish is that her daughters reach their goals in their chosen professions. Her sells ice cream treats with the help of her oldest son, who brings the items from the city center to his mother's home, where she has four freezers and refrigerators. She then distributes the items to local stores. Her cheerfulness and ability to socialize have helped Otilia win new customers, making her business very successful, more so when she sells her items in school cafeterias, where there are more people. What she likes most about her job is that she is able to taste all the delicious flavors of ice cream that she sells. This is her favorite dessert. She has been doing this for fifteen years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting the merchandise, as she only has one means of transportation and she needs another in order to speed up her work. In the future she would like to be able to manufacture her own ice cream treats and not have to buy them in the city. She needs to prepare for this. This is her fourteenth loan through "Microfinanzas PRISMA" and she knows that on-time payments are vital to the development and success of a communal bank. Otilia needs "1,500 PEN" ($525 US) in order to buy a freezer so that she can increase her inventories in order to satisfy her customers' demands, most of which are from schools.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.en:
Maria Paz is a mother of two children who are both presently studying in high school. Maria Paz is 36 years old, managing her own business of retailing goods in her general store within her community. She has been in this business seven years. Her business serves her by providing her children's allowance in school. Her greatest dream is to successfully send her children through school to finish their studies. 

Her husband is busy with his farming activities. Their net income in their yields is exactly enough for their children's allowances and their other school enrollment fees. But their income is really insufficient; they need an extra source of income to fully support their children's allowances, for them not to experience some difficulty in providing for the needs of their children. She is asking to borrow the amount of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders for additional capital to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Amanda Paulina

texts.es: Amanda tiene 20 años, vive en casa de los padres de su pareja con su niña de 3 años de edad. Amanda hace 2 años se inicio en el negocio de la venta de ropa y calzados, capital prestado por su padres de ella, en las temporadas navideñas incursiona en la venta de juguetes la cual le genera ingresos adicionales a su hogar. Amanda realiza las ventas de su mercadería como recorredora (personas que ofrecen la mercadería en el domicilio de las personas), a los cuales les brinda un trato muy calido y agradable motivo por el cual ha ido incrementándose su clientela, los cuales le realizan mayores pedidos de ropa, calzados y otros accesorios, la mayoría de sus clientes son de la misma zona donde ella vive, solicita el crédito para la compra de la mercadería que ofrecerá en la temporada navideña. Amanda no culmino la secundaria por diversos motivos, el sueño de Amanda es culminar con sus estudios, contar con una casa propia y poder tener su propio negocio el cual le generara mayores ingresos los cuales les permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Amanda is 20 years old. She lives in her partner’s parents’ house with their 3 year-old daughter. Two years ago, Amanda started a business selling clothing and shoes with capital lent to her by her parents. During the Christmas season she also sells toys, which generates additional income for her household. Amanda makes her sales as a door-to-door sales person (she sells merchandise to people in their homes). She is friendly and agreeable toward her customers, so she has been gaining clients who make larger orders of clothing, shoes, and other accessories. The majority of her customers are from the same neighborhood where she lives. She is requesting a loan so she can buy the merchandise that she offers during the Christmas season. Amanda did not finish high school for a variety of reasons. Amanda’s dream is to finish her studies, have her own house, and to have her own business that will generate greater income, which would allow her to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toys for the upcoming Christmas season

loans.name: Claudea

texts.en:
Mrs. Claudea S. is a 46-year-old woman who is currently living at Lumbayao, Aloran, with her lived-in partner. She is an old member of PMPC and she is already on her 7th regular loan.

Claudea is requesting a Php 5,000 loan to be used as additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store. Her husband’s income is not enough for their daily living so she needs to operate her business well to increase their income. She wishes to see her family succeed in their chosen field of business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es: Marta Elena P. Hernández, de 46 años. Junto a ella vive su compañero de vida, quien también es comerciante y una hija de 13 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando. Marta Elena, cuenta con un puesto en un mercado municipal cercano a su residencia, en éste distribuye todo estilo de zapato y sandalia para dama, de cuero e imitación de cuero. Ella cuenta con varios años de dedicarse a está actividad y necesita adquirir nuevos estilos ya que se acercan las graduaciones y época navideña en la que es muy demanda por sus clientes y no quiere quedarles mal, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando crédito para comprar mas producto.-
texts.en:
Marta Elena P. Hernández is 46 years old. She lives with her life partner, who is a merchant, and her 13 year old daughter who is a student. She has a vending post at the municipal market near her home where she offers all types of women’s shoes and sandals, both in genuine and artificial leather. Marta has been in business for several years, but she needs to acquire new styles because graduations and the Christmas season are approaching. Demand from her customers is much higher during this time and she does not want to disappoint them. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Berlie

texts.en: Berlie T. has a strong faith and is devoted for her dreams. She is a 34-year-old, a mother who cares of two children, both are students. Her husband, Jojit, is a fisherman. To lend a hand supporting the family Berlie has engaged in the fishing business, which is a common business on the island. She has applied for this loan in order to buy a variety of raw materials for her business, such as nets, rope, rolls of bamboo, bamboo sticks, and payment for labors, etc. In the future Berlie’s hopes to create a small stall in the market from which they can take orders of fish for consumers. She also wants to be able to save for her children's education to finish their degrees and find better jobs. She also desires to have a comfortable house for living and a happy family to live with. She would also like to have a successful business to help other people in their community.

loans.use: To buy materials such as nets rope, rolls of bamboo, bamboo sticks and payment for labor,etc.

loans.name: Murodali

texts.en:
K. Murodali is 51 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Murodali has a middle special education. His specialization is engineering. But he went over to agro-business because the salary was small. And with that small salary he has to feed his family and pay for his children’s education. 

Murodali works hard to cultivate his produce and also to raise cattle. He works from early morning till late at night hoping to have a rich harvest. Murodali sells his crops at the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural produce even more and expand his cattle breeding business. Today Murodali is requesting a loan of 4500 Somoni to buy greater quantities of seeds and fertilizer. Let's help Murodali as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan A. has raised animals since he was young. He is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children. Elshan has been in this business for over 20 years. Early every morning he goes to the various grazing fields near where he lives to feed his stock and take them to rivers or nearby lagoons so they can drink water. This takes him all day (until sunset), and he returns home tired from the constant daytime sun and the terrible cold during the afternoon. But he likes his work. Elshan knows he must feed and care for his animals very well. He would like to invest in the purchase of cattle so he can increase the stock of cattle he takes to the market to sell. Elshan is counting on your help. With your support, he can improve his family's life.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Alejandra es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Huayllapampa, Alejandra tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además venD. comida en el mismo lugar.
Alejandra necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Alejandra son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the Violeta Communal Bank. She is 37 years old, married with 2 children, and lives in the Huayllapampa community. She has a store in her home where every day she sells groceries, such as vegetables and meats, as well as meals. Alejandra needs a loan of 1,200 soles to purchase rice and sugar. Her dream is to improve her business so that her children can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Nida is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Nida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino tiene 29 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el Anexo Los Valdera del caserío Santa Isabel, zona rural que pertenece al distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de animales. Cría aves de corral y ovejas en la parte posterior de su vivienda para luego ofrecérselas en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde vive. Esta actividad le provee ingresos permanentes, y también se genera ingresos adicionales trabajando en una orquesta conformada por habitantes de la zona.

Marcelino desea ampliar su negocio de venta de animales con la compra de ovejas y aves de corral para su posterior engorde y venta. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Allternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Marcelino es un padre de familia alegre, dinámico y bastante responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para brindarle a su familia la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcelino, 29, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Santa Isabel's Anexo Los Valdera, a rural zone that is part of Mórrope district, which is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He raises small farm animals for sale. He raises barnyard fown and sheep in his back yard and then offers them for sale to the various merchants that frequent the area on a regular basis. This activity provides a permanent source of income. However, he also earns extra income playing in an orchestra made up of residents of the area. Marcelino wants to enlarge his operation buying sheep and baryard fowl to raise and sell. He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for his first, 1500 new sol, loan to reach his goal. Marcelino is a cheerful, dynamic and quite responsible father. His greatest wish is to continue to work to provide his family with the oportunity to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and barnyard fowl.

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Julia Chaca es socia del banco comunal El Arenal,  vive en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por sus hermosas Iglesias, su Centro Histórico y pro su gente que es muy calida y amable, nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha concebido dos hijos que se encuentran de 10 y 9 años de edad y estudian en la escuela Fe y Alegría, su esposo cuenta con un taller propio de tapicería, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Julia se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa  y también ayuda a su esposo  en el taller hace doce años trabajan conjuntamente para sacar adelante a su familia y su negocio,  su horario es de  lunes a sábado hasta el medio día.

Se encuentra dos años trabajando con los prestamos realizados en la fundación,  con éstos ha comprado materiales para su taller, su ingreso al bankito fue gracias a una amiga quien la invito a que forme parte de este grupo de mujeres que buscan un mejor bienestar para sus familias, con su nuevo crédito  va a seguir comprando materiales como  esponja, clavos, madera, etc. y seguir incrementando su negocio.

Su sueño es poder llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia Chaca is a member of the communal bank El Arenal, and she lives in the center of Cuenca city. This city is known for its beautiful churches in its historical center and for its warm and friendly people. She is 33 years old, married, and she has two children, aged 10 and 9 respectively, who both study in the school Fe y Alegría. Her husband owns his own weaving workshop, but they do not have their own home and instead rent. Julia is responsible for the housework and she has also been helping her husband in his workshop for twelve years – they work together to help their family and the business prosper. She works Monday through Saturday until noon. She has been receiving loans from the foundation for two years, and with these loans she has bought primary materials for the workshop. She joined this communal bank because a friend invited her to join this group of women who are all seeking a better quality of life for their families. With this new loan, she will continue to buy materials like sponges, nails, wood, etc. to continue to expand her business. Her dream is to one day have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sponges, nails, wood, etc.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es: Don Silverio tiene la edad de 57 años, durante muchos años se ha dedicado a trabajar en su propio negocio, que es la venta de granos básicos, y la venta de queso. Todos estos productos los compra al norte del país en donde viaja dos veces ala semana para poder comprar favorable y vender a mejor precio en la capital. Cuando inicio lo hizo con poco capital, el cual aumento sus venta con los financiamientos que la institución ha dado. También con las ganancias ha podido mejorar su pequeña casa que es un gran logro para su familia, que junto con su esposa se han esforzado ya que ella se dedica ala venta de tortilla. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de frijoles,  queso, para seguir con la demanda de sus clientes, así como la obtención de clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
. Silverio, 57, has had his own business for several years: he sells basic grains and cheese. He travels to the north of the country, where prices are better, twice a week to buy his products; he then sells them at a better price in the capital. When he started out, he had little capital, which gradually increased thanks to sales profits and loans from the institution. His profits have also allowed him to improve conditions of his small house, something that has been a great accomplishment for his family (his wife, too, works selling tortillas). He will use the funds to buy beans and cheese to meet customer demand as well as to attract new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans and cheese.

loans.name: Kucup Mekar Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut P. (0) is a 49-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali.  Ni Ketut is the group leader of an 18-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Kucup Mekar (MUK-0021).


Ni Ketut is married and has two adult children.  To making a living, Ni Ketut owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Ketut joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK of 1,300,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Ni Ketut from MUK.  Ni Ketut plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Ketut P. (0) merupakan 49 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 18 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Kucup Mekar (MUK-0021).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Ketut sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Ketut meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,300,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth B., from the town of Surallah, is 47 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, for the past 10 years she has been planting and harvesting rice for sale, earning approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lilibeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure, she plans to use any additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Leinda Ole Mairoi

texts.en:
Leinda Ole Mairoi K. is 26 years old. He is married to Normeshuki K. and he is a father of two school-going children. 

Leinda is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to plant more wheat, which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for wheat produce.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and have his own farm machinery.

Leinda is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To plant ten more acres of wheat.

loans.name: Rigia

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con la socia Regia, tiene 30 años,  es casada, tiene dos hijos (Fernando de años 09 y Lía Regina de un año y medio) y ellos viven en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco. Regia se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía en el centro de textil tradicional chicheros, ella va a este centro de trabajo tres veces a la semana desde las 8 de la mañana a hasta las 4:30 de la tarde. Ya son siete años que lleva este oficio, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito surtirá su negocio y va comprar más materiales como por ejemplo de lana alpaca y artesanía de tipo de muñequería. El anhelo del  socio es producir más mantas.
texts.en:
When we visited the Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank, we spoke with a member named Rigia. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children (Fernando, who is 9, and Lía Regina, who is 18 months). They live in the city of Chinchero in the department of Cusco. Rigia works making traditional crafts in the Chicheros center for traditional textiles. She works there three days a week from 8 in the morning until 4:30 in the afternoon. She was been working at this job for 7 years, and working with the Kiva field partner has allowed her to get ahead and helped her business grow. With the new loan she will expand to sell more items and will buy more materials, such as alpaca wool and materials to make dolls. She hopes to be able to produce more shawls to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of items such as alpaca wool and dollmaking materials

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena P. is from the village of Sicayab, Dipolog City. She is 38 years old, separated and has 2 school-aged children. Ma. Elena owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including shrimp and anchovies in the local community. Ma. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Ma. Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Elena  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Ma. Elena is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Ma. Elena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Esmatullah

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Esmatullah son of G. J.. He lives in Shewah district. He is 26 years old, married and has four children who are in school. He has been busy in agriculture for more than six years. Currently his land is not fertile, so he wants to take an individual loan to purchase high quality wheat seeds and mineral fertilizer to increase his products, to support his family members and make bright his children's future. 

He would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders for their effective loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To purchase high quality wheat seeds

loans.name: Grace Achieng’

texts.en:
Grace Achieng’ O. defected from being just a housewife and started hawking clothes in 1984 to generate income and be self-reliant. Shortly after that, her husband passed away, leaving her as the sole breadwinner taking care of eight children. 

Joining KMET as a community health worker, Grace enrolled in the microfinance program, where she has been able to learn more about business management. She wishes to get a loan worth 50,000 Kenyan shillings that will be used to add more stock to boost her business. Her dream is to expand her business.

She lives in Manyatta.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El Sr Sabino N. Fernández es casado, tiene 3 hijos uno de 10, 7 y de 5 años, vive en zona rural Comunidad Huancuni de Colomi provincia Chapare Cochabamba.

El Sr. Sabino se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca, papaliza, tuberculos que se cultivan en esa zona, que después de la cosecha lleva a vender en la feria semanal de Colomi, Es así que logra percibir un ingreso económico anual para mantener a su familia además tiene 3 cabezas de ganado vacuno que lo utiliza en las faenas agrícolas así para economizar sus ingresos, El Sr. Sabino trabaja solo con su esposa la Sra. Sayda Galarza.

El Sr. Sabino se apersono a la oficina para solicitar un crédito, para compra de semilla de papa, haba y productos agroquímicos, aprovechar que es época de poder comprar a precios accesibles porque le sobro parcelas preparadas, de este modo sembrar en más superficies y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para el siguiente año que biene.
texts.en:
Sr. Sabino N. F. is married and has 3 children who are 10, 7 and 5 years old. He lives in a rural area of the Bolivian province of Chapare Cochabamba. Sr. Sabino is a farmer. He grows potatoes, beans, oca and other crops that are common here. He sells his crop at a market in nearby Colomi and the income from the sales is how he supports his family. He also has 3 head of cattle that he uses on the farm. His wife, Sra. Sayda Galarza, is his only helper. Sr. Sabino approached the bank to apply for a loan that he will use to buy seeds and agrochemicals for the farm. He wants to make the most of the season because seed prices are relatively low. He has some land that has been prepared for planting so he'll be able to grow more crops and improve his income in the coming year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Guido Efrain

texts.es:
Guido de 46 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, el tiene una pequeña papelería y fotocopiadora. 
El tuvo que dejar su trabajo para poder estar mas tiempo con sus hijos, pero como no tenia ingresos suficientes invirtió sus ahorros en papelería para vender a sus vecinos, poco a poco con esfuerzo obtuvo su local, ahora trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.    

Para surtir mas su tienda el quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería y cuadernos. En el futuro quiere aumentar su negocio y tener un almacén.
texts.en:
Guido is 46 years old and lives in an urban zone in a suburb of Guayaquil. He has a small office supply store and photocopier. He had to leave his job to be able to spend more time with his children, but since he did not earn enough money he invested his savings in office supplies to sell them to his neighbors. Bit by bit and with effort he got his own store. Now he works from 7:00 am until 10:00 pm every day. With the loan he wants to buy paper and notebooks to stock his store. In the future he wants to expand his business and have a department store.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, paper

loans.name: Teresita Gay

texts.en:
Teresita Gay S. is from the village of Siare. She is 50 years old. Teresita Gay is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita Gay owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Teresita Gay has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita Gay joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita Gay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita Gay is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Teresita Gay from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vaen

texts.en: Mrs. Vaen M. is a grocery and soup seller in Prey Melong Khang Tboung village in Takeo province. She was born in 1983 and is a widow with three children: two attend school while the small one is only five years old. She is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Since her business is going well from time-to-time, she would like to expand. Mrs. Vaen M. is seeking a loan to buy more groceries. With the rest of the loan, she will buy more beef to make soup to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice K. sells secondhand clothes at Abura. She has two children. Her husband is a policeman. She assists her husband to take care of her family. She has a junior high level of education. Her loan will be used to buy more secondhand clothes to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.	

In front of her are some few used clothings on display.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bernard Gitimu

texts.en:
Bernard is 32 years old and married to Jane Nyaguthii. He has a horticulture farm. He sells his products to distributors in the area. He has been in the business for a period of about one year. 

He intends to buy  fertilizers and fungicides for his crops. He has never been in another MFI (microfinance institution) and this is his third loan after repaying the previous ones successfully. He hopes to have his children get through school and to buy land to start dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fungicides

loans.name: Trần
loans.use: To purchase bamboo materials

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a resident of a historic city of Lahore in Pakistan. She lives there in a 2 room brick house with her family in the area named Shalimar. She moved there 20 years ago. Razia is a widow with a son and a daughter. Her son does embroidery and she supports him in her spare time by doing embroidery work. Her daughter is eighteen years old and studies in the 10th grade. Razia herself operates a glass selling business. She sells glass to different glass shops on order. The glass is used to make windows and tables. She has been in this business for the past five years. Her earnings allows her to pay for the utilities expenses of her family.  

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her glass selling business. With the loan, she will buy glass to fulfill the orders of her clients and increase the profits. Razia is hopeful that an increased profit will help her to collect dowry for her daughter's marriage and she will be able to marry her after she completes her education.  

Razia is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself  a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Razia.

loans.use: To buy glass for a glass selling business

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is 40 years old and married with six children between one and 19. All of her children, except the youngest, are currently in school. Matilda’s husband is a motor vehicle mechanic.

For the past 14 years, Matilda has been operating a business selling various food items. She will use her loan to purchase more food items to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, Matilda plans to refurbish her house.  In the future, she would like to establish a mini-supermarket.

loans.use: to buy food items

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: La señora Georgina T. Cruz, es originaria de la localidad llamada San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, un lugar hermoso donde sus aguas son conocidas como termales o aguas de azufre. Doña Georgina tiene 33 años de edad, terminó la secundaria y ya no siguió estudiando por que sus padres no tenían el dinero suficiente para apoyarla con los gastos de la escuela, también dice que en su localidad en ese entonces no había preparatoria y que tenían que trasladarse a otra comunidad para estudiar y salían muy caros los pasajes. La señora Georgina esta pidiendo un crédito para invertir en una tienda que tiene dentro de la telésecundaria de su localidad, ella tiene con ese negocio 6 meses con lo que le prestarán ella comprara dulces, ingredientes para comida como masa, carne de pollo, carne de res, lechuga, jitomate, y muchos ingredientes mas, también comprara jugos, refrescos, galletas, etc. Ella esta casada con el señor Mauro el trabaja en la central de abastos en la ciudad de México como cargador, ellos tienen dos hijos de nombres Adriana de 11 años de edad estudiante de primaria y Luís Ángel de 5 años de edad el cual estudia el jardín de niños. Comenta que la meta que tiene es tener otro negocio de venta de colchas, sabanas por catálogo y tener un negocio estable en su casa.
texts.en:
Georgina T. Cruz is from a place called San José Purua, which is located in the state of Michoacán.  It's a beautiful place known for its hot springs and sulfur baths.  Georgina is 33 years old, and she has a middle school education.  She did not continue with her education because her parents did not have enough money to support her with the school expenses.  Also, in those days there was no high school in her area.  You had to travel to another community to attend a high school, and the trips were very expensive.

Georgina is requesting a loan to invest in a store that she has in the distance learning by television site in her area.  She has had the business for six months.  She will use the loan to buy sweets and ingredients to prepare food.  She will buy ingredients like dough, chicken, beef, lettuce, tomatoes, and many more.  She will also buy juice, soft drinks, and cookies, etc.

She is married to Mauro, who works as a loader in the supply center in the city of Mexico.  They have two children.  Adriana is 11 years old, and she is in elementary school.  Luís Ángel is five years old, and he attends kindergarten.  Her goals are to have another business selling bedspreads and sheets by catalog and to have a stable business in her house.

loans.use: To invest in food and drinks for an educational cooperative

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith O. is from the village of Pines. She is 44 years old. Edith is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Edith owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food in the local community. Edith has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. Edith is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Edith from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Rama B..  She is married and has one child, aged 10.  In 2010, she established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Rama plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. 

Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 
BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Josephine Gatogo

texts.en:
Josephine has practised mixed farming in Olkalou town for the last five years.  She is 33 years old, married to Joseph Maina Mwaniki, and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She has repaid both her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow, fertilier and maize seeds for planting.

In future, Josephine hopes to build rental houses so as to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow, fertilizer and maize seeds

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 53 años, es una madre de familia responsable y muy activa. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Marcos, y sus 3 hijos de los siete que son en total. Desde ha 10 años Elizabeth, se dedica a la venta de productos perecibles, en su bodega situado en el primer ambiente de su casa. Asimismo vende productos de belleza mucho más antes que su bodega,  y le va bien en ambas actividades, por lo que se siente motivada de seguir trabajando. Le gusta dedicarle todo su tiempo a sus negocios, ya que gracias a sus utilidades ayudo cubrir  la educación de sus hijos mayores, que hoy son profesionales y, solo le falta educar a los tres últimos. Es por ello,  que esta emprendedora madre de familia trabaja con mucha responsabilidad, y sabe que cuenta con la ayuda de ustedes y; eso es su mayor seguridad, por  lo que esta convencida de continuar construyendo su segundo piso de su casa y brindar la educación superior a todos sus hijos. Es su segundo crédito individual que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Elizabeth, cada fin de semana invierte en mercadería comestibles para su negocio, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará arroz, fideos y aceites al por mayor. Asimismo, cemento y arena para terminar con la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 53, is a responsible, very active mother.  She lives in her own house in the company of her husband, Marcos, and three of their seven children.  For the last 10 years Elizabeth has sold perishables in her grocery store located at home.  She has also sold beauty products from even before her grocery store.  She does well in both activities so feels very motivated to continue working.  She likes dedicating all her time to her businesses because thanks to the profits from them she was able to pay for her older children’s education, who are now professionals; she only still has the last three to go.  Because of this, this enterprising mother works with much responsibility and knows that she can count on your support and that’s her greatest security.  She is, therefore, convinced that she can continue building a second story on her house and provide higher education to all her children.

This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to pay all her installments on time because she does not want to disappoint all the people who made the loan possible that will allow her to stay in business seeking progress.

Elizabeth invests in food items weekly for her business so will use the requested loan to buy rice, noodles and oil at wholesale.  She will also buy cement and sand to finish building her house.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store as well as cement and sand to finish building her house.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo C. is from the village of Gango, Ozamiz City. He is 44 years old. Arturo is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Arturo owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling "buko" juice in the market. Arturo has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arturo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arturo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Arturo is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Arturo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pol R. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. 

R. raises chickens to sell, earning an income of US $1 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of US $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $40 on food and US $30 on the other necessary expenses. 

R. is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. 

In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos de limón y maracuyá el cual asiste diariamente y cosecha semanalmente, también cría aves de corral pavos y gallinas los cuales engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local, Estas actividades la realizan desde hace más de 5 años en la parte posterior de su casa. 

Rosa desea comprar de abonos para sus cultivos.  Por ello ha creido conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 49 years old, married common-law, and she has 2 children. She lives together with her family in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is an agricultural zone located in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque. 

She dedicates her time to the care of her lemon and maracuya fruit plantations. She takes care of them every day and she harvests the fruits weekly. She also raises foul, including turkeys and poultry. She fattens them to later sell them at the local market.  She has had these businesses for the past 5 years, installed in the back part of her house.

Rosa wishes to purchase fertilizers for her plantations. To this end she has requested a loan in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her plantations

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; Este banco está ubicado en la  provincia D. Urubamba y  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa: es casada y tiene 56 años la socia tiene 6 hijos  D. los cuales 3D. ellos son independientes y otros tres tiene 22, 20. 13 años D. edad; la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia compra y venD. maíz seco al por mayor y menor, la socia también se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores tales como chancos, cuyes pollos, también tiene ganados, la socia venD. sus productos a un tercero que los lleva a Arequipa y  Lima, la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. semillas, abono y todo lo referente a la siembra D. maíz para esta nueva etapa D. cosecha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos para la tierra.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en: This borrower is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; in Urubamba, Cusco.  Carmen Rosa is 56, married and has 6 children; three live independently and the others are ages 22, 20 and 13.  She is a vendor, and buys and sells dry corn on both the wholesale and retail markets.  Carmen also raises animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and chickens, as well as cows.  Carmen sells her products to others who market them in Arequipa and Lima; she seeks a loan to buy seed, fertilizer and other products to grow maize.  Carmen is pleased to have the opportunity to access credit and is committed to prompt repayment.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for maize production

loans.name: Hector Urbano

texts.es:
Héctor es padre de 3 niños, tiene 34 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa en una casa ubicada en el distrito de Pitipo, provincia de Ferreñafe. Este lugar se caracteriza por ser un sector agrícola y por estar habitado de gente emprendedora que se identifica con el refrán de la localidad que dice: “Ferreñafe es la ciudad de la doble fe”.

Con más de 6 años  de experiencia en el buen manejo de las tierras, Héctor se dedica  al cultivo del maíz amarillo duro.

Héctor solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles que utilizará para el mantenimiento de 2 hectáreas de maíz amarillo duro, comprando fertilizantes y pesticidas entre otras cosas, para poder tener un mayor rendimiento por hectárea. Esto le permitirá expandir su negocio obteniendo mayores ganancias para el bienestar de sus 3 hijos.

Héctor cuenta con buena reputación en Edpyme Alternativa, pues con anterioridad éste ha tenido tres créditos cancelados con puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Héctor is a 34 year-old father of three.  He lives together with his wife in their home which is located in Pitipo district, in Ferreñafe province.  This is known as an agricultural area which is inhabited by entrepreneurial people who identify with the local saying "Ferreñafe is the city of two faiths".

Héctor has more than six years experience in managing his land well.  He grows hard yellow corn.

Héctor is requesting a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to look after his two hectares of hard yellow corn.  He will buy fertilizers, pesticides and other products so that he can obtain a higher per-hectare yield.  This will allow him to expand his business and make more profits for the well-being of his three children.

Héctor has a good reputation with Edpyme Alternativa as he has had three previous loans which he repaid punctually and responsibly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his land

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en: Jenipher is 40 years old, married, and has six children.  She sells fish to earn a living.  She has been in the business for eleven years.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business.  She also saves her money with Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to have a permanent business premises.  She has requested 20,000 Kes to add to her stock of fish.

loans.use: to add to her stock of fish

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.en: Ana Julia is 32 years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 12.  She owns a small bodega where she sells various snacks, drinks, food, and other household items.  Ana is very thankful for the support she has received via previous loans, as her business has grown substantially.  The loan proceeds will be used to replace inventory and buy additional products for her store.  Her goal is to continue to expand her business and, by doing so, help provide for her family.

loans.use: to replace inventory and buy additional products for her store snacks, drinks, food, candies, cookies

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La Señora Leonarda , curso solo hasta el nivel primario, es madre soltera de 1 hijo al cual apoya y ayuda en su educación, ella es de bajos recursos, su pareja se abandonó y la dejo a su suerte hace más de 2 años desde entonces ella trabaja para mantener a us hijo y darle todas las comodidades posibles, ella cuenta con un puesto de ropa en el mercado 15 de abril de la localidad de Ivirgarzama del departamento de Cochabamba, ella se levanta a muy tempranas horas por las mañanas para preparar el desayuno y almuerzo a su hijo para después mandarlo a su colegio. Es así como la señora trata de superarse con su labor cotidiano.
Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería para su venta de ropa podrá ofrecer más variedad en sus productos y así poder tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Leonarda has only an elementary school level of education.  She is a single mother and has one child who she supports and helps in his education.  Leonarda has limited financial resources.  Her partner abandoned her and left her to her luck more than two years ago.  Since then she has been working to support her son and provide him with all the comforts possible.

Leonarda has a clothes stall in the '15 de abril' market, in the town of Ivirgarzama, in Cochabamba department.  She gets up very early in the morning to get breakfast and lunch ready for her son and then sends him to school.  This is how she tries to better herself through her daily work. 

This is the first time that Leonarda has received a loan from our institution.  She will use it to buy merchandise for her clothes business, so that she can offer a greater variety of products and thereby make more income.

loans.use: to have working capital for her clothes business

loans.name: Kum

texts.en: Mrs. Kum has been spending most of her life in the farming business. She always uses her existing farmland to grow rice and other crops. She is generating an average income of US $1.25. Mrs. Kum’s husband also assists her in the agriculture sector as well. They are blessed with four single children, one of whom is employed as a local garment factory worker. Besides her current work, she often goes around her community using her old motorbike as a vehicle in order to transport many types of old things or secondhand things such as papers, bottles, cans, old wires, and other use goods. After buying, she always brings them to resell to get a little income. Mrs. Kum will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for planting while it rains almost every day.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Toka Chini Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyalalia, leader du groupe d’affaire « Toka Chini »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 36  ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  couturière. En plus, elle aussi vendeuse de friperie pour accroitre ses revenus. Son mari est un cambiste (échangeur, bradeur de monnaie). Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la route Goma-Sake, précisément à Ndosho. Il y a 7 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  7 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  les matériels de couture et 1 ballon de friperies.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter  une nouvelle machine à coudre de broderie.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Toka Chini» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Nyalalia, leader of the "Toka Chini" business group, is a 36-year-old married businesswoman with seven children, all of whom are students. She is a dressmaker. In addition, she also sells second-hand clothing to supplement her income. Her husband is a money-changer. She displays her products along the Goma-Sake route, more specifically at Ndosho. Seven years have passed since she first started this activity. During that time, she has been through seven loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan will serve to obtain sewing supplies and one bale of second-hand clothing. In addition, her dream is to educate her children and buy a new embroidery sewing machine. This client is thankful to Hekima for its actions on behalf of poor women without access to the traditional banking system. It is worth noting that the "Toka Chini" business group is composed primarily of women.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and one bale of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 45 years old, married and residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has three grown children. She owns and operates a sari-sari store at home to earn a living. She generates a monthly income of PHP 8,000 from this activity and has been doing this for five years already. Josephine has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional grocery items to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for three years. She hopes to expand the business and sell hog feed to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for installing a floor.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben, 29, is single and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past two years, Ruben has run a charcoal business. He is often busy and spends a lot of time manufacturing charcoals to be distributed to different locations, mainly in the market place. In a month, he gets PHP 5,000 from his business.
In 2008, Ruben became an official GDMPC member. This answers his need for financial services. In his first loan application he has requested PHP 5,000 from the organization to procure charcoal making materials and continue operating. It's hard and dirty work for some but it provides a good income for Ruben. He hopes that market demand for this product will increase so that he can earn more. He plans to invest some of his future earnings in poultry.

loans.use: To procure charcoal making materials.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita, who is married, works hard to support her family with her enterprise of buying and selling used materials in the Philippines. In this business for five years now, she has requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to send her children to college and to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to sell.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a grocery selling business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a tailoring business which forms her other source income. She faces a major challenge of low income during the rainy season. She dreams of expanding her business and constructing real estate houses in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions and other greengrocery items. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions and other greengrocery items.

loans.name: Man Sid Taaba Yinga Group

texts.fr:
Mme IRENE est la représentante du groupe MAN SID TAABA YINGA. Elle est mariée et mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 05 mois. Un (01) va à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes et habits d’enfants depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionnement au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter (¼) un quart de balle de pagnes et une (01) balle d’habits d’enfants.

Mme épargne ses économies. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité ,ouvrir d’autres points de vente et exporter ses produits.
texts.en:
Irene is the representative of the MAN SID TAABA YINGA group. She is married and the mother of 2 children, who are 19 years old and 5 months old. One of the children goes to school. She is responsible for 3 people. 

For the past 8 years, Irene has been selling "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and children's clothing. She obtains her supplies in the District 10 market. Her customers are both men and women. 

Irene wants to buy a 1/4 bale of "pagnes"  and 1 bale of children's clothing. She saves her money. Her goal is to expand her business, open more sales outlets and export her products.

loans.use: to buy a 1/4 bale of "pagne" cloth and 1 bale of children's clothes.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
This is Sherly, 33, resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Felix, a construction worker, and is a mother to her only child. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Sherly operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She  earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 250 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Sherly hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of having her own house and lot in a prominent subdivision someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Reynante

texts.en:
Reynante is 28 years old .  He is married and has 4 children.  Reynante has a store that sells candies, snack food, juice and other basic products which are primary needs of his customers.  

Reynante is now requesting a loan of PHP 8000 to purchase additional products to sell.  Reynante  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Reynante hopes to improve his business and his family's way of living.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell, like snacks and beverages, candies and more

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Doña reina tiene 36 años de edad, está casada con el señor Juan Medel, quien es campesino, tienen 6 hijos socorro, martín, Maria Guadalupe, Isabel, juanita y ramón, de los cuales todos estudian dos están cursando segundo y tercer año de prepa, una mas segundo año de secundaria, primero y sexto año de primaria y el mas pequeño segundo año de preescolar, ella se dedica a la alfarería desde hacen mas de 18 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, puesto que buscaba la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, aparte de que este negocio genera muy buenas ganancias, también porque quieren continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, el crédito que recibió lo va a utilizar, para comprar mas trastes como son: ollas, vasijas, cantaros, cómales, cazuelas y leña, para así continuar con las ventas.
Ella dice que la meta más importante que tiene y quiere lograr, es la de poner un puesto de sus artesanías y tenerlo muy bien surtido, para empezar a ahorrar y asegurar su futuro junto al de su familia, también por cualquier problema por el que llegaran a enfrentar.   
La señora reina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y Fundación realidad, por todo el apoyo y confianza, que le están brindando.
texts.en: Reyna is 36 years old and married to Juan Medel, who is a farmer. They have six children, Socorro, Martín, Maria Guadalupe, Isabel, Juanita and Ramón, two who are in preparatory school, one in high school, one in sixth grade, one in first grade, and the youngest one is in preschool. Reyna has made a living in pottery for more than 18 years. She says she decided to start this activity looking for a way to support her husband with household expenses, and the business generates very good profits. She also wants to keep supporting her children's education. She is requesting the loan to purchase more utensils like pots, vases, pitchers, griddles, pans and firewood, so she can continue with her sales. She says that her most important goal that she wants to accomplish is to set up a sales post for her crafts and keep it well stocked, so she can start saving and ensure her future along with that of her family and confront any problem that arises. Reyna is very grateful to the Kiva donors and FRAC for all the support and confidence.

loans.use: to purchase pots, vases, pitchers, griddles, pans and firewood.

loans.name: Jose Gabino

texts.es:
El señor Jose tiene 62 años de edad, está casado desde hace varios años con la señora Claudelina, ellos viven en su casa ubicada en la ciudad de Encarnación.
El señor Jose es comerciante desde hace tiempo, tiene un local de venta de prendas para caballeros y artículos varios en el circuito comercial de la ciudad de Encarnación. Se dedica al comercio desde hace más de diez años y tiene mucha clientela en la zona que es un lugar muy concurrido. Gracias a esto el siempre ha podido mantener su hogar, educar a sus hijos, cubrir todos los gastos, y solventar cualquier imprevisto que se pudiera presentar.
El señor ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de prendas intimas y artículos varios, los cuales le servirán para abastecer su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Jose is 62 years old and has been married for several years to Señora Claudelina. They live in their own house located in the city of Encarnación. Señor Jose has been in business for a long time. He has a store selling mens wear and sundries located in the commercial area of the city of Encarnación. He has been doing this work for more than 10 years and has a lot of customers in the area which is a busy one. Thanks to this he has always been able to maintain his home, educate his children, cover all costs and solve any unexpected problems that could arise.

The gentleman has asked for this loan to buy underwear and various items with which to stock his business and meet customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy underwear for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 54-year-old lady who loves children. She has always wanted to have her own business, so she combined between both and started a contract with one of schools in her area to take control of their cafeteria.

In the school’s cafeteria, Siham sells  sandwiches, snacks and drinks. It has been seven years now since she started working at the school and she is already known by the students.

Siham wants to add more and different food items to the cafeteria so the kids won't get bored with what she has, and that’s why she applied for a loan.

loans.use: To add more food types for the school cafeteria.

loans.name: Mulembe Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mulembe Group in Western Kenya! Catherine is the facilitator of the Mulembe group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Catherine takes care of 6 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Catherine had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Catherine was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Catherine  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Catherine will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Mulembe group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: The photograph shows 6 people; 4 women and 2 men, with animals reared.

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es: Jesús de 34 años de edad vive en el municipio de Galapa muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla, él  es propietario de un pequeño almacén y de un taller de bicicletas en este municipio, donde comercializa repuestos, bicicletas y además ofrece servicio de reparación, mantenimientos  y especialmente pintura de bicicletas; él vive con sus padres y su cónyuge,  y con los ingresos provenientes de su negocio, contribuye en gran parte con los gastos familiares. Tiene gran experiencia en esta actividad  y está muy bien ubicado en la plaza del municipio, allí mismo donde hace 11 años trabajó para el dueño de una ferretería.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues desea tener los repuestos e insumos suficientes para responder a la demanda, que usualmente en esta temporada se presenta, pues niños y jóvenes cierran las calles para divertirse sanamente paseando felices en sus bicicletas especialmente y hacer las ciclo rutas del pueblo.  Con sus ventas cubre sus costos operativos y sus gastos familiares quedándole un margen de utilidad suficiente para  cubrir la obligación planeada.  El negocio de Jesús es muy exitosos pues cuenta con una credibilidad popular, producto de su experiencia y de su infraestructura, porque  cuenta con los activos fijos necesarios,  para realizar su trabajo y es la primera vez que asume un crédito.
texts.en:
Jesús, age 34, lives in the municipality of Galapa, very close to the city of Baranquilla. He is the proprietor of a small bicycle store and repair shop in this town. He sells spare parts and bicycles and, in addition, offers repair services, maintenance, and, especially, the painting of bicycles. He lives with his parents and wife and with the income provided from his business contributes to a large part of the family expenses. Jesús has a lot of experience in this business and has a good location in the city’s plaza in the same place where he worked for 11 years for the owner of a hardware store.

Currently he is applying for his first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He wants to use the loan to purchase spare parts and materials sufficient to respond to the demand that usually presents itself in this season, when the streets are closed so that children and young people can safely enjoy themselves by happily riding their bikes, especially on bike routes in the town.

His sales cover his costs and family expenses with enough left over to cover the planned loan obligation. Jesús’ business is very successful since he has a lot of credibility, a product of his experience and facilities. He has the fixed assets necessary to carry out his work. This is the first time he has taken out a loan.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, paint, and material for maintaining bicycles.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old and married to Nicholas. They are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Rose will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Menerva

texts.en:
Menerva is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Menerva owns & operates a business venture, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Menerva has operated this business for 5 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month doing this type of business.

In 2010, Menerva joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es:
