Karla, se dedica a la venta de artesanías, está soltera, no tiene hijos, es independiente de sus padres, ella vende en la afueras de las escuelas de los cantones y pueblos, se dedica a ofrecerles a los alumnos collares, pulseras, juguetes, juegos, calcomanías, para el uso de los jóvenes.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, ya que está por iniciar las clases y es su temporada de venta, con este préstamo estará retomando su negocio y ofreciendo collares, pulseras, aretes, juguetes, juegos, calcomanías, muñecos.
El objetivo de Karla es iniciar un año con el negocio bien surtido, ganándose más clientes, y mejorando sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Karla sells crafts.  She’s single and has no children.  She’s independent from her parents.  She sells outside schools in cantons and towns.  She offers necklaces, bracelets, toys, games and decals to the students for their use.

She is asking for a loan at present to buy merchandise since classes are about to start and this is her season of high sales.  With the loan she will be taking up her business again offering necklaces, bracelets, earrings, toys, games, decals and dolls.

Karla’s objective is to start the year with a good stock, to secure more customers and improve profits.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, bracelets, earrings, toys, games, decals and dolls.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn, 48, is married with seven children residing in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To support the big family, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for twenty-eight years. 
Horn’s group consists of three members who are all female and she is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Djidide Dehou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJIDIDE DEHOU est composé de deux personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Béatrice (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 41 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Béatrice est mariée a un mécanicien du nom de Saliou. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et a leur charge. Béatrice vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de la famille sont supportées par Béatrice et son mari. Pour cette raison, Béatrice vend du charbon de bois et des produits divers à son domicile depuis dix ans. Béatrice s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Béatrice ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du charbon de bois et des produits divers.

loans.name: Aurelia María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito  21 De Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Aurelia, tiene  38 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 21, 18, 16 y 15 años de edad, todos  estudian en Universidad y  colegio.
Aurelia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para poder cubrir  los gastos que genera el hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ella tiene un negocio en su casa, ella vende leche por litros, yogurt y otros productos de consumo, ella junto a su hija también los fines de semana instalan un pequeño local en el cual venden zapatillas, productos Avon y Yanbal  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), lleva más de 8 años con estas ventas la cual le permiten ganar sus ingresos y salir adelante. 
Este crédito es  para comprar productos lácteos, yogurt, leche, zapatillas, perfumes y todo lo que ella vende. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the group known as the "Grupo De Crédito 21 De Julio" meet in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of "los Reales Tamarindos", the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

This place is home to Aurelia who is 38 and divorced. She has four children from the relationship aged 21, 18, 16 and 15, who all study at University and College. Aurelia is a woman that enjoys working so she can pay for household expenses and her children's education. She runs a business from home, selling milk by the litre, yogurt and other food items. She and her daughter set up a small stall at the weekends and sell tennis shoes, Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). For 8 years now Aurelia has been selling this way, allowing her to make an income and get ahead.

This loan is to purchase dairy products, yogurt, milk, tennis shoes and other items that she sells. She has been a member of the "Grupo de Crédito" for 5 years and is very happy because the loans help her get ahead. She dreams that her children may become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, yogurt, milk, tennis shoes, perfume, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and married with two children, one of whom is still in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, noodles, spices, bread and other snack foods.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, noodles, spices, bread and other snack foods

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: I have been making flour tortillas for three years, and I think of myself as a fighter who has been able to earn the patronage of good customers.  My clients are groceries, market stands, and local neighbors in my community.  I know that with the loan, I can increase sales and profits.  I have two children in school, so I am very motivated to succeed in my daily and weekly sales goals.

loans.use: Buy flour.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
My name is Elizabeth. For several years now, I have been selling sweets and bread. I run my business from my centrally-located home. The income I earn allows me to cover family expenses as well as other obligations I have with my suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Elizabeth, cuento con un negocio de venta de golocinas y elaboración de pan de levadura en mi casa de habitación, ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gasto familiares y demas compromisos con los proveedores.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, lard, margarine, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the grocery store and improve his farm so that they can save some money to buy a small home.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This business owner has a small shop to sell fabric in the Kirkuk market. He inherited this shop from his father. He is the only one working in his family. He applied to AL-Aman to get $1200 to buy new goods from another city and sell them in Kirkuk. This entrepreneur is very active. He works 12 hours during the day. He wants to increase his sale average and earn more money.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Rano is 37 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband fixes cars and her children study in school. After Tajikistan’s civil war, factories closed, life became very hard and Rano started making ground meat. She started her business with $30. Rano rented a refrigerator to store the ground meat.

In 2004 Rano received her first loan from MicroInvest. Back then her assets were worth $100. After several loans she started purchasing meat wholesale and purchased a refrigerator. Today her assets have risen to $380. In the future she plans on purchasing a large scale and improving her business location.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Орипова Рано – 37лет. Замужем, мать троих детей. Муж занимается ремонтом автомашины, дети учатся в школе. После гражданской войны в Таджикистане заводы и фабрики закрылись, жить стала очень трудной и Рано начала заниматься изготовлением и реализацией фарша. Начала свою деятельность с 30$. Она арендовала холодильник для хранения фарша. В 2004году получила первый займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест», тогда её активы составляли 100$. После неоднократного получения займа она стала закупать оптом мясо, приобрела холодильник. Сейчас её активы возросли до 380$. В будущем она планирует купить большие весы и улучшить место деятельности.

loans.use: to buy scales and improve activity place

loans.name: Kouao Chaye

texts.en:
Kouao N. Chaye is a fruit and bananas seller at the Treichville market, in the south of Abidjan. She was born in 1971 and lives in cohabitation with an usher. Together they have a baby boy; they live a little far away from the market.

Kouao N. started her business very young. When she was about 11, she used to help her mum at the market after school. She finally loved doing these activities and decided to stop school and set up her own business.

Kouao N. said that it is important for her to be financially autonomous from her common-law husband. She would like to expand her business activity with the loan by purchasing goods in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu C. is a successful business client that has seen her business grow as a result of the loan program.  She started her business five years ago at a very small scale.  Mariatu was a hawker and then she established a small table shop in the open air market.  After 5 loans, Mariatu rented a small shop for the business.  She is a thirty five year old mother of four children who is married to a social worker, whose income is insufficient to meet her family expenses.  Mariatu’s income supplements her family’s income and Matiatu’s husband supports her in managing the business.  She is requesting a $1200 loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Mariatu wants to continue to grow her business now that she has a store front.

loans.name: Belen Group

texts.es:
The Banco Comunal Belen is a young bank that was started one year ago. Currently, there are four cycles and 27 partners. Maritza, Hortensia, Juana, Eulogio and Felicitas are the founding partners of the Banco Comunal. The partners tell us that through the Banco Comunal, they learn how to be punctual, responsible, to save and they say that all the partners are friends and colleagues.

The partners are involved in different businesses such as the sale of food, fruit, shoes, clothes, cereals, and cosmetics, as well as small grocery stores, appliance repair services, and the making of agriculture tools. Each partner has a different history, such as is the case of Hortensia who worked as an employee in a store and, at the same time, traveled to markets bringing clothes to sell. At first, she brought little merchandise, but presently, she has more merchandise and stock and she sells second-hand clothes. Julia also sells second-hand clothes. At first, she had very little merchandise. Now, her business has grown and she has more customers. She also breeds guinea pigs. Julia has noted that one year ago she had six guinea pigs but now she has 58, which she sells to restaurants.

The partners need loans in different amounts. Some amounts are of 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles and 800 soles totaling a loan amount of 12,200 soles to the Banco Comunal. These loans will be invested in the purchase of baby clothes, pants, sweaters, cosmetics, tools, carbon stone, spare parts, transistors, integrated circuits, filters, fabric for ponchos for the Carnival celebrations, apples, bananas, papaya, shoes and products for the start of a small café and rental of premises.

They will use their savings to buy necessities for the home and education for their children. The partners’ dreams are that their businesses grow and are commercially great, to have their own premises and that their children are able to find better jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Belén es un banco joven que se inició hace 1 año. Actualmente tiene 4 ciclos y 27 socias. Maritza, Hortensia, Juana, Eulogio y Felicitas son las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal. Las socias nos cuentan que en el Banco Comunal las socias aprendieron a ser puntuales, responsables, a ahorrar, y dicen que todas las socias son amigas y compañeras. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comida, frutas, calzado, ropa, cereales, cosméticos, abarrotes, servicios D. reparación D. electrodomésticos y fabricación D. herramientas agrícolas. Cada socia tiene una historia diferente como es el caso D. Hortensia que trabajaba en una tienda como empleada y a L. vez viajaba a las ferias llevando ropa para vender. En un inicio llevaba muy poca mercadería, pero en L. actualidad elL. tiene más mercadería y surtida, y además, venD. ropa D. segunda mano. Por otro lado Julia también venD. ropa D. segunda mano. En un inicio tenía muy poca mercadería, ahora su negocio ha crecido y tiene más clientes, además cría cuyes. Julia cuenta que hace 1 año elL. tenía 6 cuyes pero ahora tiene 58 cuyes, que venD. a los recreos y restaurantes. Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, 800 soles, haciendo un total D. 12,200 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. ropa D. bebé, pantalones, chompas, cosméticos, fierros, carbón D. piedra, repuestos, transistores, circuitos integrados, filtros, telas para L. confección D. ponchos para las fiestas D. carnaval, manzanas, plátano, papaya, zapatos, en productos para L. implementación D. un cafetín y en el alquiler D. un local. Los ahorros los utilizarán para comprar algún bien para su hogar y para L. educación D. sus hijos. Los sueños D. las socias es que sus negocios crezcan y sean grandes comerciantes, tener un local propio y que sus hijos sean mejores que ellas con una profesión.

loans.use: The partners need loans in different amounts. Some amounts are of 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles and 800 soles totaling a loan amount of 12,200 soles to the Banco Comunal. These loans will be invested in the purchase of baby clothes, pants, sweaters, cosmetics, tools, carbon stone, spare parts, transistors, integrated circuits, filters, fabric for ponchos for the Carnival celebrations, apples, bananas, papaya, shoes and products for the start of a small café and rental of premises.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: T. Manzura lives in the Nausky region and is married with 3 children. She is engaged in a commercial service and trade. She has her own shop selling Delftware (Delft pottery) that is located in one of the populous districts. Mrs.T. trades with prices that are lower than bazaar prices and she has a wide assortment (vases, vessels, etc.). She has repeat customers and a good business turnover. There are different departments in the shop (clothes department, children and infant wear department, and Delftware department). It permits her to return the taken loans on time and to develop the existing business. Now Mrs. T. requests a loan of $1200 to purchase new goods.

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Magamaga West C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Aisha M.. She is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to purchase poultry feed. Aisha is 38 years old and is married. Her husband has a piggery business. She has 6 children ranging from age 4 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Aisha makes approximately UGX 28000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more poultry feed. Aisha has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy chicken feed and the loan was paid back on time.

Aisha is joined in her small group by Irene B., Irene B., Sylvia M., and Justine K.. Irene B. has a business in tailoring and wants to purchase a sewing machine. Irene B. is currently operating a business in maize milling and wants a loan to increase inventory. Sylvia M. operates a business in maize milling and wants to add to her business. Justine K. is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to buy more birds.

loans.use: To add to poultry business and boost it

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Mr. Yawo A., 33 years old, is married and the father of 5 children. To earn money and to send his children to school, he became a motorcycle-taxi driver. He picks up passengers on his motorcycle, drops them off at their destination, and charges for the trip. He runs his moto-taxi service in the area of Avetonou, a small village located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With his loan, Yawo would like to buy a new motorcycle to improve the quality of his services. This will allow him to respond to the demands of his clients and thus, earn more money to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A. Yawo, âgé de 33 ans, est marié et père de 5 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent et envoyer ses enfants à l’école il est devenu conducteur de taxi – moto. Il fait monter les passagers sur sa moto et les dépose à leur destination et prend les frais de déplacement. Il fait le taxi – moto dans la localité d’Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce crédit , il veut acheter une nouvelle moto pour améliorer la qualité du transport. Ce qui lui permettra de répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et par là dégager plus de profits pour améliorer les conditions de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase a new motorcycle

acheter une nouvelle moto

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo began a business two years ago in order to generate income to support himself since his parents passed away in an accident, leaving him abandoned. He wanted to continue studying, which caused the idea of opening a snack stand to occur to him. This business has actually permitted him to live and continue in school.

Now he is asking for a loan for US $350 that he will repay in 4 months in order to buy merchandise and to have a better variety of products to offer. With your help, Gustavo will continue to proposer!

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Gustavo inicio un negocio hace 2 años para generar ingresos que le permitieran sostenerse a si mismo, ya que sus padres fallecieron en un accidente quedándose desamparado. El deseaba seguir estudiando por lo que se le ocurrió la idea de poner un snack. Actualmente este negocio le ha permitido subsistir y continuar en la escuela.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer. Con tu ayuda Gustavo seguirá prosperando.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Rudi

texts.es:
Rudi belongs to the Mujeres con Futuro communal bank located at Jr. Arenal 1210 in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 25 years old and a mother of two children. Her husband is a welder, but his income is not sufficient to support their family so Rudi took out her first loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles to invest in a small hardware store. Today she manages the hardware store together with her husband. She runs the store out of her home to be close to her two small children who still need her very much, and to also manage her household chores. With this new loan, which will be repaid within 6 months, Rudi will purchase bolts, light bulbs, motor oil, nails, wire, padlocks, paint, etc. Rudi is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to establish her business and work to educate her children.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Rudi pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. Arenal 1210, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años, es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es soldador, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Rudi con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña ferretería. En la actualidad conjunto con su esposo administran su ferretería, como el negocio es en su casa eso le facilita estar a lado de sus pequeños hijos atenderlo por que aun son pequeños y necesitan mucho de ella, y también realiza sus labores domesticas. Con este préstamo de S/.1,100 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: pernos, focos, aceite para motores, clavos, alambres, candados, pinturas, etc. Rudi le da muchas gracias a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de poder poner su negocio y trabajar para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for resale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T., 30 years old, took her husband’s advise to join the TYM Fund in 2003. Her first loan was modest at 500,000 VND. She used the funds to invest in raising pigs. The loan amounts increase gradually as she felt more comfortable with the weekly repayments. She got more pigs and expanded the facility. Besides raising pigs she weaves baskets for extra income. She takes in 3,000,000 VND a month. Her husband is a laborer with an average wage of 1,500,000 a month. They have a school aged child. She is applying for a loan of 9,000,000 VND to invest more into her raising pigs business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Năm 2003 được sự động viên của chồng. Chị Nguyễn Thị T. 30 tuổi đã tham gia vào Quỹ, vòng vốn đầu tiên do chưa quen việc hoàn trả theo tuần nên gia đình chị vay mức vốn thấp 500.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, qua 1 vòng vốn vay gia đình chị đã quen dần với hình thức trả vốn theo tuần nên các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị vay các mức vốn cao hơn vẫn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đã mở rộng và quy mô hơn, những lúc nhàn dỗi gia đình chị làm thêm nghề đan thúng để tăng thu nhập, chị có 1 con đang đi học, chồng chị là người chịu khó hàng ngày anh vẫn đi làm thuê thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn nay gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials and sewing equipment

loans.name: Zuhura's Atoae Ni Mungu Group

texts.en:
Zuhura is 30 years. She is married with two children; they are 12 and 8 years old. She has been a fish and soap seller since 2005. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Zuhura now hopes for a loan to buy more fish and soap for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Chiku and Rukia.

loans.use: To buy more fish and soap for her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.

Nancy es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hija de 4 años, Nancy junto a su esposo tienen un taller de reparaciones eléctricas para carros, su local es alquilado que esta ubicado en una avenida principal, su negocio lo iniciaron hace 1 año, producto de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro, su esposo anteriormente trabajaba como ayudante en un taller y poco a poco fueron implementando su taller. Actualmente Nancy aprovechando la demanda de repuestos, también vende algunos repuestos básicos, productos que compra de proveedores de la misma ciudad.

Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos variados. Los sueños de Nancy son mejorar su negocio, tener casa propia, educar a su hija y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Virgin Mary Community Bank. Nancy is 24 years old, lives with her partner and a 4 years old daughter. Nancy and her partner have an electric repair auto shop. They rent the place which is located in the main avenue. They started their business a year ago with a lot of effort and savings. Her husband previously worked as a helper at a shop and little by little they were able to build their own shop. Presently, there is a demand for spare parts, opportunity that Nancy is using to sell basic spare parts which she buys from suppliers in town.

Nancy needs a 100 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, money that will be invested in buying a variety of spare parts. Nancy's dreams are: to improve her business, own a house, provide an education for her daughter and move ahead.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nancy needs a 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, money that will be invested in buying a variety of spare parts.

loans.name: Yuos

texts.en: Mrs. Yuos M. is a farmer in Chek Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Yuos M. is a 54-year-old widow with two children, one of who is employed in a garment factory while the other one is a farmer. In her plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support her field. With the rest of the money, she would hire laborers to plow her rice field with oxen. She hopes her rice revenue will increase with this new loan.

loans.use: Yuos would like to buy more fertilizers to support her rice field.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.vi: Chị Trương Thị Thuý là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Trước khi tham gia vào quỹ kinh tế gia đình còn nhiều khó khăn, thu nhập của gia đình chủ yếu trông vào  việc đi thu mua phế liệu. Do thiếu vốn nên thu nhập từ thu mua phế liệu chỉ đạt  khoảng 20.000đồng /ngày . Từ khi tham gia vào quỹ nhờ có thêm vốn nên công việc thu mua phế liệu mang lại thu nhập cao hơn nhờ đó kinh tế gia đình chị dần nâng lên. Đến  nay chị đã mua được máy xay sát gạo về để xay sát cho nhân trong xã. Thu nhập hiện nay của gia đình đã đạt 3 triệuđồng/tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 7.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm máy sát gạo.
texts.en:
Ms. T. Thi Thuy has been a member of TYM fund since 2000. Before joining the fund, her family's economic situation was difficult with their main source of income from buying & selling scraps. Due to lack of capital, they were only able to bring in about 1.5 USD per day from this work. Since joining the fund, they were able to borrow additional money to invest in the business, and thus their income has been steadily rising. She was able to purchase a rice grinding machine to mill rice for the local community. Their income now averages 180 USD per month. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 425 USD to buy additional rice grinding machine.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright Udoawujo is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs like palm oil, beans, rice, crayfish and stockfish. She plans to increase her foodstuffs business. Bright is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
This client was a food vendor, but for the past year, she has been selling food, like plantains, and cooking utensils. Akosua K. is 45 years old and is married with five children. Four of the children are independent, releasing her from the burden of their basic needs, but her last born, who lives with her, is in the final year at the junior high school. 

Akosua lives in Agya Baaniikrom, which is a suburb in the western region of Ghana. She treks to the surrounding villages to buy plantains and then transports them to the Volta region, her hometown, to sell them. She says is it a very lucrative business. On her return, she buys cooking sets from Togo, a country that borders Ghana, and sells them to her customers in the community where she lives. 

Her major challenge has been raising adequate funds to improve her business. Akosua is requesting a loan to buy more plantains and kitchen sets to increase her inventory even in the lean season. She belongs to a community trust group called ‘Nyame Nhyira,’ which means "God's Blessing." In this group, members guarantee for one another and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: Akosua wants the loan to buy more plantains and utensils to sell

loans.name: Krin

texts.en: Krin V. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. One child is at home, two are in school, and two others are employed as garment factory workers. Krin makes her living by raising pigs and selling them to the market, and earns around $1.50 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer and contributes his entire income to the household every day. Krin V. hopes to use this loan to expand her livestock by adding more pigs.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Rosas Rojas Group

texts.es:
este grupo se llama Rosas Rojas y esta integrado de la siguiente forma:
Guadalupe del Carmen D.: la actividad principal de ella es el comercio, tiene 11 años y medio de dedicarse a la venta de oro, actividad que realiza de manera ambulante y es notable que durante ese tiempo lo ha sabido administrar, ya que con los ingresos que le ha generado este negocio a apoyado a su esposo a brindarles educacion a sus hijas, las cuales ahora son profesionales, ella es casada y del matrimonio ya solo depende un hijo de la familia, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. 
Marta G. N.: ella tiene 12 años de haber iniciado con su negocio de pulperia, la cual opera bajo el nombre de pulperia Suyapita, en la actualidad ella es madre y padre para sus hijos ya que su compañero de hogar migro a USA en busca de mejores condiciones de vida, tiene 3 hijos los cuales estan cursando la secundaria. ella los mantiene y su esposo le manda remesas con las cuales les hace mejoras a la casa.
Gladys R.: ella tiene 6 años de haber iniciado con una pulperia, la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia R., este tipo de negocio es muy comun en nuestro ambito social, las pulperias se encuentran ubicadas muy cerca la una con la otra y se ganan los clientes a quienes les brindan mejor la atencion. ella es casada pero no tiene hijos, su esposo trabaja como policia penitenciario en Tamara Departamento de Francisco Morazan, sus condiciones de vida han mejorado notablemente, ya que no dependen solo del sueldo de su esposo, sino tambien de los ingresos de la pulperia.
Nora Argentina R.: se dedica a la venta de verduras, actividad a la cual se dedica hace 4 años, dicho negocio lo lleva a cabo con su compañero de hogar, ella es madre de 2 hijos los cuales dependen al 100% de ellos, las verduras las compra en el mercado mayoreo de tegucigalpa y algunas veces en la ciudad de Danli, ella compra el producto los dias jueves de todas las semanas y los distribuye de manera ambulante en diferentes comunidades, aldeas y caserios de la zona de jamastran, esto lo hace en un carro que es propiedad de su esposo, su esposo de lunes a jueves se dedica a transportar lacteos en su carro. esto le genera ingresos aparte de la venta de verduras.
texts.en:
This group is named Red Roses and is organized as follows: Guadalupe del Carmen D.: Her principal activity is trade. She has spent 11 and a half years selling gold, which she does by foot. In this time she has learned administration, and with the money she has earned she has been able to support her husband in educating their two daughters, who are now professionals themselves. She is married and has only one child still as a dependant. Her husband works as a farmer. Marta G. N.: Began her convenience store 12 years ago, which operates under the name of Pulperia Suyapita. She acts as mother and father for her children, as her partner emigrated to the United States in search of better living conditions. She has three children who are in secondary school. She takes care of them and her husband sends money back, which they use to make improvements on their home. Gladys R.: Began her convenience store, Pulperia R., 6 years ago. This type of business is very common in the area, convenience stores are located very close to eachother, and htose which provide the best service earn the most customers. She is married but has no children, and her husband works as a prison guard. Their living conditions have improved notably now that they no longer depend only on the husband's salary, but as well on the income from the convenience store. Nora Argentina R.: Works selling vegetables, which she has done for 4 years. This business was created with her husband, with whom she has two children who depend on them 100%. The vegetables are bought in the major market in Tegucigalpa and sometimes in the city of Danli as well. She makes her purchases every Thursday, and distributes them on foot to different communities, villages, and farmhouses in the region of Jamastran. This is done in a cart belonging to her husband, which he uses to distribute dairy products from Monday to Thursday, in order to generate more money than the vegetables alone would earn.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing gold, sugar, butter, soaps, sanitary napkins, corn flour, rice, chicken, coffee, beans, and dairy products.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline P. owns a small sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods like rice, soaps, sardines, instant noodles, edible oil, chicken feed, Coca-Cola and other canned goods to earn a living. Her profit helps her feed and clothe her family. Because of her store, she was able to pay the tuition fees, books, and other school projects of her 3 children. Her husband, Efren P. is a fisherman. Every night except for typhoons, her husband goes out to fish. When they have a big catch, they also sell fish in their village.

Evangeline is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her store. In that way, she believes, she can attract more customers. That will lead Evangeline to earn more profit and support her family's needs well.

CEVI is helping her sustain her business even more. She is provided with the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage CEVI gives to all their clients. In this way, she can make her small business to grow.

loans.use: To buy additional  merchandise for her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Savat K. is a villager in Krang Roung village, in Takeo province. He owns a small business and sells mix ice-cream and grocery goods. Since his business has a lot of consumers, he wants to expand it. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to purchase more ice-cream and grocery products for his customers.

He hopes to earn more profit and improve his family's living conditions with this loan. His wife, Net Savy, is a Khmer noodle seller. Savat is 35 years old and the father of two children who attend the local school. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: Purchase more ice-cream and grocery products for his customers.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: La sra. Ingrid tiene su restaurante en la zona de Villa Copacabana, atiende los fines de semana (sábado y domingo),  ofrece platos típicos del departamento de La Paz, como fricasé, plato con trozos de cerdo acompañados con mote y chuño (papa deshidratada) servidos con su mismo caldo sazonado con ají amarillo; chicharrón, plato de trozos de cerdo retostados acompañado de mote y chuño; lechón, plato con trozos de carne de cerdo cocido al horno, sazonado con ají, acompañado de ensalada de lechuga, tomate y cebolla, camote, papa y plátano, cocidos también al horno, por la zona su restaurante ya es muy conocido. Ella vive con su esposo que se dedica al servicio de electrónica, y su hijo que está en edad escolar, sus otros hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Cliente muy responsable y puntual, invertirá el crédito en la compra de juegos de mesas y sillas, un extractor de grasa y un juego de ollas, ya que por la demanda que tiene debe aumentar la cantidad de platos a servir.
texts.en:
Ingrid owns a restaurant in the Villa Copacana zone, which is open on weekends (Saturday and Sunday) and offers dishes typical of the La Paz region, such as fricasé, a pork dish accompanied by mote (boiled corn) and chuño (a type of dehydrated potato) and served in its own broth seasoned with yellow ají pepper; chicharrón, roasted and slow-simmered pork rinds accompanied by mote and chuño; lechón, roasted beef and pork seasoned with ají and served with a salad of lettuce, tomato and onion, and roasted sweet potatoes, potatoes, and plantains. Her restaurant is already very well known in the area. She lives with her husband, who works in electronics repair, and one son who is of school-age; her other children are older and independent. Ingrid is a very responsible and punctual client. She will invest her loan in sets of tables and chairs, a stove exhaust fan, and a set of pots, since the high demand at her restaurant will require her to increase the number of dishes served.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will be invested in the purchase of kitchen furnishings for her business

loans.name: Nhat

texts.en: Nhật K. Đỗ was born in 1968 (no. 010117070029). She is a tailor. She is living in Phuc Loc village, Uy No commune, Dong Anh district, Ha Noi. She has one child. She is learning at the university. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 VND. She has to work hard. She needs 5,450,000 VND (about 325 USD) to buy cloth to make clothes. She is sitting to the right side of the picture.

loans.use: To buy cloth to make clothes

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard B. is 59 years old; he is married and has three children. All his children are still in school. He lives with his wife who is a petty trader in the community where they live. They are currently living at Dorma Ahenkro, a farming community in the Brong Ahafo region in Ghana.

Bernard owns and operates grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits, etc. in his neighborhood. It has been his dream to expand by adding other foodstuffs to his existing products. With the loan, he wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase his inventory. He hopes to improve his savings to pay for his children's schooling. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Nyame Nti’ which means "Christ's Sake".

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and boxes of biscuit etc.

loans.name: Carlos Román

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Román vive con su esposa en esta ciudad, son padres de 2 pequeñitos 
Y tienen su propio negocio de nombre "Abarrotes Roman " establecido desde hace 3 años, a pesar de la economía en estos momentos el negocio se ha mantenido estable y más aun sigue creciendo. 
El por el motivo que esta solicitando este crédito es para surtir mucha mas mercancía y así crezcan sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Señor Carlos Román lives with his wife in this city. They are the parents of two small children. They have their own business, Abarrotes Román (Román's Groceries) which has been in business for three years. In spite of the current economy, his business has been stable and furthermore is continuing to grow. The reason he is seeking this loan is to stock up with a lot more merchandise and build up his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the business.

loans.name: Grace Jane

texts.en: Grace Jane A. is from the town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Grace Jane owns and operates a "habal-habal" (transportation) business, providing motor-vehicle transportation services to local community members. Grace Jane has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Grace Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Grace Jane is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to repair a vehicle used in the business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Байматова Латофат является активным нашим клиентом. Она родилась 1955 году и имеет  4 детей. Латофат работает в Радио Таджикистана оператором и через каждые 2 дня. Остальные дни она занимается продажей лепешек на рынке "Сафариён", магазин №118. Латофат сама печет лепешки по заказу для «Курутоб», а в основном она закупает в оптом.   
У нее много клиентов. Ей нравиться ее работа, она считает, что хлеб всегда будут покупать и это является постоянным источником дохода.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Latofat B. is our active client. She was born in 1955 and has four children. Latofat works on the Tajikistan Radio as an operator every two days. During other days she sells flat breads on the Safariyon market in the store number 118. Latofat makes the flat breads herself, she gets orders from Kurutob and mainly she buys in wholesale. She has many customers. She likes her work and she thinks that bread will always be in demand and it is a stable source of income.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and ingredients for baking

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
“Strive hard to achieve your dreams in life,” says Erlinda B.. She is a farmer in the of village in Barangay Inaban Dupax del Norte in Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Leonardo B. and they are blessed with five children. The couple has been farming since childhood. And because of life's difficulties, they were not able to send their children to college. Instead, they sent them to the high school level only, but some of their children are still studying in elementary level and one is patiently coping with his high school studies. 

Erlinda wants to borrow a loan from Kiva of PHP 10,000.00. If she is given the chance, Erlinda will invest the amount in their rice farming business and plans to buy a piglet that will be beneficial to her family when it grows and is sold to buyers. Erlinda is also planning to venture into the vegetable-selling business for additional income.  She hopes that Kiva lenders will assist her in uplifting their family from poverty.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Carmen, pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray”, situado en el distrito de Taray, a 1 hora de la misma ciudad del Cusco.

La socia  tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de  (14, 5) años, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, ella vende sus productos en el mirador de Taray a los turistas, la socia aprovecha que este es un sitio obligado de paso para todos los visitantes que van en dirección a Calca, Pisac, Urubamba, Ollantaytambo y de hay continuarán a Machupicchu, la socia requiere el préstamo en razón de invertir en la compra de mayor número de artesanía para la venta.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el dinero prestado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos mensuales en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Señor de la Agonía de Taray Communal Bank, located in the district of Taray, an hour away from Cusco. She is 34 years old, lives with her partner and has two children aged fourteen and five. She goes back and forth between her household activities and her handicrafts business. She sells her products to tourists at a scenic overlook in Taray, taking advantage of visitors stopping on their way to Calca, Pisac, Urubamba and Ollantaytambo and from there, continuing on to Machu Picchu. She needs a loan to purchase more handicrafts to sell. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling her repayment obligations in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en:
H. Nurali is a diligent and tenacious farmer, who strives to meet his family’s needs. His wife does not work and thus he carries the burden alone through his farming income to meet his family’s needs. Nurali works on a farm owned by his parents. His harvests are sometimes not maximized because his cultivation method and seeds are not the best. Better farming supplies, seeds and fertilizer require a larger capital which he didn’t have. Nurali is now relieved that IMON International is helping him get a loan he needs to improve his farming. This loan will be used to buy superior seeds, organic fertilizers and pesticides. Nurali is waiting for his next harvest which he hopes to yield better results from his previous harvests. He will use his farming income to support his children’s educational needs and if there is still some money left he really hopes to fix his unfinished house.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Chenta

texts.en:
Mrs. Chenta S., age 29 (shown in picture with her husband), and her husband Mr. Thol Sorn, age 31, were married in 2002 and have two sons and one daughter. One of them attends school and other two are still young. The family lives along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chenda has been growing vegetable for 7 years. Mr. Thol Sorn has been a construction worker for about 6 months. He works in other districts far a way from his house. Chenda is requesting her first loan of $500 to make sheathing the plans from sun.

loans.use: To make sheathing the plans from sun.

loans.name: Bin

texts.en: Bin P. was born in 1962, a married woman and is the mother blessed with eight children. Five of them are married and live independently, while other three live in home and go to school. Bin P. sells some vegetables and groceries in the local market, as another source of income comes from she provides a karaoke service for singing. She has an attractive place which she uses for her service. While her husband‘s name is Thorn Buthoeun, (he appears in the picture here) works with her in the business. Bin P. will be used her first loan to decorate her karaoke room in order to attract more customer.

loans.use: To decorate her karaoke room in order to attract more customer

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena G. is from the village of Zone 1, Camarahan, Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 56 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Nena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Nena is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Tan S. is a 31-year-old farmer who resides in the best territory of Kompong Tom, in a good location for farming. To earn a living, Tan S. plants potatoes and peanut trees on her own piece of farmland. She currently earns approximately of $2 a day to contribute her family. To provide more income for family, her husband is a blacksmith for a small firm. The family lives with two school-aged children. Tan S. will be using her first loan to purchase a motorbike, which she and her family will use for traveling purposes.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Alvaro Manuel

texts.es: Don Alvaro  Manuel es originartio del cantón Cojxac del municipio de Totonicapan  su actividad principal es la elaboracion de sinchos  de diferentes estilos y colores dicha actividad lo aprendio desde cuando tenia ocho años como operario cuando cumplio los veinte años formo su propio negocio y la cual los vende en la plaza de los dias martes y sabado en el mercado municiapl de Totonicapan hoy necesita de un credtio para surtir su mercaderia ya que consiguio un nuevo punto de ventas el Joyabaj Santa cruz del Quiche.
texts.en:
Don Alvaro Manuel is originally from the Cojxac district in the town of Totonicapan. He makes belts in different styles and colors. Alvaro says he learned this trade when he was 8 years old. At the age of 20, he started his own business selling his products in the open area of the Totonicapan municipal market on Tuesdays and Saturdays. He needs a loan in order to produce more merchandise. Recently he acquired a new vending location in Joyabaj Santa Cruz del Quiche.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies for making belts

loans.name: Olaide

texts.en:
Olaide sells hair extensions and hair cream at retail prices in her shop. She is a hair stylist, and she sells hair materials to make a living. She is happy because the high season is here, and she hopes to make more sales during this season.

She is 43 years old and married with 4 children. Her children are doing well in school.

Olaide is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a young man, 24 years of age, married, and the father of one child. He owns a grocery store. He would like to use this loan to acquire supplies of new products for his store. Given this chance, he will earn more funds and save more, so he can meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Pastora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pastora está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Mercedes de la Concepción S. M. quien desde los 16 años tiene una Fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos. 

Está señora con las ganancias mantiene a sus cuatro hijos menores de edad los cuales pronto ingresaran nuevamente a clases.

La señora Martha Lorena M. M. de 26 años en el 2000 con la comercialización de granos básicos y Cordalia M. de 31 años vende frescos y enchiladas.
texts.en:
The Group "Pastora" is made of three hard working women. One of them is Mercedes de la Concepción S. M., who since 16 has had a Fritanga, a popular restaurant that sells fried foods. With the earnings, she can support her 4 young children who will soon return to school. Ms. Martha Lorena M. M. is 26 years old. In 2000, she started selling basic grains and Cordalia M., 31 years old sells drinks and enchiladas.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients like basic grains, meat, vegetables, legumes…etc

loans.name: Mariela Victoria

texts.es: Esta señora es maestra de escuela primaria tiene 40 de edad es madre soltera y con dos hijos a su cargo, los dos son menores de edad, ella es directora de un centro de estudio que se llama José Dolores Toruño en el municipio de Posoltega de donde es originaria, ella está trabajando con nuestra institución desde el año 2006, los créditos que se le han otorgado han sido para mejorar su vivienda y este último que se le está otorgando es para la compra de útiles escolares y uniformes para sus hijos, a demás de otros gastos que tiene que solventar.
texts.en:
This woman is a primary school teacher. She is 40 years old and a single mother with two children to support. She is the director of a school called José Dolores Toruño in the town of Posoltega, where she was born. She has been working with CEPRODEL since 2006. The loans that she has been granted have been to make home improvements and this loan is to buy school supplies and uniforms for her children as well as to cover other expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses: notebooks, pencils, backpacks, uniforms, shoes, and other expenses.

loans.name: Afoussitou

texts.en: Afoussitou S. is 46 years old. She works in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo, and sells a variety of grains and cereals. She began this business in 2000 and is now asking for her second loan from the Kiva field partner, WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase ten sacks of corn and eight sacks of spice. The remainder will be used to purchase any other products needed to restock her shelves. Mrs. S. is married and has two children. With this loan, both her business and her family will prosper.

loans.use: Purchase of corn and spice

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Progreso es parte del centro focal de Panamericana.  Este es su segundo ciclo, la mayoría de las socias solicitaron recoger su ahorro y de esta manera cada socia tendría doble ingreso económico para impulsar el negocio: el del ahorro y el dinero desembolsado en el crédito.  Esta asociación tiene 10 clientes, 9 mujeres y 1 varon.  El varon extra que se encuentra vestido de chamarra negra es el esposo de una socia.

Los negocios de las socias son diferentes: tejido de mantas, venta de zapatos, albañileria, tejido de mantas de vicuña, venta de papas fritas, mantas, ropa, zapatos y abarrotes.

La señora Susana M.  contínúa a cargo de la asociación como presidenta.   Ella indica que su negocio de elaboración de mantas de vicuña necesita capitalizarse, pues se avecina la época de frio (Otoño e Invierno) y en la misma hay demanda de sus productos
texts.en:
The Progreso community group is part of a Panamerican regional center. This is their second loan cycle, and the majority of the members are requesting it to revamp their savings. In this way, each member can double the money they infuse into their business: from their personal savings and from the loan. There are 10 group members, nine women and one man. The extra man in the photo wearing a black jacket is the husband of another member. The members' businesses are varied: weaving blankets (which multiple members do), selling shoes and clothing, construction, selling french fries, and grocery sales. Susana M. continues to be in charge of the group as president. She says that her business making blankets out of vicuña wool, which is similar to llamas and alpacas, needs to raise capital since the cold seasons of fall and winter are approaching and her products will be in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es: La señora Maria Lucrecia C., es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos estan en edad escolar. Actualmente se desempeña en su centro de labores esforzandose grandemente para obtener los ingresos para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda que así lo requiere. Para ello ha solicitado un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como lo son  cemento, arena, zinc, entre otros para así llevar a cabo dicha obra en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Lucrecia C. has three children; two of them are school age. She currently works as the reservations manager for a beach hotel. She has a life companion. Basically her activity consists of taking reservations, entering them in the system, and making sure that they are not oversold.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement, sand, and gravel

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina V.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She is 39 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Tipolo. Gina has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2001, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Gina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 15th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To stock more produce like maize, millet and beans

loans.name: Laxmi Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi Kumari T. is the grocery storekeeper in the town of Chetrapati, Kathmandu. She opens her grocery store three years ago to uplift the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of goods such as rice, maize, biscuits, noodles, snacks, etc. in her shop. Due to the increasing demand for grocery goods, she is requesting a Rs 25,000.00 loan to buy different varieties of grocery goods for her shop.

Mrs. Laxmi Kumari T. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Prem T., is a house painter. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade six and her daughter is studying in grade nine.

loans.use: To buy goods.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère d’un enfant, cette dame est  très active. Elle a 34 ans mais a démarré le commerce de pagnes depuis plus de 12 ans. Elle achète ses pagnes au grand marché de Lomé et les revend sur les marchés périphériques notamment Assiyéyé.
Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter de nouvelles gammes de pagnes pour conserver sa clientèle.
Elle compte sur les revenus de cette activité pour mieux contribuer aux charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of one child, this lady is very active. She is 34 years old but started a business involving pagnes (colorful West African cloth) over twelve years ago. She buys her cloth at the big market of Lomé, the capital of Togo and resells it at outlying markets, especially Assiyéyé. She is requesting this loan for buying new assortments of cloth in order to maintain her customers. She is counting on the revenues from this business to do more to cover household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pagne cloth

loans.name: Divinas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Divinas” esta representado por la señora Silvia y conformada por 13 miembros, es un grupo que esta por su segundo ciclo, son muy responsable, alegre, y cumplido y sobre todo muy solidario. La señora Silvia es casada y al igual que ella su esposo es muy trabajadora, ella se dedica al servicio de peluquería, negocio el cual instalado en la casa donde reside en anticretico, ella y su esposo desean poder ahorrar para tener una casa propia en la cual puedan formar una familia futura ya que ella aun no tiene hijos, ella requiere el dinero para poder comprar herramientas para su negocio como secadoras, planchas para el cabello y acomodar el ambiente para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientas que le generan el ingreso diario. En este grupo todos son multifacéticos es decir que trabajan en todo tipo de rubros, les gusta trabajar mucho y saben como hacer negocios, en este momento las socias se dedican a la venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, venta de pollos, venta de refrescos y empanadas, venta de ropa, venta de verduras, joyas y al transporte  público. En este caso no hay competencia porque todos tienen diferentes negocios y todos les va muy bien porque salen a distintos puntos de venta para poder vender su mercadería o ofrecer sus servicio, por ejemplo, la señora Susana vende empanadas y masitas tiene clientes que realizan pedidos por día y gana muy bien en su negocio. El crédito será utilizado para poder crecer mas a su negocio y atraer mas clientela para mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Las socias ya tiene bastante experiencia con respecto a lo que es créditos solidarios, es un grupo que esta por su segundo ciclo,  termino muy bien en su primer crédito mostrando mucha capacidad para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The communal bank, “Divinas” is represented by Silvia and is composed of 13 members. The group will be in its second loan cycle. The members are very responsible, cheerful, punctual, and above all, united. Silvia is married, and just like her, her husband is a hard worker. She is a hairdresser and works out of her home, which is under an anticredito agreement (anticretico is a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from the tenant in exchange for housing, which must be paid back at the end of the contract. If the loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to the tenant). She and her husband want to save for their own house where they can raise a family since they do not yet have children. Silvia needs capital to purchase tools for her business such as hairdryers, flat irons, and to arrange an ambience to give better service to her customers, who are the source of her daily income. All the members of the group are multifaceted, meaning they work in all kinds of fields. They like to work hard, and they know how to do business. The members sell food, groceries, chickens, soft drinks and empanadas, clothing, vegetables, jewelry, and offer public transport. The members do not compete with one another because everyone has a different business. They all do well because they go to different places to sell their merchandise or offer their services. For example, Susana sells empanadas and “masitas,” a type of pastry, and has clients that place orders by the day. Her business provides her with a decent salary. The loan will be used to grow the members’ businesses and attract more clients to increase income and improve quality of life for the families. The members already have plenty of experience with group loans. The group will be in its second loan cycle, and it completed its first loan very well, showing a great capacity for continuing working.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Delmy Aracely

texts.es: Delmy Aracely C. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad,  resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive con su esposo el cual trabaja en su negocio propio, repartiendo tambos D. gas propano, así mismo vive junto a sus tres hijas D. 10, 8 y 3 años D. edad, D. las cuales la mayor y la menor disfrutan mucho estar en el negocio junto a Delmy. Ella posee una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, así mismo elabora platillos típicos como: yuca frita, atol D. elote entre otros más, estos los elabora todas las tardes, D. esta misma forma comercializa productos D. belleza como maquillaje, cremas para el cuidado D. la piel y el cabello y otros más, los cuales venD. D. forma ambulante. Ella demuestra ser una mujer muy responsable, la cual realiza diferentes actividades, con el deseo D. obtener mayores ganancias con las cuales le brinD. toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en la tienda comprando mayor cantidad D. productos D. primera necesidad, así mismo comprar materia prima como maíz y elotes para la elaboración D. los platillos típicos y también comprar más cosméticos, esto lo hace con el enorme deseo D. mejorar sus ventas y contar con mayor mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Delmy Aracely C. D. M. is 34 years old. She lives in the town of Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who has his own business repairing propane tanks, and their three daughters ages 10, 8 and 3, of which the oldest and the youngest love to go to work with Delmy. Delmy owns a store that sells perishable products and basic necessities. It is located in her house. She also makes traditional dishes such as fried yucca, atol D. elote (a drink maD. from corn) and other things. She makes these every afternoon. She also sells beauty products such as make-up, skin and hair care cremes and others that she sells as a street vendor. She is a responsible woman who works various jobs with the desire to earn more in order to help her husband with the household expenses. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan so that she can buy more basic necessity products for her store, more raw materials like corn and elotes to make traditional dishes and also to buy more cosmetics. She wants to increase her sales and have more merchandise to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products for her store, more raw materials to make traditional dishes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Samnan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnan C. is 28 years old and married to Mr. Boeun Ty, a laborer who earns a small salary to help with his family’s living expenses. The couple has four children; two attend the local school while the other two are too young to study or work. Located in Kab Nuem, Takeo province, their village bank consists of thirteen members who selected Mrs. C. to be its president. The members of this village will use this loan to support different purposes.

Mrs. C. owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice. She works very hard to support her family. In order to increase the family’s income, Mrs. C. wishes to use her loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Phesila Akumu

texts.en: Phesila Akumu has been a cereal dealer since 2003 in Nyamasaria market in Kisumu. (She left her agri-base business which had many climatic challenges and could not adequately support her family.) She travels to Kibuye market on a daily basis to purchase her stock. Her endeavor to improve her business has been a great task due to insufficient capital, which is why she applied for a loan worth 20,000 (KES) to enable her to realize her dream of expanding her business. Phesila is 45 and married with four children.

loans.use: Improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for young people for the upcoming season of the Santa Ana festivals

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es el  Sr. Claudio; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos,  el socio se dedica a la compra y venta de repuestos para autos, el distribuye auto partes;  El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el capital de negocio y comprar repuestos.    

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Claudio is a member of the communal bank "UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO." The bank is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco. Sr. Claudio is 45 years old and is married with 3 children. He buys, sells, and distributes auto parts. Claudio is seeking a loan to invest in business capital and to buy auto parts. He is grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Requesting a loan to invest in business capital and to buy auto parts

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina P. is 31 years old and the mother of three young girls. Her family lives in Santo Niño, Surallah. 

She has been farming since having her family. This has been their source of livelihood. Like most mothers, she wants her children to have a life quite different from hers. She realized that she could do better with her farming if given financial assistance. 

She requested a loan to be used in buying seedlings and fertilizers. The extra income that she can get from this will be used for her family’s daily needs and for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia O. is from the village of Tru-cut Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Antonia is married and has 3 adult-age children. To make a living, Antonia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits  like banana and marang, a local fruit similar to a breadfruit, in the local community. (You can see marangs on the shelf in the photograph).  Antonia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Antonia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. Antonia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Antonia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa E. moves around in her locality to sell her detergent at Abura. She is married to a carpenter and has been through junior high school. Adjoa has been in this business for three years now. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more detergent to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to save to build a shop to display her goods.

loans.use: To purchase more detergent to resell.

loans.name: Gulomhaydar

texts.ru: Зикиров Гуломхайдар проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 58 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Двое сыновей живут и занимаются бизнесом в городе Душанбе. Сам Гуломхайдар имеет средне - специальное образование, художник. По специальности работает уже 25 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения красок и других, необходимых для деятельности вещей.
texts.en: Gulomhaydar Z. lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 58 years old, married and has 5 children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Two of their sons live and do business in the city of Dushanbe.  Gulomhaydar has a secondary-specialized education, as an artist.  He has been working in his field for 25 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of paint and other essentials for the business.

loans.use: Purchase of paint and other essentials for the business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul, a married man, has three children and he operates a retail shop. He has been in his business for four years. He also does mixed farming so as to supplement his family’s income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business inventory. This has helped him to improve his business and, hence, growth of his family’s income. With the loan of 40, 000 KES, he will buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Claudia Karina

texts.es: Claudia Karina P. D. de 25 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Vicente, junto a su esposo y una hija menor de edad. Claudia posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, leche, huevos, alimentos enlatados, agua embotellada, verduras y otros productos más. Ella es una persona muy responsable y amable la cual cuenta con varios clientes a pesar que su tienda no tiene mucha variedad de productos. Claudia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que el mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir su negocio y así percibir mayores ganancias. Claudia es una madre de familia muy responsable quien desea mucho poder brindarle todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Claudia Karina P. D. is 25 years old.  She lives in San Vicente department with her husband and her school-age daughter.  Claudia has a store in which she sells basic household goods such as bread, milk, eggs, canned goods, bottled water, vegetables and other products besides.  She is a very responsible and kind person who has a number of customers even though her store doesn't have a great variety of products.

Claudia is requesting a loan so that she has enough money to buy a larger quantity of products since her biggest wish is to be able to stock her business and thereby make more profits.  Claudia is a very responsible mother who would like to be able to provide her daughter with the best.

loans.use: To buy basic household products to stock her store

loans.name: Olga Cristina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.
