En este lugar encontramos a la señora  Olga, ella tiene 64 años de edad, está soltera  pero de una relación que tuvo hace mucho  tiene dos hijos de  33 y 22 años, los dos aun viven con ella y estudian en la universidad.

Se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Nature Garden, también vende tarjetas de telefonía celular, aguas, colas y gelatinas, todos sus productos los vende en su casa, trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 19 h00. Entre los productos que más vende están el vitatoro, Esperoline, vitacerebral, gel reductor, entre otros. Los productos los recibe en una distribuidora en Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para comprar gel reductor, vitatoro, vitacerebral y otros productos que ella vende. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Las Américas Communal Bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.

In this place we find Olga, 64 years old.  She is single, but from a relationship long ago she has two children, 22 and 33 years old.  They both live with her and study at the university.

She sells Nature Garden brand natural products, as well as cell phone cards, water, soda, and jellies, all from her home.  She works every day from 9am to 7pm.  Her best-selling products include Vitatoro, Esperoline, Vitacerebral, and reducing gel, among others.  She receives the products at a distribution company in Portoviejo.

This loan is to buy reducing gel, Vitatoro, Vitacerebral and other products that she sells.  Her dream is to have her own house, since where she lives is rented.

loans.use: To buy reducing gel, Vitatoro, Vitacerebral, and more products such as cell phone cards, water, soda, and jellies.

loans.name: Nueva Estrella (New Star) Group

texts.es: Doña Ana Lucía, D. veinte años D. edad es una señora recién casada, doña Ana apoya económicamente a su familia y prepararle un mejor futuro a sus hijos,  ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa que ella  ha podido  mantener, actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. cuatro años, ella venD. en varios municipios y en los días D. plaza del pueblo para mejorar sus venta y tener más clientes, doña Ana se dio cuenta que necesitaba surtir mas su negocio para poder mejorar las ventas, D. esa manera ella pueD. obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas y vecinas que conocía desD. hace mas D. cinco años para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su comunidad, el cual cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, elaboración D. mochilas,  venta D. mercería, entre otros.
texts.en: Ana Lucía is a twenty year old woman and recently married. She sells clothes in order to support her family and proviD. a better future for her children. She has been running this business for over four years, and sells in various districts and on town market days to increase her sales and attract more customers. Ana realised she needed to stock her business in order to sell more and increase her profits. So she gathered together a few friends and neighbours she had known for more than five years, and formed a group. Because she tries to support not only her family but also other people in her community, each woman has a different traD., including selling fruit, rearing livestock, making rucksacks, selling haberdashery items, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: José Anibal

texts.es:
José Aníbal tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Tranca Fanupe del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola caracterizada por que sus pobladores son bastante humildes y trabajadores. La localidad pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su domicilio. Allí ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. José ofrece sus productos  tanto al crédito como al contado y siempre trata de brindar un buen trato a sus clientes por lo que en el tiempo que lleva funcionando su negocio este ha empezado a contar con buena acogida. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

José desea adquirir mercadería para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
José Aníbal is 19 years old, single, and lives with his family in the village of Tranca Fanupe, in Mórrope district.  This is an agricultural area which is characterized by the fact that its inhabitants are quite humble and hard working.  The village is located in Lambayeque province, one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

José Aníbal has a grocery store in his home where he offers his customers different staples and groceries.  He offers his products both on credit and for cash and he always tries to provide his customers with good service.  Over the time he has been in this business, this has led to his store becoming very popular.  He uses the profits he makes from this business to cover his personal costs and to help his parents with the family's finances.

José would like to acquire merchandise so that he can meet current demand.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To acquire merchandise so that he can meet his current demand

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes T. is from the village of Gamis Saguday Quirino. She is 48 years old. Agnes is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Agnes is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Agnes owns & operates a business venture in the arts sector operating a handicraft business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Agnes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agnes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional handicrafts to sell. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Agnes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Abdusamat

texts.en:
M. Abdusamat is a very responsible and optimistic person, and he has three children and a wife to support. He wants to develop his business of raising cattle in his village because there is a very high demand for milk from villagers and especially from customers who come from surrounding towns. Abdusamat is helped by his wife. 

He is currently faced with many problems because his children are growing; accordingly, their expenses are growing, too. The only way to get out of this difficulty is to succeed in business, so we hope that his capabilities along with the services provided by IMON International will help him improve the business. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy young cattle for developing his business

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHASKA ÑAHUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zoraida; ella tiene 65 años de edad, separada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende golosinas, fideos, gaseosas entre otros productos más a la vez la socia vende comida todos los domingos en las ferias gastronómicas que se realiza en la plaza de San Francisco de Cusco.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería e insumos para sus negocios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "CHASKA ÑAHUI” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, belonging to the province of Cuzco and departament of Cuzco.

The member is Zoraida. She is 65 years old, seperated and has 4 children.  She has a grocery store where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, suagr and milk. She also sells candies, pasta and soft drinks among other products. She sells food every Sunday in the food fairs held on San Francisco Plaza of Cuzco as well.  

The member is asking for the loan to buy more merchandise and materials for her businesses. 

The member is happy with the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy more merchandise and materials for her businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials for cable manufacturing business

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Esteban es periodista y su esposa es comerciante, el crédito lo requiere para el pago de mensualidades ya que el señor estudia en una universidad privada, es casado tiene dos hijos, vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva y se encuentra muy satisfecho con las condiciones de los créditos.
texts.en: Esteban is a reporter and his wife is a merchant. He requires a loan to pay his monthly tuition fees. He is attending a private university. He is married and he has two children. He lives in a house which he owns in the region of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. This is the second time he requests a loan through Kiva and he is very happy with the loan conditions.

loans.use: to pay his monthly tuition fees for his university studies in journalism

loans.name: En's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen members. Mrs. En is a village bank president. She was born in 1954. She is a widow with two children: one is a monk and one is student.

Mrs. En is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow rice for a living. She doesn't have enough money to support her rice field. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for hired laborers to plow her rice field. Aside from farmer she is also village chief, earning a small salary to support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for hired laborers plow her rice field.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; Este banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma: es soltero y tiene 24 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de choclo, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo y ella siembra y cosecha choclos, una vez cosechado ella los vende; la socia también trabaja en un hotel en la zona, ella desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de semillas y abonos, la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos para la tierra.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Irma, age 24, is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; the bank is located in the Urubamba province of the Cusco department. Irma is single and makes her living buying and selling corn; she also has plots of land where she plants and harvests corn crops, which she then sells after the harvest. Irma also works at a local hotel.

Irma would like to use the loan to purchase seed and manure for her corn plots. She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase seed and manure for cultivating corn

loans.name: Angela Gregoria

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad  y una hija de 13 años, la misma que estudian en escuela, con ella viven el hijo mayor que es discapacitado y la menor. El marido es albañil.
 
Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa, en la que vende arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, artículos de bazar, productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo, nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio por seis años y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y artículos de bazar. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 8 ciclos y le gusta la facilidad para realizar los pagos.

Su sueño es ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Unión y Solidaridad' (Union and Solidarity) community bank meet in San Pablo parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí and it has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet 44 year-old Angela who lives with her common-law husband and has three children.  Two of her children are already grown up but her youngest (daughter) is 13 and still in school.  Angela's eldest son is disabled and lives with her, as does her youngest daughter.  Her husband is a construction worker.

Angela has a general store in her home where she sells rice, sugar, oil, detergents, general goods and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every day, from 7.00am to 8.00pm and sometimes until later.  Her children help her in her work.  She tells us that she has been in her business for six years and it has done very well.

Angela will use this loan to further stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold meats and general goods.  She has been a member of her community bank for eight loan cycles and she likes the repayment terms. 

Angela's dream is to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold meats and general goods

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old, married to Andrew, and has four children. She has been knitting sweaters and school uniforms as a primary business. She also sells rice to her customers in Mwiki. She earns an income of KES. 22,700 per month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she intends to use the entire loan amount to buy knitting wools and to buy rice to sell. She will use the generated profit to invest in the rice business.

In the future, she hopes to grow her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy knitting wools and rice to sell.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope que se encuentra a 40 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola, ganadería y turismo (tiene festividades  religiosas muy bonitas).

María es comerciante desde hace muchos años de ganado vacuno (vacas), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y arreglar sus corral, con la finalidad de que con los ingresos que obtenga pueda brindarlea su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  María es una mujer  muy responsable y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener mejoras para su negocio y seguir solventando sus necesidades familiares y brindarle a sus hijos otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own house, which only has the service of electricity.  It is located in the district of Mórrope, which can be found 40 minutes from the department of Lambayeque.  This zone is dedicated to activities related to farming, livestock and tourism (they have beautiful religious festivals).

María has been a livestock merchant for many years (cows).  Her corral is located outside her house, and she gives them balanced feed and natural grasses so they will grow optimally.  She offers them throughout the various markets in the zone, and that is how she generates good profits to meet the household expenses.

She has requested a loan of 3000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternative to buy more animals and make repairs to her corral.  The end result hopefully being that, with the earnings she obtains, she will be able to provide a higher standard of living for her family.  María is a very responsible and hard-working woman who worries about improving her business and continuing to meet the family’s needs.  She wants to give her children other opportunities in life.

loans.use: buy more animals and make repairs to her corral.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 62 años D. edad, tiene un solo hijo, el cual es independiente, cuenta con casa propia con los servicios D. agua y luz, ubicada en L. zona rural del distrito D. Mórrope que pertenece al departamento D. Lambayeque.  Esta zona L. actividad principal es L. agricultura, ganadería y turismo (tiene festividades religiosas y lugares muy bonitos).

Mercedes desD. hace 10 años se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. animales (vacas, cerdos y aves D. corral), su corral se encuentra en L. parte externa D. su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para que pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados D. L. zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectiva comida, con L. finalidad D. obtener un mejor precio con sus clientes y así mejoraría  su calidad D. vida. Mercedes es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca cada vez más y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercedes tiene 62 años D. edad, tiene un solo hijo, el cual es independiente, cuenta con casa propia con los servicios D. agua y luz, ubicada en L. zona rural del distrito D. Mórrope que pertenece al departamento D. Lambayeque.  Esta zona L. actividad principal es L. agricultura, ganadería y turismo (tiene festividades religiosas y lugares muy bonitos).

Mercedes desD. hace 10 años se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. animales (vacas, cerdos y aves D. corral), su corral se encuentra en L. parte externa D. su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para que pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados D. L. zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectiva comida, con L. finalidad D. obtener un mejor precio con sus clientes y así mejoraría  su calidad D. vida. Mercedes es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca cada vez más y sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Compra de animales y su respectivo alimento

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en: Celedonia, 57 years old, is married and blessed with five children. She's engaged in food production and sells cured pork and sausages. She's been in this business for almost six years. Her net income is 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) monthly. She's asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients to make more sausages to sell. Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to Celedonia, who sees the loans as the only opportunity for progression of her business and financial security.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make more sausages to sell.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 75 years old and married with four children, ages 22, 30, 32, and 34. Together with two of her daughters, Felicitas owns and runs a family furniture-making business. She and her family have their own store where they construct and sell furniture. Felicitas is proud that their store has been open for more than 10 years. 

Felicitas is requesting a loan to buy more wood and other needed materials to make furniture to sell. She and her family are very happy about this loan and are committed to making all the necessary payments.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials to make furniture

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
Abu Bakarr, age 53, owns a used footwear sales business. He began his business because he wanted to provide as well as possible for himself and his family. He and his wife have five children aged 13, 13, 16, 19, and 27. He has two additional dependents, his niece and nephew, living with the family. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Abu Bakarr would like to request a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. He requires this loan in order to buy an additional five bales of used shoes to offer for sale. He is confident that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. 

In the future, he plans to provide for the education of his children to the university level. He hopes eventually to become a top leader in the community.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik was born in 1957 in Lorut village, Lori region. He is married and has a daughter who works as a nurse at Vanadzor hospital. It is already a long time that Gagik and his family have been living in Vanadzor city. In Vanadzor, he has a small plot of land where he breeds pigs and sells pork to resellers. But the main body of Gagik’s business is selling dairy products. He buys cheese and butter from his native village, stores it and then resells it at Vanadzor market. Gagik’s wife helps him in his occupations and thus they support their family. Gagik received a loan from Nor Horizon 12 times and he has never delayed his repayments. Now he needs a 1,000,000 Armenian drams loan to buy a batch of dairy products from villagers and store it to sell later.

loans.use: To buy dairy products from villagers to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has been operating her salon business for the last three years in Kasieku, Emali town. She is 29 years old and married. She and her husband Michael have six children.

Agnes was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add stock of  hair relaxer and hair pieces for her salon.

In the future, Agnes hopes to expand her business and be able to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To add stock of hair relaxer and hair pieces.

loans.name: Mushfig

texts.ru: Mushvig 45 let. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ocev dlya uvelicheniya kolichestvo skota. Mushvig uje 12 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec.
texts.en: Mushfig is 45 years old, married and has three children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person), who moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his wife and children.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy sheep in order to increase livestock quantity.  Mushfig has been involved in animal husbandry for 12 years and breeds sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Abunzubumwe A / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Théogène fait parti du groupe Abunzubumwe A / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « unir les gens ». Théogène est né au Rwanda. Il est marié avec 6 enfants de 3 à 18 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de primaire. 

Théogène est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver à temps, de cultiver une race améliorée et de vendre une grande quantité de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Théogène voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Théogène is a member of Abunzuwumbe A / Rusizi Group, which means "uniting people". He was born in Rwanda. He is married and the father of six children, aged 3 to 18. Three of his children attend school. He attended elementary school until fourth grade.

Théogène is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field.

His growth strategy consists in early planting, growing an improved rice variety and selling large quantities of rice. In the years to come Théogène would like to become one of the best rice farmers in his valley. He will use his profit to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger tiene 35 años, es un hombre dinámico y emprendedor, es conviviente y madre de dos hijos de 6 y 3 años, quienes son su motivo de trabajo y su deseo de superación. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, inmueble que logró comprar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Su trabajo consiste en la fabricación de casas prefabricadas, muebles de madera, dicho trabajo lo realiza a domicilio. Es bueno en lo que hace, pues sus trabajos tiene un buen acabado; y ésto lo aprendió desde muy pequeño, en el que su padre le enseñó la carpintería. Ahora lo que más desea es implementar su trabajo con nuevas herramientas. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, le va bien en su grupo y espera poder seguir siendo socio puntual y responsable que fue hasta ahora, asimismo esta agradecido con los préstamos otorgados anteriormente ya que le ayudaron a tener mayor capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado,  acondicionará un espacio de su casa para hacer un taller, además comprará herramientas que le hacen falta para seguir realizando sus maravillosos trabajos.
texts.en: Roger is 35 years old and he is a dynamic and enterprising man. He lives with his partner and mother of his two children, aged 6 and 3. They are the reason for his work and for his wish to improve. Together they live in a house of their own. They managed to purchase the house with a great deal of effort and sacrifice. His work consists of making prefabricated houses and wooden furniture. He carries out his work at home. He does good work, especially because his projects have a good finish. He learned this business when he was very young. His father taught him carpentry. His greatest wish is to supply his business with new tools. This will be his fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). It has gone well for him within his group and he hopes to continue to be a member who is punctual and responsible. He is thankful for the loans granted to him previously especially because they have helped him have a greater working capital. With the funds requested he will condition a space in his house to set up a shop. He will also purchase tools to keep creating his marvelous projects.

loans.use: to purchase tools and to condition a space in his house to set up a workshop.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is married to Abner, who works as a government employee. She is 46 years old and is blessed with three children. Haydee, her eldest, is currently living in Jordan and working as a factory worker. Hayleen is a fourth-year college student. Absel, the youngest, is also in college. Sending them to college is very costly. Celia hopes that her children will finish their studies with her financial support. 

To help her husband in providing for the growing needs of their children, she began selling beauty soaps and other products like detergents, gas stove and umbrella. She sells her products to the people from her community.

Aside from her retailing business, she also maintains a hog-raising business. 

To further grow both of her businesses, Celia is requesting a loan of Php 28,000 from Kiva lenders. She plans to purchase stocks of beauty soap, lotion, gas stove and silver wares to sell.

She hopes that someday her business will expand to provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of beauty soap, lotion, gas stove and silver ware to sell

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru: Шафоат замужем. Детей не имеет. 15 лет она занимается швейными услугами. Она сама кроит и шьет национальные платья. У неё свои постоянные клиенты. Услуги портнихи и швеи очень востребованы и прибыльные.  В настоящее время очень востребована компьютерная вышивка на национальных платьях. Вышивки она заказывает другим швеям и это обходится ей дорого. Шафоат хочет  купить современную программную вышивальную машинку. Для реализации этой её мечты она хочет получить займ. Она благодарит вас за поддержку и ждет одобрения займа. Спасибо
texts.en: Shafoat is married and has no children.  She has been involved in sewing services for 15 years.  She cuts and sews national dresses and has loyal clients.  Tailoring and sewing services are in high demand and profitable.  At the present time, computerized embroidery on national dresses is in high demand.  Shafoat uses other seamstresses' services for embroidery, which is expensive.  She want to buy a current programmable embroidery machine.  She wants to obtain this loan to achieve her dream.  Shafoat thanks you for the support and awaits loan approval.  Thank you.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Marlene Del Socorro se dedica a brindar el servicio de gimnasio, tiene más de 12 años en esta actividad. Ella tiene 2 hijos bajo su cargo. Es una madre muy dedicada y disfruta de brindarles lo necesario. Ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de pesas, maquinas para su gimnasio. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido el tener tiempo para su otro negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, Marlene tiene que dividir su tiempo para cuidar el gimnasio y además ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en: Marlene Del Socorro runs a gym for a living. She has been doing this for more than 12 years. She has two children and she is a very dedicated mother, who enjoys providing for her children. She is requesting the loan to buy weights and machines for her gym. She is a very enterprising person and one of her greatest challenges is having enough time for her other business where she sells general goods. Marlene has to split her time between looking after the gym and selling her products.

loans.use: to buy weights and machines for her gym.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Magdalena has a shop that sells used clothing and animal feed by the kilogram for pigs and chickens. She has run this business for four years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of used clothing and sacks of animal feed for resale.
Magdalena has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing and sacks of animal feeds for resale.

loans.name: Sonia Marisol

texts.es:
Sonia es una persona luchadora y emprendedora, le gusta salir adelante en las cosas que hace. Es una mujer soltera de 32 años, tiene 3 hijos de 6, 5 y 2 años de edad, vive con ellos en San Gabriel en el Norte de Ecuador.

Sonia trabaja sola en la crianza y venta de cerdos, empezó a trabajar con su mamá con una cerdita y las ganancias eran a medias con su mamá, pero ahora por sus hijos tiene la necesida de incrementar sus ingresos para poderles mantener y darles el estudi, es por eso que realiza su primer crédito a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de cerdos para hacerlos reproducir y de esta manera que su negocio pueda crecer en cuanto a cantidady unos buenos ingresos.

Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea convertirse en una gran microempresaria.
texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking and enterprising person who likes to succeed in the things that she does.  She is a 32 year-old single mother of 3 children, aged 6, 5 and 2.  She lives with them in San Gabriel in northern Ecuador.

Sonia works alone raising and selling pigs.  She started doing this type of work with her mother and a baby pig, and she shared the earnings with her mother.  But now, because of her children, she needs to increase her income so that she can support them and provide them with an education.  For this reason she is taking her first loan with FODEMI, which she will invest in the purchase of pigs to breed.  In this way her business can grow and generate a good income.

Her dream is to improve her family's quality of life, and she wants to become a great small businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy pigs to breed

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has been running a retail shop for the last three years, and he earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. He is 37 years old and married to Eunice. They have three children.

He has applied for his second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET Ltd. He plans to use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, sweets and tea leaves for sale.

The anticipated profits he will save to provide the basic needs for his family. Andrew hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop in the future

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, sweets and tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es: Luisa  de 22 años vive en el municipio de Soledad con su padre de actividad conductor viajero. Desde hace 4 años cuando no encontró empleo, Luisa decidió emprender su propio negocio,  donde ofrece servicios de llamadas a celulares y vende meriendas y dulces, en un lugar concurrido de este municipio ubicado en el barrio contiguo a su vivienda. Allí le ha ido muy bien porque tiene dinero para su sustento diario y el pago de costos fijos de su negocio, aunque quiere seguir creciendo, su capital de trabajo se vuelve insuficiente para lograrlo, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará 2 planes más  e invertirá en dulces y meriendas para tener muy bien surtido su negocio. Su mayor desafío es lograr tener un local cerca a su casa y vincular computadores para ofrecer servicios adicionales de informática e ir estructurando una infraestructura elegante y muy formal. Esta es la primera vez que Luisa recibe un crédito y con ello iniciará su historial crediticio como su mejor carta de presentación, porque trabaja disciplinadamente y logra cada día alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Lucia, age 22, lives in the municipality of Soledad with her father, whose business is driving travelers.  After 4 years of unemployment, Luisa decided to begin her own business.  She offers cell phone services (to customers who pay to make calls on her phones) and sells snacks and sweets.  She has a popular spot in the town located in the neighborhood next to her home.  There, she has done very well.  She has money for her daily support and to pay the fixed costs of her business.

She wants to continue increasing her working capital which has become insufficient for her to succeed.  This is the reason why she is seeking her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will invest the loan in purchasing 2 more cell phone plans and in sweets and snacks so that she will have a very well stocked business.  Her greatest challenges are succeeding in having a stand close to her house, obtaining computer links in order to offer additional information service, and putting together a more elegant and formal place of business.

This is the first time Luisa has received a loan.  With it she will establish a credit rating as her best calling card, for she is a disciplined worker and succeeds in reaching her goals each day.

loans.use: to purchase 2 more cell phone plans and invest in sweets and snacks.

loans.name: Dorice Nasio

texts.en: Dorice is 36 years old and is married with three children ranging from six to ten years. She describes herself as an ambitious, polite and kind woman. She has been selling clothing material, canvas and linings for the last six years. Her business faces the challenges of low purchasing power and the high cost of materials sold. She will be using the Kes 20,000 to buy canvas, lining and materials. In the future, Dorice hopes and dreams to be a supplier of canvas and materials.

loans.use: To buy canvas, lining and clothing materials.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is from Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Thelma is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Thelma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, catching and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Thelma has been engaged in her business for two years and earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Thelma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Thelma is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Shielenn Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Shielenn; pertenece al banco comunal "MARIA AUXILIADORA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Sebastian perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, 

La socia tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera, la sociase dedica  la compra y venta de productos de belleza, ella vende por catálogos, la socia también se dedica  a la compra y ventad e ropa, la socia suele viajar a la ciudad de Lima y la ciudad de Trujillo para comprar de las diferentes tiendas y fabricas todo tipo de ropa de temporada y de zapatos para traer a vender a sus amistades y clientes en general. En esta ocasión la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ropa y zapatos.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner Shielenn belongs to the communal bank "Maria Auxiliadora".  The bank is located in the San Sebastian District, which belongs to the department of Cusco.

The parter is 22 years old and is single.  She buys and sells beauty products through catalogs.  She also buys and sells clothing.  She usually travels to the cities of Lima and Trujillo to buy all types of seasonal clothing and shoes from the different stores and factories, in order to sell them to her friends and customers in general.  She is asking for a loan on this occasion to invest in the purchase of clothing and shoes.

Shielenn is thankful for the loan, and she promises to follow through with the payment of her dues at the established time.

loans.use: buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Lindi Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her mid 30's is married with three schooling children. She has been running a grocery store for four years now. She works from 4 pm day to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 
   
This will be Amina’ 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to replace the out of stock items for her grocery. She dreams of building her own house and open up a new grocery in town.

Amina, will share this loan with her loan group”LINDI” which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replace the out of stock items for her grocery

loans.name: Alba Rosa

texts.en: For the past 4 years Iâ€™ve dedicated myself to the sale of clothing and shoes for children, women and men. I sell my products to various offices in this city.  I already have a set clientele and I get paid every 15 days or upon delivery. I also sell from my residence with the help of my kids.  This business generates some earnings that allow me to better provide for my household.

loans.use: Buying shoes, blouses for women and girls, sock, menâ€™s undergarments amongst others.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline runs a multipurpose shop in the village where she does hair -dressing, dressmaking and sells secondhand clothing for the community. She has participated in the TEACH lending skills programme of Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a loan of $525 from KIVA Tto expand her business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
Salomat is a member of the group “Humo”. She was one of the creators of the group. She needed money for her business but did not have collateral, so she helped create a solidarity group in order to receive a loan from MicroInvest as a solution for her business. Since 2005, she has been receiving loans from MicroInvest. All of the members of her group are satisfied with that. They never have had difficulties with repayment.

Salomat started her business over 10 years ago. She sells various home appliances, goods for the house, and office supplies. Her children help her in the business. She has $2100 in sales turnover. She makes the trips to the wholesale market herself. Her goal is to improve the quality of the goods sold. That means she will have to buy more expensive goods, but she thinks they will be in demand because of quality. She will use the next loan for the trip to the wholesale market.

loans.use: Trade of home appliances

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica is 26, single and crafts bracelets and belts to support herself and her family. She sells her products in an artesan market in the city (which is about 30 minutes from her home). With her earnings she helps her mother with household expenses because she has four younger siblings who all still attend school. She is a member of the solidarity group "Betania 2." She hopes to invest the loan in the purchase of more thread on wholesale, reducing purchasing costs and increasing her earnings, with which she can better help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

VERONICA TIENE 26 AÑOS, SOLTERA, ELLA HACE PULSERAS Y CINTURONES, Y LOS VENDE EN EL MERCADO ARTESANAL DE LA CIUDAD (SE LOCALIZA A 30 MINUTOS DE SU CASA), CON LAS GANANCIAS QUE OBTIENE LE AYUDA A SU MAMA CON LOS GASTOS QUE SE GENERAN EN SU HOGAR YA QUE TIENE CUATRO HERMANITOS QUE ESTAN ESTUDIANDO. ELLA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO BETANIA 2.CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INVERTIRLO EN HILOS AL POR MAYOR Y ASI REBAJAR LOS COSTOS DE COMPRA Y AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS PARA AYUDAR MEJOR A SU FAMILIA.

loans.use: To craft belts.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: E. Rita is 29 years of age, single but has a child. She has been in business for 14 years. She sells drinks; hair products & sells recharge cards. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the requested loan to buy more recharge cards, drinks, relaxer and hair cream for sale. She equally hopes to buy a sewing machine with herloan. She has been in LAPO for 4 years as a secretary of her union.

loans.use: To buy more recharge cards, drinks, relaxer and hair cream for sale.

loans.name: Isabel Madec

texts.en: Isabel, 42 years old, is married, with six children. Her husband is working on the dustcarts, picking up the rubbish, and doesn't earn sufficient money as to provide a good education and food for the family. To face that situation, Isabel plans to start a small business, selling men's clothes from this holiday season onwards. She has already been a saleswoman, and has a lot of experience. She'll wholesale purchase the clothes in Santo Domingo, the capital, and sell them from her house. Given this loan, Isabel will 'en gran manera' help her husband support their family financially and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To wholesale purchase clothes to start a small business.

loans.name: Talaleu

texts.en: Talaleu is 42 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband works as a mechanic for a local company in town. They have lived on their farm for many years and with the money they make they are able to pay for their children's education. When her husband started working, she looked after the farm, and with the help of her two brothers she has tried hard to improve and develop it. She is delighted to have this opportunity to be able to help support her family.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for her farm

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en: Mrs. P. Phoeun, 50, is a widow with two children, one son and one daughter, who both work. Her husband died under the Khmer rouge regime in year 1978.  Phoeun is living with her children in a village along Mekong River about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been a silk weaver since 1992.  It's a skill she learned from her mother. Before starting her business of weaving, she was a farmer. Phoeun is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $300. She will use this loan to purchase silk material for continuing her silk production business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
N. Rano is 42 years old. She is married with three children. Her elder daughter is already married and two younger ones are still living with their parents.

Rano's husband does not earn much. In order to help him and to support her family, Rano has been running an electrical goods sales business, which is in its 10th year. All the equipment is imported from Uzbekistan and other countries. Her business generates the significant income for her family, allowing them to improve their living conditions.

Rano is requesting US$1,000 for a term of 12 months. Rano intends to spend the loan to purchase new household appliances like refrigerators, electrical ovens and electrical heaters. Rano has been an IMON client since 2001 and has shown herself to be a reliable client with good credit history.

loans.use: To purchase new electrical goods like refrigerators, electrical ovens, electrical heaters for selling.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 34 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are studying in school. His young sister lives with him and is studying in university. He is responsible for her school expenses. He has a car that he operates as a taxi and he has applied to get $1200 to replace his car with a newer one and to do some work on it. He wants to increase his income to provide a better life for his family and help his sister to complete her studies.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Replace his car

loans.name: Amadith

texts.es:
Mrs Amadith F. V. is a member of the Banco Comunal “Picota”. She lives in San Martín, Picota province, Picota district. She says spare car parts from her own home which is in Avendia La Pz, a good place to sell this type of product. She started up in business 11 years ago with an ironmongers business, which was not a great success which is why she decided to move on to selling accessories and parts for motor vehicles. With the loan of S/2 500.00, which she will repay within 6 months, she will buy accessories and car parts such as batteries, side skirts, mudflaps, headlights, spotlights, clutch cables, brakepads. She is 46 years old, with 2 children. Her family has been her motivation.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Amadith F. V. es socia del Banco Comunal “Picota”,vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motos y motocarros, en su propia que se ubica la Av.La Paz, lugar propicio para la venta de este tipo de productos. Se inicio hace 11 años con un negocio de ferretería, que no tuvo los logros esperados por lo que optaron por la venta de accesorios y repuestos los propietarios de vehículos motorizados. Con el préstamo de S/.2,500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará accesorios y repuestos para motos y motocarros como: baterías, tapas laterales, tapabarros, faros, focos intermitentes, cables para embrague, zapatas para frenos, Tiene 46 años y 2 hijos, es su familia quien la impulsa a desarrollarse como mujer,

loans.use: With the loan she will buy accessories for her business

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Doña Marlene is a woman dedicated to the sale of ‘cajetas,’ or homemade caramel, and has a small grocery store. She has thirty years of experience in small businesses, to which she has dedicated all of her life and all of her efforts.

From the time she was very young, upon seeing her son in her arms she decided to look for a source of income to be able to give sustenance to her young one, so she began selling cajetas, and it is for this that she seeks a loan to purchase raw materials to continue producing a larger quantity of cajetas.

Doña Marlene is 51 years old, single, and has a 30 year-old son who is in the United States, helping her with monthly remittances. One of the greatest desires of Doña Marlene is to have a small grocery story where she can sell a greater amount of sweets, and the other, which is no less important, is to see her son again after having gone so long without seeing him.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Marlene es una señora que se dedica a la venta de cajetas y tiene una pequeña pupería. Tiene 30 años de estar en estos pequeños negocios a los cuales le ha dedicado toda su vida y todo su esfuerzo.

Desde muy joven al verse con su hijo en brazos decidió buscar una fuente de ingresos para poder darle el sustento al pequeño, es así como empezó la venta de cajetas, y es para eso que solicita el préstamo, para la compra de materia prima para seguir elaborando mayor cantidad de cajetas.

Doña Marlene tiene 51 años de edad es soltera y tiene un hijo de 30 años de edad y se encuentra en Estados Unidos, él le ayuda con remesas mensuales. Uno de los mayores anhelos de dona Marlene es llegar a tener una pequeña empresa donde pueda comercializar a mayores cantidades de dulces, y el otro pero no menos importante es poder volver a encontrarse nuevamente con su hijo al que tiene mucho tiempo sin ver.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for homemade caramel

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard H. is thirty year old businessman. He is married with two children, who are both in school. He is a small scale manufacturer of tin pepper near the community market. He buys fresh and dry pepper, mills and processes them into canned pepper, and then supplies them to food vendors and restaurant operators. His operation is on a limited scale due to inadequate capital to buy machines for the processing.

Bernard wants to take advantage of the loan opportunity to buy more raw materials and equipment to increase his efficiency and produce in larger quantities. He believes this can help expand his business to produce a larger income to help finance his children’s education.

He belongs to the community group called Nyame Boafo ("The helping God") Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and act as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials and equipment to manufacture tin pepper.

loans.name: Desak Wiratni

texts.id:
Desak Wiartni recently follows her child's footstep to obtain a loan from Dinari foundation. In her first loan, Desak Wiartni obtained a loan for Rp 2,000,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00) that she used to expand her pig farming business. Since she only owned a mother pig, Desak Wiartni bought 4 more piglets for a Total price of Rp 1,000,000 for fattening. During a 6 month period, usually she could harvest 2 times. Feed expenses for 3 months are Rp 300,000. Profit are about Rp 1,0000,000 for 3 months. She hopes for the future that her pig farming business could expand larger, and could increase profit so that her family's living standard could increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Desak Wiartni baru mengikuti jejak anaknya yang sudah bergabung mendapat pinjaman dari Yayasan Dinari. Untuk Pinjaman pertama ini Desak Wiratni memperoleh pinjaman sebesar Rp. 2.000.000,- yang dipergunakan untuk mengembangkan usaha ternak babinya.Berhubung sudah mempunyai satu induk Desak Wiratni membeli lagi 4 ekor bibit babi dengan total harga Rp.1.000.000,- untuk dipelihara secara penggemukan. Dalam 1 periode selama 6 bulan biasanya dapat memanen sebanyak dua kali. Biaya pengeluaran selama tiga bulan untuk membeli pakan sebesar Rp.300.000,-.Keuntungan sebesar Rp. 1.000.000,- dapat diperoleh selama tiga bulan.Harapan untuk kedepannya dari usaha ternak babinya dapat berkembang lebih besar lagi dan mendapat keuntungan lebih meningkat sehingga taraf hidup keluarganya menjadi lebih baik.

loans.use: To buy 4 piglets (Membeli 4 ekor anak babi)

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en: Mrs. Sochea R. is a vegetable-seller in Tie Prumpie Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Because her business is going well she wants to expand it. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy different kinds of vegetables to sell. With part of the loan she will also fix her house. Mrs. Sochea R. is a 37-year-old widow with a child who is attending school. Previously, Mrs. Sochea R. obtained a loan to buy rice. She has fully repaid that loan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Kadiatou Diakité est âgée de  27 ans et vit avec ses 2 enfants et son mari dans une famille monogame au  quartier Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (préfecture de Bougouni troisième région économique de la république du Mali).
Ayant vite abandonné les études pour des raisons sociales, elle mena plusieurs  activités génératrices de revenus sans succès mais finit par se spécialiser depuis maintenant 8 ans dans l’achat vente des vêtements d’occasion autrement dit la friperie. Elle a appris cette activité  auprès d’une amie.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires Madame Kadiatou Diakité a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est à sa première expérience.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 3 balles de vêtements d’occasion de différentes variétés (pour enfants, draps et serviettes). Elle méne cette activité devant son domicile à Heremakono Nord et au marché de Bougouni tous les (jeudi) jours de foire, où elle réalise le plus de vente. Elle a une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes, de hotels et exerce cette activité durant toute l’année. 
Elle s’approvisionne généralement  à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des sociétés importatrices des friperies et en république du Burkina Faso.
 Madame Kadiatou Diakité  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, aider  son mari à assurer les dépenses de la famille (santé, éducation, nourriture, etc....) et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadiatou Diakité, 27, lives with her two children and her husband in a monogamous family in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood of the town of Bougouni (Bougouni Prefecture, third economic region of the Republic of Mali.)

Having abandoned her studies early for societal reasons, she tried several different money-earning activities without success and ended up specializing for the past 8 years in selling fairly used clothing. She learned this business from a friend.

In her search for complementary financial resources, Mrs. Kadiatou Diakité decided to join the credit program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom she is having her first experience as a borrower.

She intends to use this loan to buy three bales of used clothing of different sorts (for children, sheets and napkins). She runs her business out of her home in Heremakono Nord and at the market in Bougouni on Thursday market days. She has a clientele essentially composed of women and of hotels and works at this business all year round.

She generally buys her merchandise in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from companies that import used clothing and in the Republic of Burkina Faso.

Mrs. Kadiatou Diakité hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and to help her husband cover family expenses (health, education, food, etc.). She will reinvest any remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Solidaridad Aa Group

texts.en:
The Solidaridad AA group consists of three men and 11 women who live in Sucre, in south-central Bolivia. Most of the group members are mothers of young children. They are involved in a variety of economic activities: sewing skirts and athletic clothing; selling cell phones; knitting shawls and sweaters; selling cookies, fruits and vegetables; driving taxis; selling beauty products and cosmetics; and running a neighborhood store. Most of the group members have between one and seven years of experience in their respective businesses, with the exception of Angela and Dora (who knit shawls and sweaters and sew athletic clothing, respectively), who both have more than fifteen years of experience.

Most of the group members will use their Kiva loans to buy more bulk merchandise to sell or to buy more raw materials for making clothing. This is the group's first loan. Their loan officer describes them as a very responsible and entrepreneurial group.

loans.use: Buy materials to make clothing or buy bulk merchandise to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea S., 26 and the mother of two children aged two and three, is a farmer in Dock Por Village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Yem Koem, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income that contributes to the support of their family. Although Mrs. Chea S. and her husband have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions.

In order to improve their lives, Mrs. Chea S. is requesting a loan to buy piglets in order to start a breeding business. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es: Nimia tiene 62 años, es madre soltera, en la actualidad vive con 4 de sus 8 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales, las vende durante todo el día fuera de su casa, este negocio lo tiene desde hace un año. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y que estos se sientan satisfechos al momento y después de comprar sus productos. Este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que es la única persona que vende estos productos regionales en su zona, muy aparte de encontrarse ubicada en un lugar muy transitable. Le va muy bien en su negocio. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para proteger sus frutas de los rayos solares u otras impurezas y así vender tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Nimia is 62 years old she is a single mother and currently lives with 4 of her 8 children. She works selling fruits during the day outside her house, for the past year. What she enjoys most is to provide good service to her clients so they feel satisfied when they buy her products. The business is very profitable because she is the only person selling regional products on her location, which has lots of transit also, so her business is going very well. Is the first time she solicits a loan with MFP. With the money she wants to build a kiosk to protect her fruits from the sunshine and other impurities and sell her products with calm.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk to sell her products

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés tiene 36 años de edad, conviviente, tiene dos hijos muy pequeños aun, él y su esposa trabajan en la chacra. Desde muy niño se dedicó a la agricultura, ahora que tiene su familia con mayor razón está sembrando varias hectáreas de frutos cítricos, carambolas y mangos, lo bueno nos dice, que las carambolas producen constantemente y se puede cosechar progresivamente, solo se le tiene que fumigar contra las mosquitas con insecticidas muy fuertes para que puedan erradicar estos insectos que afectan a todo cítrico. A Moisés le agrada su trabajo, sobre todo le es muy rentable, porque durante todos los meses del año puede cosechar mientras que estén bien cuidadas las plantas, la dificultad mayor son las plagas afectan sus cultivos. Es su 3er préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Después de tanta entrega a la agricultura, ahora quiere invertir en la implementación de una pequeña bodega, el resto del dinero será usado en la compra de insecticidas para fumigar sus frutas.
texts.en:
Moisés is 36 years old, is in a civil union, and has two small children. He and his wife work on a small farm. He has been a farmer since he was very young, and now that he has a family he is especially motivated to succeed. He plants several hectares of citrus, star fruit, and mangoes. The good thing about star fruit trees is that they bear fruit and can be harvested continually, though they must be fumigated with insecticides to eradicate mosquitoes. Moisés is very grateful for his job, especially since it is so profitable. As long as his trees are well-tended he can harvest all year long. His main difficulty is in dealing with the insects that effect his crops.

This is Moisés's third loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. After so much time farming, he would like to invest in having a small general store. The remaining amount of the loan will be used to purchase insecticides to fumigate his fruit trees.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides for his crops

loans.name: Leticia Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Leticia tiene 28 años de edad, habita en el  barrio La Primavera, en la capital de Managua,  casada su esposo es conductor de transporte urbano, tiene dos lindos hijos de 2 y 10 años de edad, sus planes para su familia construir su vivienda, dejándole un patrimonio seguro y sólido a sus hijos. Doña Leticia posee su pequeño negocio de variedades desde hace seis años, iniciándolo con préstamos, sus objetivos para su negocio a corto plazo es ampliarlo y aumentar el volumen de venta con nuevos productos, también invertir en una unidad de taxi. Con la solicitud del préstamo lograra comprar nuevos productos como: ropa para dama, caballero y niños, articulo de hogar, artículos escolares y juguetes para comercializarlo a nuevos mercados, generándole mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Señora Leticia is 28 years old, married, and lives in the Primavera neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Her husband is a conductor on urban transit. She has two handsome sons, ages two and ten. Their plans for the family are to build their house and leave a solid and secure inheritance for their sons. Doña Leticia's business is a small variety store which she started six years ago with the help of loans. Her business objectives in the short term are to enlarge the business and increase the volume of sales with new products, and also to invest in a taxi. With the help of this loan she will be able to buy new products such as: clothing for women, men and children, household articles, school supplies and toys. This will allow her to expand her business into new markets and generate increased profits.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar ropa variada para niños, adultos y articulos escolares

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Sourn S. is 64 years old and works with her husband growing rice and vegetables. She is the mother of four children and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. One of her children is a student and three are professional tailors. Sourn S. is asking for a loan to purchase a sewing machine for her children to operate a tailor shop.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Nuk

texts.en: N. is a 48-year-old widower and he earns his living by driving a taxi motorbike, earning an average of US$ 4.50 each day. He currently begins his business early in the morning, picking up passengers and coming back home in the evening with his income. Beside this, he also is a rice farmer. He is a very responsible father for his one child who is a teenager. N. is requesting a loan of $500 to plant rice in the dry season. The loan will allow them to have more income.

loans.use: To plant rice in the dry season

loans.name: Honoria

texts.en:
Honoria M. owns a small "sari-sari" store. She is 53 years old and has 4 children. Her children are studying and frequently ask her for money to help pay for books and other school projects. Besides running the store, Honoria is a seamstress. She makes good quality dresses that she sells to her regular customers when she is not busy in her store. She cuts and sews fabric to generate additional income for the family.

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. She believes buying more goods will attract more customers. She wants to increase the size of her store to earn a bigger income.

CEVI helps Honoria sustain her business. CEVI provides her with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage to help her business grow.

loans.use: Buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en: Mrs. D. is a resident of Capundag, Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ. She operates a "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) business located at Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She’s 47 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom are working. Her husband is a farmer but also helps manage their business. Her children gave them the capital to open a used clothing retail business. She’s planning to expand the business but she lacks capital. When she became a member of Paglaum, she readily took a loan for her 1st cycle. She’s now on her 2nd cycle and is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy additional bundles of used clothing. Her hope and aspiration is that her business will expand and become stable in the future and provide a decent life for the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Cecilia es casada, tienen 48 años y 6 hijos, Cecilia vende golosinas variadas de manera ambulatoria en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, su negocio esta ubicado al frente de una universidad. Además los fines de semana viaja a las ferias en donde vende verduras.
Cecilia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras y golosinas.
Los sueños de Cecilia son techar su casa para alquilar y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the Maria Antonieta Communal Bank. Cecilia is married, is 48 years old and has 6 children. Cecilia sells varied sweets as a traveling salesperson in a centrally located street in the city of Ayacucho. Her business is located in front of a university. In addition, on the weekends she travels to markets where she sells vegetables. Cecilia needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of vegetables and sweets. Cecilia's dreams are to put a roof on her house in order to rent it and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of vegetables and sweets.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana M., 43, is married and has six children, two sons and four daughters, some of whom are in senior high school while the others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Juliana works to support her husband, a farmer, in providing for the family by trading in smoked fish. Juliana buys the fish from markets in nearby communities and sells them at the local market on a table top. She has been in business for twenty years and is now requesting a loan to procure smoked fish in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
After finishing her high school studies, Vilma got married to Victor A. and they live happily at Barangay Aliaga Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They were blessed with four children. Three of them are now in their college education, therefore, they have to work hard to provide their children with their important needs.

They earn income thru farming as their major source of livelihood while Vilma manages a general store as an alternative source of income to support their daily needs. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 so that she will be able to expand her selling business further. She also hopes to improve her store by saving little amounts from her daily income. She believes that she will become successful in her business endeavor through patience and hard work.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Yasmeen Muhammad Younas Group

texts.en:
My name is Yasmeen and I live in a city of shrines named Borewala, Pakistan. I own a two room brick house and have been living in it with my family for the past 14 years. My husband, M. Y., has a timber-selling business and has been in the profession for the past 5 years. I handle my embroidered clothes business. I do this work to pay off the utilities and to ease the financial burden on my husband. I am applying for a loan to buy timber to grow my husband’s timber-selling business. 

I’m the group leader of four other women from my locality. Maqboolan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Safia baji wants a loan to buy a donkey for loading. Zarina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Yasmeen baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan and, the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora J. is from the town of Marapong Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 57 years old. Nora is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Nora operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the community. Nora has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Nora joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Nora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Nora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sav

texts.en: Mrs. Sav N. lives in Samraung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who grows both rice and vegetables to sell. She is a 63-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other stays at home to do housework. Mrs. Sav N. needs a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to earn income and improve her family's standard of living with this loan after she sells the cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Ayobami

texts.en: Ayobami is 45 years old and married with three children. She sells drinks. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Sara Miguelina

texts.en:
Señora Sara is 63 years old.  She and her husband live with their 15-year-old adopted son.  Sara has a business making handicrafts such as earring and accessory stands, placemats, and embroidered cloths and towels.  She also hand-decorates shoes.  Her husband sells cell phones and other phone equipment.  Sara and her husband also earn income by renting rooms in their home in the city of Pucallpa.

Sara has been working with Manuela Ramos for nine years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Almendras” (The Almonds).  She plans to use this loan of 2000 soles to invest in materials for decorating shoes and also in improving the doors for the rooms that she rents.  

Sara can count on her husband’s support for her business ventures.  She and her husband are completing the construction of more rooms to rent out on the second floor of their home.  Sara also owns a piece of land outside the city where she grows plantains, maize, and fruits.  Sara’s goal is to have good earnings from this piece of land (as well as from her other business ventures) so that she can contribute to the household income.

loans.use: Materials for decorating shoes; improvement of doors for rooms for rent

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA., a 22-year-old man living in the Bekaa, has owned an internet cafe since 2007. BilA. decided on this business because he likes computers and wanted to work independently. His clients are his friends and neighbors. BilA. knows how to treat his clients, and his clients feel at ease. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network.

BilA. has requested a loan of $1000 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his café and start selling recharge mobile cards. This is the first time that BilA. has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on improving and expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his café and to start selling recharge mobile cards

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre de 37 años, vive con Jesús, su esposo, y su hijo Yomar de 6 añitos, en su casa propia. Ella y su esposo trabajan incansablemente para brindarle a su hijo un futuro mejor, por ello su negocio de venta de madera lleva el nombre de su hijo, una manera de cábala para tener suerte en el negocio. Es así que hace algunos años esta actividad se ha convertido en la fuente de ingresos de la familia, pues gracias al empeño con que lo realizan obtienen buenas ganancias. Desde entonces, Jesús viaja constantemente a otras ciudades para dejar los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, siendo su trabajo de mucha demanda, mientras que Hilda administra todos los pedidos que van llegando. Ambos están muy contentos con su trabajo porque saben que en el futuro cosecharán buenos frutos, ya que su negocio va creciendo poco a poco y será cada vez más rentable. 
Este es el segundo préstamo de Hilda con MFP y ha demostrado ser muy puntual en todos los pagos, de sus créditos anteriores. El dinero que ahora solicita será para la comprar mayor cantidad de madera, la cual venderán en otras ciudades para aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
