“Victory is always possible to a person who never stops fighting,” says Ruel as he shares his guiding principle in life. Ruel is 21 years old and resides in the village of San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela. He is still single and is engaged in a small business. He still lives with his parents and is proud that he is able to assist his parents with their daily needs.  

Ruel is a vendor of frozen foods in his village. Aside from this, he also sells electronic load for additional income.  He aspires to be more progressive in his business and to be able to have another source of livelihood in their village. For this reason, he is requesting a loan amounting to 8,000 Philippine pesos that he can use for business growth. He is very determined to achieve his dreams; that is the reason why he gives his full attention to his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to grow his business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es una mujer de 36 años, su deseo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos lo necesario para su educación, además que dentro de casa también trata de inculcarles buenos principios.

Desde que se separó de su esposo tuvo que desempeñarse en diversas actividades y una de ellas es la venta de cosméticos, labor que siempre le agradó. Bertha considera que las relacionarse interpersonales son la base de su negocio, pues cada persona que conoce, se convierte en su cliente. 
Sin embargo, lo difícil de este negocio es recorrer diversos lugares en busca de nuevos clientes, por lo que tiene que caminar mucho y tocar varias puertas.
Sus planes a futuro son de conseguir un local donde pueda instalar una tienda para vender accesorios para damas, pues es una de las actividades más rentables en su localidad.

Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, por tanto desea trabajar con responsabilidad para no defraudar la confianza depositada en su persona. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará materiales navideños para realizar adornos artesanales y venderlos a sus clientas de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 36 year old woman who desires to improve her living conditions. She also wants to provide her two children with an education and a home where she can instill in them good principles.

Since separating from her husband, Bertha has had to take on numerous jobs with one of them being the sale of cosmetics. She has always enjoyed this type of work. Bertha finds that interpersonal relationships are the foundation of her business because she is able to convert anyone she meets into a customer. However, her work is difficult because she has to travel to different places in search of new customers. This requires a lot of walking and knocking on many doors. Her future plans include opening a shop where she can sell women’s accessories, since this is one of the most profitable types of businesses in her area.

Bertha is taking her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Therefore, she is willing to work responsibly so that she does not betray the trust that was placed in her. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase materials for making Christmas ornaments and handicrafts and selling them to the customers who already buy cosmetics from her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making Christmas ornaments & handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Miss Socheat H., 24, is single (she is not in the photo, but her mother was available instead). She has 7 siblings and lives with her mother in a small village along National Road Number 5 about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Socheat has been a garment factory worker for 6 years. Her mother is a rice farmer. Socheat is requesting her first loan of US$ 600 to pay school fees for her brother who is learning motorcycle repair skills and help as capital for her mother in her farming business.

loans.use: To pay school fee for brother and as capital for her mother

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn S., 46, is married with two children.  She resides in Battambong Province, Cambodia with her husband and younger child, who is enrolled at a local high school. To make a living, she sells various kinds of fruits at a local market in the town.  She earns approximately US $16 per day, which is the primary income for the family. Her husband helps her with the business every day. The family is also assisted by her older child, who is a hair dresser earning an income of US $3 per day. 

S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $600 to purchase in-stock oranges from the local farmers in her province. She hopes that she will be able to generate better profits when she sells these oranges back to her customers.

loans.use: to buy in-stock oranges from local farmers

loans.name: Hermonisa

texts.en:
Hermonisa N. wishes that her business will become successful someday. Accessing loans through ASHI, a Kiva field partner in the Philippines, is one of the greatest opportunities which has enabled her to start reaching for her goal. Along with the business success she is dreaming about, graduation of her three children aged from a month old to five years old is also her greatest hope. The proceeds of her business give her money to support the immediate and basic needs of her family.

Despite hardship brought about by poverty to her and her family, Hermonisa remains strong and determined to change her family’s standard of living. The love and support she and her husband give to one another makes Hermonisa’s life meaningful. The desire to give her children a brighter tomorrow is the reason she keeps in her mind and heart not to surrender to poverty.

loans.use: To finance her rice buy and sell business

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 38 year old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his wife. Ziad works as an electrician, and he also owns a farm where he has had cows for nineteen years. Ziad decided on having a farm which allows him to sell dairy products like milk, cheese, etc. His second job, as an electrician, is the job that he always wanted to do. These two jobs allow him to take care of his family’s needs.

Ziad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase feed for his cows and tools for his work as an electrician. This is the first time that Ziad has requested a loan.

Ziad is special in his work because he is known for his good dairy products. His clients are his friends and neighbors, as well as people from outside his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. In the future, he plans to keep on improving both of his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his cows and tools for his electrician business.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Valerie S. N. tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija la cual actualmente se encuentra estudiando en la universidad y desde hace mas de 30 años la señora S. se dedica a impartir clases como profesora.

Esta profesora desde hace dos años a estado administrando un centro de bachillerato por madurez, el cual consiste en formar a personas adultas en niveles de bachillerato, este centro es intensivo y se da los días domingo y tiene demanda partiendo que los alumnos son trabajadores que no tienen tiempo de estudiar en los otros días de la semana.

Sin embargo el gobierno esta solicitando a través del ministerio de educación algunos requisitos mínimos como lo son que los estudiantes tengan acceso a la tecnología, por lo que la profesora S. necesita se le financie para comprar lo siguiente:


Una computadora que esta valorada en US 450 dólares y una impresora que esta valorada en US 250 dólares.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Valerie S. N. is 59 years old. She is a single mother. She has a daughter who is now studying at the university, and for 30 years, Señora S. has been giving classes as a teacher.

For two years, she has been administrator of an adult education center, which educates adults through the completion of secondary school. The classes at this center are intensive and are given on Sundays. There is demand because the students are workers who do not have time to study the other days of the week.

However, the government is requesting through the ministry of education some minimum requirements, such as the students having access to technology. For this reason, Señora S. needs to be financed to buy the following: a computer that is valued at US $450 and a printer that is valued at US $250.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer and a printer

loans.name: Rusell

texts.en:
Rusell G. is from the village of Southwestern Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Rusell is married and has 1 school age child. To make a living, Rusell owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling meat products including pork and beef in the public market. Rusell has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rusell joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rusell has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Rusell is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rusell from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita A. is a married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing and fish-vending business. Her 57-year-old husband, Rogelio, is a fisherman and whatever he catches, she sells to her community. Margarita lives in Talusan Brgy. Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their four children aged between 22 and 27. One child already has a family, and the rest are working.
Margarita has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 1992. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and fish-vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 11,000 PHP.
Margarita is now borrowing 29,500 PHP to buy a new fishing net and materials to repair her pump boat. This will be her sixteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Margarita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure its future wellbeing by following the 'Dungganon' way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net and materials to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Reynalyn

texts.en:
Reynalyn A. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Camp Philips, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Reynalyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Reynalyn owns and operates a business of making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Reynalyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $100 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Reynalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynalyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
Adriano is a 50-year-old rice farmer who is married and is the father of two kids. His oldest child, who goes to school, is only 17 years old. His family depends on his farm so he works hard to make it productive.

Adriano joined CEVI, an MFI (micro-finance institute), in 2008. He said that its program has been really helpful to his business. He also likes its low interest rate. Adriano is currently requesting a loan of Php 14,000, which he would use to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a rice farmer in Talibon, Bohol. She needs farm inputs to operate her rice field. But she lacks capital. That's why she sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP. This loan will enable her to provide the supplies needed for her farm. Lolita wishes her family good health and to be able to eat their meals everyday. Rice farming is the only way she can provide the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en:
Bayarjargal is 38 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Four of her children, age 11-17, attend local secondary and primary schools. 

Bayarjargal operates a traditional Mongolian boot manufacturing business with her husband. They produce boots for men, women and children. Bayarjargal and her husband have been operating their business since July 2009, and have become experienced at shoe manufacturing. They have built a loyal customer base. Bayarjargal usually sells her products for cash, although she sometimes barters her boots for meat and dairy products. The cost of her boots depends on how many ornaments are included in a pair. Children's boots cost 10,000 – 15,000 tugrugs (~  7 – 10 USD), and adult boots cost between 60,000 and 80,000 tugrugs (~  42 – 60 USD). Bayarjargal and her husband have the capacity to produce 4-5 pairs of boots per month. Their monthly profit is 80,000 – 150,000 tugrugs (~  60 – 110 USD). Bayarjargal is a very hardworking person and has many plans for the future. She says, “I would like to expand my business and purchase my own plot of land with a yard.” 

She is requesting a 150,000 tugrug (~  110 USD) loan to purchase leather and other materials used to manufacture Mongolian boots.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Petronille

texts.en:
Petronille is 44 years old, married with 7 children.  Petronille works hard at selling a variety of goods in her shop.  Those goods include soaps, body lotion, cooking oil, toilet paper, etc.  Petronille has been in this business for about 6 years, and the hours of her business are from 6 am to 8 pm every day except Sunday.

Petronille needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company, which hopefully will allow her to expand her shop through purchasing a variety of goods such as sugar, rice, beans, different types of flour, etc… She will also sell some drinks like sodas, juice.  With this expansion, Petronille will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will be used for the further reinvestment in her business and saving for the future.

loans.use: The purchase of a variety of goods such as sugar, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: LA SRA. FLORA VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, EN EL BARRIO SAN MARTIN DE DICHA LOCALIDAD, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CHOFER EN UN RADIO MOVIL(TRANSPORTE DE PERSONAS URBANO), TIENEN 2 HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO SOLICITADO ES PARA COMPRAR UN EXHIBIDOR DE TORTA, PARA SU NEGOCIO,  SU ACTIVIDAD ES LA VENTA DE JUGO DE FRUTAS Y LA VENTA DE TORTA, SE SIENTE AGRADECIDAD CON LA INSTITUCION POR BRINDARLE EL APOYO ECONOMICO FINANCIERO, PARA SEGUIR CRECIENDO EN SU ECONOMIA, Y AYUDARLE A SU ESPOSO EN EL SUSTENTO DE SU HOGAR.
texts.en:
Flora lives in the town of El Torno, 40 km from the city of Santa Cruz, in the San Martin neighbourhood. Her husband works as a driver in a radiomovil (an urban mode of human transportation). They have 2 school-aged children. The requested loan is destined for the purchase of a display case for cakes, for her business. She sells fruit juice and cakes. She is grateful to the institution for offering her this economic support. This will help her to continue growing financially, and to help her husband with household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: an increase in working capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Marina;  ella tiene 36 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia vende papa en el mercado modelo de Urubamba, desde hace 10 años, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar de los proveedores al mayoreo papa de todo tipo y bolsas de rafia para almacenar sus papas y llevarlos a vender al mercado, donde la socia tiene su stand.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marina C. S. belongs to the "Perolniyoc" community bank; she lives in the province of Urubamba, Cusco. She is 36, lives with her partner and has 2 children. She does housework and retail; she has sold potatoes in the Urubamba Modelo market for 10 years. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy all types of potatoes wholesale from providers, and raffia bags to store the potatoes and bring them to sell in the market, where she has her stand. She is grateful for, and values the support offered through this loan and promises to repay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of potatoes

loans.name: Jay Dawn

texts.en: Jay Dawn P. is from Oroquitea City. She is 26 years old and single. To make a living, Jay Dawn owns and operates a business providing motor transport services like "habal-habal" (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers). Jay Dawn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2007, Jay Dawn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jay Dawn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jay Dawn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Jay Dawn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete his stock, buy more seeds and ready his land for cultivation

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is a 51 year old business person. She is married and has one child. Her husband is also a business man. She has basic business skills; her business is located along Church Street in Makeni city. Mariama has been selling food to a large number of families both in Makeni Township and its surrounding villages for the past 8 years.She got her initial business capital from a family member. She starts selling at 7:30am and is back home around 6:30pm daily.

Mariama is now soliciting a loan of 3,000,000 in order to buy variety of food for her business. She believes this will help her satisfy her customers and generate more profit, so that her business will continue to grow. 

Mariama intends to educate her child to university level and buy a piece of land from the proceeds of this loan.

loans.use: To buy additional palm oil (food).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase hardware supplies

loans.name: Mario Anibal

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es el  Sr. Mario; el tiene 29 años de edad y es soltero y el socio se dedica a prestar servicio de seguridad, el socio también tiene su negocio familiar de fabricación y venta de velas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la fabricación de velas para la venta.        

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “United for Success” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Mario, he is 29 years old, single and he is a security guard. Mr. Mario also has his family business in making and selling candles. The member needs the loan to buy materials to make candles to sell.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet the payments of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy materials to make candles to sell.

loans.name: Burul's Group

texts.en:
Burul I. is the leader of this group. She is forty-five and married. She has three children: her two sons are twenty-five and twenty-three and her daughter is elven years old. Her sons are construction workers and her daughter goes to school. Her husband is a construction worker and he earns 7,000 soms monthly. She farms and breeds cattle with the help of her children. 

She started her business three years ago with initial investment of 14,000 soms. She has been able to increase the number of cattle she owns, purchase furniture, and increase her income to 3,000 soms monthly.  She is applying for a loan in order to purchase additional cattle and increase her profits. In the future, she is planning to buy more cattle, a car, and a plot of land in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan).

Group members:

Kanyshtyk S. is forty-seven and divorced. She has seven children: her sons are twenty-seven, twenty-six, twenty-three, and nineteen, and her daughters are twenty-five, twenty-two and eighteen years old. Her elder son is a construction worker in Bishkek, her second son is married and lives with his family in Kazakhstan, and her youngest son is a general worker and lives with Kanyshtyk. Her daughters are married and live with their families. 

She sells convenience goods. Six years ago, she decided to rent a small shop and purchased convenience goods for 1,000 soms. She has been able to increase her turnover and marry her sons and daughters. She is planning to expand her business. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase additional convenience goods for increasing her turnover. In the future, she is planning to expand her business and increase her turnover to 50,000 soms, marry her youngest son and purchase furniture. 

Nazgul Y. is thirty-six and married. She has three children: her sons are eight and one and her daughter is twelve years old. Her elder son and daughter go to school and her youngest son is at home. He husband resells agricultural products. 

Also, together with her husband, Nazgul is farming. She started ten years ago with initial investment of 2,000 soms following the suggestion of their relatives. Now, she earns 3,000 soms monthly. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase necessary things for farming. This Autumn, she is planning to sow garlic, build a shed and make repairs to her house. 

Damira I. is forty-three and married. She has two sons of twenty and three years old. Her elder son is a tractor driver and her youngest son is at home. Her husband is a merchant. She helps her husband in his business. They sell convenience goods and office and school accessories. 

They started five years ago by renting a place at the local market where they were selling convenience goods. Their initial investment was 15,000 soms. For now, they could increase their turnover and purchase household appliances and increase their income to 4,000 soms. 

She is applying for a loan in order to purchase goods for increasing their turnover. They are planning to purchase office and school accessories for new academic year and expect high returns. In the future, they are planning to open a shop, increase their turnover and purchase a car. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line--People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan   Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Yung

texts.en: Mrs. Yung S. H. was born in 1978 and is a villager in Angk Svay Chek village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Lorng Dy Ya, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She is also a knitter and her husband is a fisherman. Her problem is that her field is far away from an irrigation system. So, to improve production, Mrs. Yung S. H. is asking for a loan to buy a pump machine and fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will dig a well. She is a mother of a child who is four years old. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine and fertilizer

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAÏDOU est Composé essentiellement de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier HEREMAKONO de la ville de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
A travers les relations d’amitiés et de mariage, ces femmes se sont connues et mènent le commerce de céréales, la restauration et la vente des tubercules avec KADIA S. qui a un enfant assis sur ses pieds dans la photo. 
Dans l’intention de faire le grossiste et satisfaire les clients, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame KADIA S. fait le commerce des tubercules dans le marché de BOUGOUNI.  Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 200kg d’igname, 300kg de patate douce et 100kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des fournisseurs de la ville de SIKASSO. Toutes les ventes se font dans le marché de BOUGOUNI en gros et en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt le elle espère réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel de 
40000 FCFA tandis que les autres membres du groupe comptent sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000F CFA dont une partie sera réutilisé dans l’entreprise, et l’autre partie dans les frais éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The Laïdou group is made up mainly of married women, who average 25 years of age with an average of two children each. They live in nuclear families with their children and husbands, in the Heremakono district of the town of Bougouni, in the Republic of Mali's third administrative region. 

These women met each other through friends and marriage and have businesses in the cereal trade, restauration and the sale of tubers (the latter being carried out by Kadia S., the lady with the child sat at her feet in the photo).

With the aim of becoming wholesalers and satisfying customer demand, they decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their third group loan from the institution; all the previous loans have been repaid correctly. 

Mrs. Kadia S. sells tubers at the market in Bougouni. With this loan she is planning to buy 200kg of yams, 300kg of sweet potatoes and 100kg of ordinary potatoes. She stocks up from suppliers in the town of Sikasso and sells all her produce in the market at Bougouni, on a wholesale and retail basis, for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. 

With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000FCFA, while the other members of the group are counting on making a monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, part of which will be used for their businesses and part for their children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase of tubers

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta S., a married woman who lives in Sitio Sta. Cruz, Brgy. Don Virgilio, Medellin, Cebu, earns her living by operating a fishing business. Her husband, Jaime S., 51 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children who are between 9 and 29 years old.

Loreta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Loreta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to buy fishing gear so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Loreta S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Thị (20201070033) is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  

To make a living, M. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  M. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,800,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future.  

M. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 5th loan she has taken out from SEDA.  M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


M. Nguyễn Thị (20201070033) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, M. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  M. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  M. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  M. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & supplies

loans.name: Menardo

texts.en:
Menardo A. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. He is 30 years old. Menardo is married and has 3 very young children. To make a living, Menardo owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling green bananas & vegetables like squash and eggplants in the local community. Menardo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Menardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Menardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Menardo is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Menardo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Dolores

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.
 
La señora Rosa es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben para incrementar sus negocios. Tiene 39 años y está separada pero de esa relación que tuvo cuatro hijos  de 17, 14, 11 y 2 años los dos mayores estudian en colegio, otro en escuela.
 
Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 21h00, nos cuenta que no le dificulta vender hasta más tarde ya que su tienda la tiene en su casa, además de productos de primera necesidad también vende productos de Avon y Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería,  y accesorios para damas). Su mercadería la compra en Bahía  y Portoviejo. Recibe en su local parte de la mercadería.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, enlatados, etc.  Su sueño es tener un mini market con todas las comodidades para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The members of the Marianita de Jesús communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Rosa is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because of the help they get to increase business.  She is 39 years old and separated.  She has four children who are 17, 14, 11, and 2 years of age.  The two oldest go to secondary school and the other one is in elementary school.

She has a small grocery store.  She’s open every day from 6am until 9pm.  She says it isn’t difficult to stay open so late because the store is in her home.  Besides groceries she also sells Avon and Esika brand products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She buys her merchandise in Bahía and in Portoviejo.  Some of her merchandise is delivered to her location.

She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, canned goods, etc.  Her dream is to have a minimarket with all the comforts for her customers.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Marta Mayra

texts.es:
Doña Marta mujer emprendedora de oficio comerciante con su propio micro empresa de elaboración de rosquillas, viejitas y otros productos a base de maíz. Siendo los productos horneados una de las mayores tradiciones de Nicaragua. Tiene como planes principales el mejorar el nivel de vida, vive con su mamá, y desde muy pequeña aprendió el oficio de horneadora poniéndolo en práctica desde hace 6 años siendo su medio de trabajo, ha encontrado como dificulta que su mamá se enfermo siendo ella la que asume todo los gastos de medicamentos, bueno superándolo y  siguiendo con su trabajo para cumplir sus planes. 
Con este nuevo financiamiento comprara materias primas como: maíz, queso, manteca, dulce, leña y otros productos. Logrando ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad y obteniendo mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marta is an enterprising woman who is a saleswoman by trade.  She has her own small business where she makes 'rosquillas' (a kind of doughnut), 'viejitas' (a traditional Nicaraguan sweet pastry) and other products made from corn.  Baked products are one of Nicaragua's biggest traditions.

Marta's main goal is to improve her standard of living.  She lives with her mom and she learned the trade of baker when she was very small.  She put her knowledge into practice as a job six years ago.  She encountered problems when her mom became sick as Marta is the one who covers the cost of all her medication.  However, she overcame her problems and continues working to achieve her goals.

Marta will use this new loan to buy supplies such as corn, cheese, butter, milk caramel, firewood and other products.  This will enable her to offer more variety to her customers and she will make more profits.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making her products

loans.name: April Mellowayne

texts.en:
April Mellowayne P. is from the village of Nuesa. She is 20 years old. April Mellowayne is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, April Mellowayne owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the community. April Mellowayne has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, April Mellowayne joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. April Mellowayne is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by April Mellowayne from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan is the wife of M. R. and resides in a city called Kasur in Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its leather industry. She has been living there in a three-room brick house with her family for past twenty-one years. Hameedan is 49 years old and is involved in the business of hand embroidery. She takes orders from her neighboring clients and fulfills them within a given time period to earn an income. She is known among her clients for the quality of her work and meeting her time commitment. 

She is the mother of three sons and three daughters. Her sons have a business of selling bedsheets, and her daughters do embroidery to help their mother in completing her embroidery orders. Her husband has a business of selling construction supplies. He offers his services to different construction companies and earns income. 

Hameedan has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further growth of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will purchase embroidery material and clothes in bulk to offer her clients better quality services. 

She has been operating her business for the past ten years and keeps herself up to date about the latest trends in fashion and clothing. She is hopeful that an investment will give her business an instant boost and will increase her income. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material and clothes for her embroidery business

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sabenty” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Kadiatu K. is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is twenty-eight-year-old and married with two children who are attending primary school. Kadiatu sells medicines and has been doing this business for seven years now. With the help of this loan, Kadiatu will invest in her business by buying medicines such as Paracetamol, Stop Aches, ORS, Flagins, and syrups to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy medicines such as Paracetamol and syrups to add to her business inventory

loans.name: La Fuente De Bendicion 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Reina is one of our businesswomen. She works selling seafood such as squid, fish, crabs and others. She makes her sales in her community which is a rural area surrounded by forests and mountains, also near Bahia, in the town of Hato Mayor, an agricultural zone where some of her customers live and other borrowers live.

Reina has two children who still live with her, together with her long-term partner, also their father. Her most important challenge is finishing her studies. Reina is receiving her sixth loan from Esperanza Internacional and, because her loan repayments have all been maD. punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the re-investment she makes from each loan. 

She started her business 6 years ago, with some personal savings. She will buy a freezer, scales, and also a cooler to carry with her to other communities far from the Bahia. She would like to save her profits to build her house and to be able to give her children a safer home.  She also wants to become a successful businesswoman and a professional.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, a freezer and other items

loans.name: Wajih

texts.en: Wajih is a 47 year-old married man from Chtoura and owner of a car repair garage since 1999.  He has had 32 years of experience in this field.  Wajih was young when he started working, unlike most of his friends who attended school at that time. Wajih is talented, and he says that he knows every car's cure. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to improve his business by buying new fuel oils and lubricants necessary to all car types. It's his first time requesting a loan, and he hopes it comes with a good feedback in the future.

loans.use: To buy fuel oils and lubricants

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is a forty-three-year-old married man with six children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running his shop for six years. He started by selling firewood then set up a retail shop. His hardships are debtors and high rent and his vision is a wholesale business and  buying a motorcycle. Ernest wants the credit facility to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom C. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Yung, live in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have one son and one daughter. One is in school and the other one is still young. 

She and her husband are garment factory workers. In addition, they also grow rice when they are free. Sreymom asked for a Kiva loan once, and she is now requesting another loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Josefina Antonieta

texts.es:
La Señora. Josefina B. es socia del banco comunal Espoir Mi Bankito, vive por el sector Cristo del Consuelo en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es hermosa por su centro histórico, sus iglesias, su naturaleza y varios lugares turísticos en donde cuentan con variada gastronomía y sus 4 ríos la bañan hacen de esta ciudad un lugar hermoso para visitar.

La Señora Josefina tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 12, 11, 9 y 7 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es comerciante de mariscos, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Josefina se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de mariscos, esta actividad la desempeña hace 8 años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de mariscos como: pescado, camarón, conchas, cangrejos, etc. para incrementar su negocio.

Su meta es tener  casa propia.
texts.en:
Josefina B. is a member of the Espoir Mi Bankito communal bank.  She lives in the Cristo el Consuelo area of the city of Cuenca.  This city is beautiful because of its historic center, its churches, its natural features, and its various tourist sites, which feature a varied gastronomy.  Its four rivers make the city a beautiful place to visit.

Josefina is 34 years old.  She is married and has 4 children, 7, 9, 11, and 12 years old.  All of her children study in a small school in the city.  Her husband sells fish.  They do not own their own house, so they rent.

Josefina sells all kinds of fish.  She has been doing this for 8 years, and she works Sunday to Sunday from 6 in the morning until 6 in the evening.

This is her first loan with the communal bank, and she is going to invest it in the purchase of fish such as: shrimp, shellfish, crab, etc. in order to expand her business.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase fish, shrimp, shellfish, crab, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Carmen trabaja en un despacho contable y tiene un local el cual vende ropa interior para dama, joyería fina y de plata, también vende un poco de juguetes para regalos. Ella tiene con su negocio aproximadamente 5 años y comenta que puso este negocio porque tubo una mala racha de dos años en los cuales ella le hecho ganas para salir adelante y sacar a sus hijos adelante ya que se divorcio y tubo que salir sola con sus hijos. Comenta que esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para la compra de ropa interior que vende en su tienda y también por catalogo ella vende de diferentes marcas y surte sus productos en la cuidad de México y Guadalajara ya que aya le dan buenos precios y así también ella los da a precios baratos y así tiene mas clientes. Dice que ella esta muy contenta con su negocio ya que tiene muchas clientas que se van satisfechas con lo que ella vende, la meta que tiene doña Carmen es dedicarse por completo a su negocio ya que su mama le ayuda atenderlo y mas adelante ponerle un negocio a su mama de lo mismo que ella vende para que gane su propio capital. En la foto sale la señora carmen con su mama ella dice “gracias a mi mama que es una buena administradora mi negocio ha crecido mucho  y le agradezco que me aya ayudado con mi negocio y por eso le quiero poner su propio  negocio para que ella sea independiente”.
texts.en: Carmen works in an accounting firm and she has a store where she sells ladies' undergarments and fine silver jewelry. She also sells a few toys for gifts. She has had her business for about 5 years and she says that she started her business because she had had two bad years when she went through a divorce and she had to support her children by herself.  She says that she requests a loan from the organization to purchase undergarments, products that she sells in her store. She also sells by catalogue. She sells different brand names and she acquires her products in Mexico City and in Guadalajara. She gets good prices there and so she also gives affordable prices. This is how she has more clients. She says that she is very happy with her business because she has many clients who are satisfied with what she sells. Carmen's goal is to completely dedicate herself in her business. Her mother helps her with the business but later on she wants to set up a similar business for her mother so that she will have her own income. Carmen can be seen with her mother in the photo and she says  "it is thanks to her mother that she is a good business administrator and that she has made her business grow. She has helped her with the business and that is the reason why she wants to set up a business for her so that she will be independent."

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of jewelry and undergarments.

loans.name: Bibisha

texts.en: Bibisha is a thirty-four-year-old divorced woman with four children, and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family  rests solely on her. Her desire is to educate her children up to University. After divorcing from her husband she realized that the only way to support her family was to sell fish since it has a ready market, and she is proud of her decision. She has been selling dry fish for five years with minimal hardships. Her vision is to be a big supplier plus building her own house. Bibisha needs the loan to buy fish for resale.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Gloria Argentina

texts.es: La Señora Gloria Argentina tiene 36 años. Ella es una mujer muy alegre, a pesar de las dificultades que ha atravesado siempre ha mantenido su espíritu de entusiasmo  y esto es lo le ha ayudado con su actividad económica  es su brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 10 años que tiene de dedicarse a este negocio. A Gloria siempre le ha gustado su actividad económica ya que le gusta interactuar con la gente. Por lo que es una persona que le gusta el progreso. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en la compra de zipper, hilos, agujas, tijeras y telas.
texts.en: Gloria Argentina is 36 years old.  She’s a very cheerful woman despite the difficulties she’s gone through.  She’s always kept an enthusiastic spirit and this has helped her in her economic activity which is providing sewing services.  She’s been in this occupation for over 10 years.  Gloria has always enjoyed her work because she likes interacting with people.  She’s a person who likes to make progress.  Because of that she’s asking for this loan to buy zippers, thread, needles, scissors and fabric.

loans.use: to buy zippers, thread, needles, scissors and fabric.

loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en:
Nyamaa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her two children, age 17 and 19, both attend local secondary school. Her husband is a carpenter who makes many kinds of household goods such as beds, tables, and chairs, etc. 

Nyamaa manages a clothing trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2008 after moving to center of the province. Previously, she was a herder with some husbandry animals. However, because of bad winter weather, she lost all her husbandry animals. So she decided to conduct her clothing trading business. Now she has many regular customers and imports her goods from China. She is planning to rent a booth where the sales are quite high. She is a hardworking lady who says, "I am planning to expand my business in the future." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Vugukuri Group

texts.fr:
Aloys est un commerçant âgé de 56ans qui habite au Quartier Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Il  fait le commerce d’huile de palme depuis 3ans. Il est en même temps plombier. Il est veuf avec 2 enfants âgés de  26ans et 24ans. L’ainée étudie. Il n’a pas fréquenté l’école.

Son crédit de 200,000frans burundais va contribuer à augmenter son capital et agrandir la quantité d’huile de palme à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« VUGUKURI».
texts.en:
Éliane is the president of Vugukuri Group.

Here follows the business description of Aloys, the highlighted member of the group. He is a 56-year-old merchant living in the neighborhood of Kanyosha in the municipality of Bujumbura. He has been selling palm oil for three years. In addition, he is a plumber. He is widowed and the father of two children, aged 26 and 24. His eldest daughter is studying. Aloys himself did not attend school.

He will use his share of 200,000 Burundi francs in the group loan to increase his working capital. He will buy more palm oil for resale and make a big profit.

Aloys is a member of Vugukuri Community Group.

loans.use: to increase his supply of palm oil for resale and make a big profit.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena, tiene la edad de 33 años, está casada, ella vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo que son sus mayores prioridades. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de  materiales para establecer un local para realizar la explotacion de estos animales y poder generar las ganancias para seguir adelante y creciendo con el nuevo proyecto. Ella comprara también el alimento de los pollos para engordarlos más rápido y poderlos sacar al mercado pronto para su posterior venta. Ella piensa en el futuro de sus hijos y su esposo y quiere alivianarle la carga a su esposo generando un ingreso extra para su familia. Es el primero  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: María Elena, age 33, is married. She lives with her husband and three children who are her highest priorities. She expects to use this loan to purchase materials to open a store to profit from these animals and generate an income to keep improving and expanding her new project. She will also purchase food for the chickens in order to fatten them more quickly and bring them to the market soon for sale. She has the futures of her children and her husband in mind, and wants to lighten her husband's load by providing an extra income for her family. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hadn't had any previous loans from state banks, and FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with greater ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to fatten

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Rosa Ema

texts.es: Rosa Ema una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, desde hace 5 años cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada  donde ofrece variedad de artículos como lo es ropa en diferentes tallas, zapatos, calcetines, zapatos y venta de comida. En este momento el desea invertir en su negocio como compra de mercancía para tener mayor variedad y así sus ventas se incrementen.
texts.en: Rosa Ema is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been selling clothing for five years.  She offers a variety of articles ranging from different size clothing to shoes, socks, and even food.  She is currently interested in buying more merchandise for her business in order to offer a wider variety and increase sales.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel tiene la edad de 50 años, estudio solo la primaria, es madre soltera de 2 hijos pero actualmente solo vive con dos de sus nietos uno de 16 años que asiste a la secuendaria y el otro nieto de 3 años que va al preescolar.

Ella nos platica que siempre le a gustado trabajar y que desde hace mas de 30 años tiene una pequeña refresqueria en su casa en la cual vende refresques, pulpa de tamarindo y cocadas, tambien nos dice que los fines de semana (sabado y domingo) vende casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad chiles rellenos, tamales y empanadas.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos, coco, azucar, tamarindo, leche, chile en polvo, maiz, carne, chiles, tomates, cebolla, huevos, arina y aceite para poder continuar con su negocio, ella nos dice que espera que con esta invercion ya que se gustaria invertir sus ganancias en la compra de plasticos (vasos, platos, cucharas, bandejas, tazas y toppers)para vender y asi hacer crecer su negocio.

Doña Isabel se encuentra muy feliz por el credito que ha recibido y agradece a la fundacion la confianza que le a dado al otorgarle este prestamo.
texts.en:
Isabel, 50, only completed elementary school.  She’s a single mother of two children but she currently lives only with two of her grandchildren, a 16-year-old who is in secondary school and a 3-year-old who is in preschool.

She relates that she’s always enjoyed working and that she’s had a small snack bar for over 30 years at home where she sells soft-drinks, tamarind pulp and macaroons.  She also tells us that on weekends (Saturday and Sunday) she sells chiles rellenos (stuffed peppers), tamales and turnovers door to door among her friends and neighbors in the community.

She needs this loan to buy soft-drinks, coconut, sugar, tamarind, milk, powdered chili, corn, meat, chilies, tomatoes, onions, eggs, flour and oil to continue with the business.  She tells us that she hopes that this investment will allow her to stay in business and that she’d like to use her profits to buy plastic ware (drinking glasses, plates, spoons, trays, cups and Tupperware) to sell and help her business to grow that way.  Isabel is very happy about the loan she’s gotten and thanks the foundation for the trust it’s placed in her by granting it.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her Mexican fast food items.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and married with 4 children. With 2 children in school, Rosa works very hard to provide for them.

Rosa runs a buying & selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and hasrequested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosa has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Rosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Benkadi  V Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI V  est un groupe composé  de sept femmes mariées du village de SANGOULA  de la sous préfecture de BLA, préfecture de BLA région de SÉGOU. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 5 enfants et cultivent  du riz de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production les membres du groupe BENKADI  V  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année et sont à leur premier prêt de campagne. 
DJENEBA NAFORI, qui la présidente du groupe, est la deuxième debout à gauche, portant un complet brodé verdâtre et un foulard blanc,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, au grand marché de BLA auprès des revendeurs. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA , de YANGASSO et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, en gros, au comptant, à une clientèle constituée de consommateurs et de revendeurs.
DJENEBA NAFORI, compte réaliser  après l’écoulement de ses produits agricoles, un bénéfice de  45.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et aider le mari dans les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI V is a group made up of seven married women from Sangoula, a village in the sub-prefecture of Bla, in the Bla prefecture, region of Segou. They live in traditional families, are on average 42 years old with 5 children, and grow groundnuts and gumbo.
In the interests of securing a return on their farms to increase the size of their farmable plots of land for an improved production, this year the members of the BENKADI V group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme and this is their first rural loan.
DJENEBA NAFORI is the president of the group, she is the second from the left standing up, and wearing a greenish embroidered suit and a white headscarf. She plans to use her loan to buy good quality seeds, small tools, and fertilisers for cultivation from the stockists at the big market in Bla. After wintering, the crops are stocked for a certain period of time so that they appreciate in value. They are then sold at the big market in BLA, YANGASSO, and in the neighbouring markets, for cash, retail  or wholesale to a clientele made up of consumers and retailers.
DJENEBA NAFORI hopes to make a profit of 45.000FCFA after the sale of her agricultural products which will be used for the payment of the interests of the loan and for helping her husband to pay the family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase farming inputs,seeds and small tools.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia is a 43 year old married lady. She sells lesos and charcoal in Mtwapa, Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last three years. This is her first loan in KADET LTD. With it she plans to purchase more bags of charcoal. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es: Dorotea, de 50 años es una mujer responsable; que cuidó de sus 9 hijos, sola y a pesar de la limitación; continua trabajando por 5 de ellos que todavía son menores. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Punray. Ella es una mujer feliz, pues tiene el apoyo de sus hijos. Los que le ayudan en las actividades del hogar. Según menciona, tiene varios ingresos económicos. Uno de ellos es la agricultura, donde tiene 30 años de experiencia en la siembra de arveja y papa en sus 2 hectáreas de terreno agrícola. Los que le proporcionan ingresos en cada cosecha, ya que tiene clientes fijos en la ciudad de Tarma; de la misma manera hace 4 moldes de queso al día, con la leche que le proporciona las 3 vacas que posee. Los cuales son cuidados por sus hijos, como también los cuyes, cerdos y gallinas, ahí obtiene un dinero extra con la venta de los mismos. Además teje colchas, frazadas y chalecos a base de lana; los que comercializa a pobladores de la zona. Sus días son agitados y de mucho trabajo; por ello quiere juntar el dinero necesario para poder brindar a sus hijos una buena educación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Punray avanzando” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo, en esta oportunidad. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Dorotea de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y guano de ave de corral para esparcir en su próxima siembra de papa “canchan”.
texts.en:
Dorotea, age 50, is a responsible woman who raised nine children alone.  In spite of that limitation, she continues working for five of them who are still minors.  They live together in her own house in the rural community of Punray.  She is happy because she has her children’s support.  They help her with the household chores.

She mentions that she has various incomes.  One of them is farming.  She has 30 years of experiences growing peas and potatoes on two hectares of farm land.  These give her income with each harvest because she has fixed customers in the city of Tarma.  She makes four molds of cheese a day with the milk that her three cows provide.  Her children take care of the cows in addition to the guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens.  She gets extra money by selling the animals.

Also, she weaves wool bedspreads, blankets, and vests; and she sells them to the people living in the area.  Her days are very hectic with a lot of work because she wants to get together the money needed to be able to give her children a good education.

She belongs to the Punray Avanzando Communal Bank.  This is her ninth loan with MFP, where she hopes for your support at this time.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  Upon receiving your support she will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizers and poultry guano to spread the next time she plants “canchan” potatoes (has a pink, thin skin; the meat is of a pale whitish color).

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and poultry guano.

loans.name: Boir

texts.ru: Боир семянин, на воспитании имеет одного сына. Более 16 лет он занимается пчеловодством, производством меда по наследству, также он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов, такие как арбуз, дыня, морковь и т.д. и бахчевых на собственной земле площадью 2,5 га. Займ он хочет получить для приобретения крупного рогатого скота и нужных товаров для  пчеловодства.
texts.en: Boir is a family man, who is raising one son.  For over 16 years, Boir has been involved in beekeeping, inherited honey production and also growing agricultural products, such as watermelons, cantaloupe, carrots, etc. and melons on his own land of 2.5 hectares.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle and necessary goods for beekeeping.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and ncessary goods for beekeeping

loans.name: Altantulkhuur

texts.en:
Altantulkhuur is 27 years old.  She is a beautician in a salon. She lives with her son and husband in her father’s house, which is located in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar.   Her husband runs an inter-city passenger transportation service.  He has a lot of regular customers and they say that he is a good driver. 

Lately, his car has become more broken down and it's dangerous to serve the customers. Therefore, he needs to change its spare parts and some sections.  It will be good for his business earnings if he can make the repairs before this winter.  The loan Altantulkhuur is requesting will be used to purchase some new spare parts so her husband can make repairs to his car.

loans.use: buy parts to repair her husband's car

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Carlos es una persona de treinta cuatro años de edad es casado y con tres hijos y  estos se encuentran en edad escolar y todavía dependen de el. 
El acude nuevamente a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para compra de materiales de construcción para continuar con el proceso de mejoras en su casa de habitación.
El préstamo es para comprar tres verjas para las ventanas de su casa de habitación ya que estas se encuentran solo cerradas con tablas. Todo esto para brindarle una mejor vivienda a su familia y a gradece a ceprodel por las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 34 years old and married, with three school-age children who are still dependent on him.

He is approaching the offices of CEPRODEL again to request a new loan to buy construction materials to continue with the process of making improvements to his home.

The loan is to buy three grilles for the windows of his house, since until now they have been closed only with planks.  All this is to give his family a better future.

He thanks CEPRODEL for the opportunities offered.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a 25-year-old man from Kisumu City, Western Kenya. He is married to Josephine, a housewife, and they have a four-month-old baby.
Lucas operates a stall from which he sells various home products – for example, torches, radios, CDs and many more items. He has been running this business for the last five years and he makes a monthly income of 30,000 KES. 
Lucas joined Kiva partner KADET recently and has been awarded with a first loan, which he will use to buy CDs, torches, power extensions, and other items. He will use the profits to expand his business because he hopes to own a big shop selling home products at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy a stock of home products.

loans.name: Maira Yecenia

texts.es:
La señora Maira tiene 35 años de edad y vive en la aldea de San Antonio en el municipio de La Lopez. Ella es casada y su esposo Rafael es comerciante. La pareja tiene dos hijos de 6 y 11/2 años de edad. Los dos adultos aportan económicamente a los gastos familiares. 

Doña Maira especializa en la venta de cosméticos. Ella toma pedidos de catalogo y proporciona los productos a su clientela. Vende desde su casa y de forma ambulante. Empezó este negocio hace 7 años. En aquellos tiempos ella experimentó con varios negocios buscando uno que era rentable. Realizó que vender cosméticos era muy rentable y decidió poner el negocio. 

Solicitó este crédito de L10,000 para la compra de lociones y cremas. Ella espera que el crédito le ayuda hacer más grande su negocio. En un futuro, desea tener su propio local comercial para no seguir con la venta ambulante.
texts.en:
Maira, 35, lives in the village of San Antonio in La Lopez Municipality.  She’s married to her husband, Rafael, who is a merchant.  The couple has two children who are 6 and 11-1/2 years old.  The two adults contribute to family expenses.

Maira specializes in selling cosmetics.  She takes orders from catalogues and then provides the products to her customers.  She sells from home and as a street vendor.  She started the business 7 years ago.  In those days, she experimented with several businesses looking for one that would be profitable.  She realized that selling cosmetics was very profitable and decided to go into this business.

She requested this L10,000 loan to buy lotions and creams.  She hopes that the loan will help her make her business larger.  In the future, she’d like to have her own commercial locale so as not to continue being a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy lotions and creams.

loans.name: Gullu

texts.ru:
Gullu yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Gullu zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Yeyo deti pomogayut svoyey mame po rabote. Gullu 48 let. 
Ona ochen nujdayetsya V 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya togo chtob uvelichit kolichestvo molochnogo produkta, tak kak ona xochet uvelichit svoy mesachniy doxot. 
Gullu uje  8 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey teti kotoraya toje zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Gullu prodayot molochniye produkti v magazini.
texts.en:
Gullu is an internally displaced person (IDP) and has been relocated from the town of Fuzuli, she now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family. Gullu is married and has three children. Her children help their mother with the business. Gullu is 48 years old.

She very much needs 2000 AZN to buy cows so that she can increase the volume of milk products as she wants to increase her monthly income.  Gullu sells the milk products to the stores.

Gullu has been in the livestock business breeding cows for eight years now. She has learned this business from her aunt who also keeps livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Warren

texts.es: Warren, de 27 años, es un hombre bueno, y trabajador, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres a quienes apoya en la parte económica y por quienes trabaja a diario para brindarles la comodidad que ellos merecen. El trabajo de Warren consiste en el transporte de carga y pasajero dentro y fuera de la ciudad. Desde muy temprano sale en busca de sus eventuales pasajeros a quienes recoge de las calles más concurridas de la ciudad y los transporta a los destinos que ellos solicitan. Lleva trabajando de mototaxista por cuatro años, durante este período de tiempo aprendió muchas cosas que al principio no sabia y a veces le hacían perder pasajeros, ahora todos los días aprende algo nuevo y trabaja mucho para que pueda seguir generando ingresos a su hogar. Le va muy bien ya que durante las 10 horas que esta en la calle sabe a donde ir en que horarios ir, además que algunas veces agarra contratos por hora y eso le conviene aún más. Espera seguir haciendo su trabajo con la normalidad que lo hizo ahora y empezar a ahorrar para comprar una nueva mototaxi. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por su parte se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además se siente muy a gusto trabajando con sus compañeros de banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, aportará algo a su ahorro para comprarse un mototaxi más y revalidará la documentación para su vehiculo ya que están por vencer, además de comprar algunas piezas y repuestos para su moto ya que con el tiempo se han deteriorado.
texts.en:
Warren, 27, is a good and hardworking man.  He is single and does not have children yet.  He lives in his parents' home, and supports them financially and works daily to give them the comfort they deserve.

Warren's job consists of cargo and passenger transportation within and outside the city.  He goes out very early in search of his eventual passengers, whom he picks up in the busiest streets of the city and transports to the locations they request.  He has worked as a motorcycle taxi driver for four years.  During this time he has learned many things he did not know at the beginning and sometimes made him lose passengers.  Now he learns something new every day and he works a lot so he can continue generating income for his home.  It is going very well for him because during the 10 hours he is in the street he knows where to go and when.  Besides, sometimes he gets hourly contracts and this is even better for him.

He hopes to continue doing his work as normally as he has done it, and to begin to save to buy a new motorcycle taxi.  This will be his second loan with MFP, and he hopes for your collaboration so he can realize his plans.
