For his part, he is committed once again to making his payments just as with the previous loans he had.  He also feels very comfortable working with his companions from the communal bank because all are very responsible and supportive.

With the requested loan of 1500 PEN he will contribute something to his savings to buy himself a motorcycle taxi, he will renew his papers for his vehicle since they are about to expire, and he also will buy some parts and spare parts for his motorcycle because they have been damaged over time.

loans.use: to update his vehicle permit papers, to buy spare parts, and to help pay for a new vehicle.

loans.name: Rahumuma's Group

texts.en:
Rahumuma's group is comprised of 4 hardworking women. Rahumuma is 19 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, she has been working hard to manage her small market which sells food. 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and will help her to generate greater profits and take care of her young brothers and sisters. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy herself a plot of land. 

She is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rahumuma's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save her money.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale,

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 47, is married, and resides with her husband, her mother and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a weaver. Additionally, she is a rice farmer and raises chickens to generate more income. Her husband is a carpenter who manufactures furniture to sell to generate income for the family. Two of her children are employed at the Christian school. 

Mao is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase wood for her husband to manufacture more furniture to sell to his clients so as to make more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and purchase more farming land to grow rice. Moreover, she plans to build a kitchen, a bathroom and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase wood for her husband to manufacture more furniture to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal "MARIA AUXILIADORA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Sebastian perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, 

La socia tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 1 año de edad; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de materiales de construcion en su ferreteria, la socia vende desde clavos, pinturas, carretillas, cemento entre otros materiales, la socia desea invertir el prestamo e la compra de materiales de construccion para implementar su ferreteria.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of "MARIA AUXILIADORA", a communal bank located in San Sebastian, a district of the Cusco department.

The borrower is 27 years old, she lives with her life partner and she has a 1-year-old child. She engages in buying and selling construction materials in her ironmonger’s store. She sells nails, paints, wheelbarrows, cement and other materials. She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to stock up her store.

She is thankful for the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues according to the schedule she has agreed upon.

loans.use: To  buy construction materials to stock up her store.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has no children and has been doing this work for 2 years. His primary income sources are milk, crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'keeping dairy cows.' His biggest challenge is 'animal diseases.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'cheseger.'

Patrick was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'because they give grace period.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'that they encourage group guarantee- mechanism.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Patrick replied 'in improving their livelihood.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Patrick owns the following: 'cow, pig' but does not own 'poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en: A resident from Bovel district of Battambang province where her corn is grown, Ry is 51 years old and a mother of two children. She has involved in corn farming for several years. This is the original loan for Ry with VisionFund(Kiva's partner). She forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed, and to pay for plowing fee. She hopes that she can gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed, and to pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married with seven children and is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. She supports her family through buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her son Ariel, who is 22 years old and is the second of her seven children. He is studying toward his Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

Arlene is borrowing PHP 8,000 to pay the tuition fees of her son Ariel for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Ariel plans, when he graduates, to help his parents earn an income to send his brother and sister to college.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Anne Lisette

texts.fr:
Anne Lisette a 65 ans. Elle est divorcée et a un descendant de 39 ans qui peut l’aider si cela est nécessaire car ils habitent le même quartier. 
Elle est gargotière et couturière à la fois. Son expérience dans la gargote est très riche, car elle exerce cette activité depuis 17ans. Elle en est à son 3eme prêt et a déjà épargné de l’argent de côté pour son exploitation. Elle a des clients fidèles dans son activité, mais le seul problème c’est que leurs achats sont à crédit. Le prêt servira à l’aménagement de la gargote et elle a besoin d'acheter quelques matériaux comme tôle, ciment, bois carré, planche, ainsi que l’augmentation des articles d’exploitation : riz, charbon, fait-tout.
Elle espère avoir plusieurs gargotes afin de subvenir à ses besoins, quand la vieillesse l’atteindra.

loans.use: acheter du riz, charbon de bois, marmites, tôles, ciment, bois carré, planches..

loans.name: Dahly

texts.en: Dahly, is aged 39, married to a Seaman and they're blessed with three children. She owns and manages a retail store in their village and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. She's been in this business for almost three years. She also have a noodle house to earn more income. Her PHP 500 daily was spent on the school allowances and they're daily expenses at home. Due to insufficient capital on her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase grocery items and food ingredients to sell. She's hoping that her retail store will continue to become more productive and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and food ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Lucy Njeri

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Melody Mothers group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Lucy is a widow with one dependant. Despite being a widow she is very active.

Lucy grows and sells vegetables and poultry farming on a small plot. She started her farming business with a loan of USD 280. She sells her vegetable products to the neighbors and the nearby markets. Due to the prolonged dry spells, the demand for her products has increased since she is among the few using irrigation method of farming.

For poultry, she gets orders from hotels in Nairobi though due to lack of enough capital she is not able to meet the demand from her clients.

loans.use:
Given a loan of USD 700, she will be able to buy a water pump to facilitate her vegetable farming and meet the high demand.
She will  be able to add more poultry stock and meet the demand from her clients and get new customers.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Mr. Kossi A. is a very dynamic young man. Married to a business woman and father of two children, he is also responsible for three of his younger brothers who are going to school. He supports his family by earning income from selling secondhand clothes and shoes. He started trading clothing when he was forced to leave school for lack of money. Fortunately, Mr. ATTINGON’s business is flourishing and he would like to expand it to increase his income and better support his family. He is thus seeking an $850 loan to increase the scope of his business to meet client demand as well as to reach markets beyond his town. This loan could improve his family’s living conditions, as well as his financial situation.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kossi est un jeune homme très dynamique. Marié à une commerçante et père de deux (2) enfants, il a à sa charge trois (3) petits frères en âge de scolarisation. Il réussit à nourrir sa famille à partir du revenu de la vente des friperies : vêtements et chaussures. Contraint d’abandonner les études à cause du manque des moyens, il s’est lancé dans ce commerce pour pouvoir se prendre en charge. C’est une activité très florissante et Monsieur A. compte l’agrandir aujourd’hui pour en tirer plus de revenu pour le bonheur de sa famille. Il souhaite alors avoir un appui financier d’un montant $850 pour agrandir la taille de son activité afin de répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle et avoir une possibilité d’aller sur des marchés plus grands que celui de sa localité. Ce crédit pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille de même que sa situation financière.

loans.use: Sale of secondhand clothes and shoes

loans.name: Marshal

texts.en: Mr. Marshal N.. Hails from a semi-rural area in Edo State, Nigeria. He is married with eight (8) children. He deals in the sales of cooking material to the community and promises to expand his business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana was born in 1970 in the Salyan region. She is married and has 3 children.
She has been in this business for 3 years.
This business is the only source of income for her family. She breeds cows and calves. 
Now she needs a loan of $375 to buy grass.

loans.use: To buy grass

loans.name: Halimah

texts.en:
Halimah is a 30-year-old single mom. She has a daughter who is 5 years old and attends kindergarten. Halimah lives with four relatives; two of them go to high school while the other two help her to prepare snacks like chapati and cakes, which she sells at her business. She pays part of the school fees for the two dependants who go to high school.

Halimah operates a canteen at Kawanda secondary school where she sells drinks and snacks to students. She has been in this business for 7 years. With her earnings Halimah is able to pay rent for both her residential and work place. 

Halimah wants to borrow $600 to use to restock her canteen. From the increased capital, she hopes to earn more income to complete the two-room house that she is building and pay school fees for her child and dependants.

loans.use: To restock her business, a canteen that operates at a secondary school, providing drinks and snacks to students

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty products to sell to her salon clients

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela is a brave lady who works each and every day to support her four children. They drive her life and energize her to continue moving forward, despite having suffered the abandonment of her husband a year ago. This episode was a very painful chapter in her life, but it did not destroy her. She always worked in food sales, and her strength has become an example to many people. She has decided to continue in her endeavors to support her children, particularly the needs of her seven year old who has been greatly impacted by the abandonment of her father. For Estela, the days of highest sales volume are Sundays which have the greatest flow of customers. She sells her foods by traveling around the local areas and her sales are steady given how well-received her dishes are by her clientele. This, and the help of her beloved children, has motivated her to continue and succeed over her recent crisis. She has plans to improve her business, and to reach this objective asks for a loan. The investment and any profits thereof are to help pay for the educational costs of her children. A brave and strong heart cannot be left unsupported. Let’s join together to help build a bright future for Estela and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Estela, es una valiente dama que día a día trabaja para sostener a sus cuatro hijos, que impulsan su vida y la animan a seguir adelante alentándola siempre a pesar de haber sufrido el abandono moral y material de su esposo hace un año, este hecho fue un capítulo muy penoso pero no la derrumbó.Siempre ha trabajado en la venta de comidas y se ha convertido en un ejemplo de fortaleza para muchas personas; está decidida a seguir desempeñándose en su ocupación eficientemente para apoyar a sus hijos y sobre todo a la pequeña de siete años que la necesita más debido al enorme impacto que causó en ella el abandono de su padre.Para Estela los días de mayor venta son los domingos porque tiene mayor afluencia de público y adicionalmente reparte de manera ambulante los pedidos de comida de sus clientes ya que su buena sazón le aseguran la venta completa de los platillos; esto y la ayuda de sus queridos hijos la animan a continuar y a superar la crisis que tuvo.Ella ha planeado mejorar su negocio y para cumplir con su objetivo solicita un préstamo. La inversión y la ganancia son en beneficio de solventar los gastos educativos de sus hijos.Un corazón valiente y lleno de fortaleza no puede dejar de ser apoyado, solidaricémonos para construirle a Estela y sus hijos un futuro prometedor.

loans.use: Capital to increase production of delicious traditional foods.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Yoeun, 52, is widow with two daughters. Her husband died in 1988. One daughter works in a garment factory and other one is a tailor. Yoeun and her family are living on an island of Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Yoeun is in the business of selling cloth at the market in her village. She started this business in 1985.

Yoeun is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $700. She will combine this loan with money she has saved to buy wood to build her house. She is pictured with her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase wood to build a house

loans.name: Negmat

texts.en: S. Negmat lives in Nau, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2003. His stable business development and steady income has helped him to return his previous loans on time and to improve his business. Mr. S. is engaged in a home business of raising and selling livestock. It is the family business within which his wife is engaged in milk production and selling. He has 20 years experience in the business. Now Mr. S. requests a loan of $625 to purchase mixed fodder.

loans.use: To purchase mixed fodder

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
I. Uktam is 30 years old. He is married with three children.

Uktam grows rice. When he was a boy he used to help his father who is also involved in this business. When he became an adult, Uktam decided to grow rice also as he already knew lots of things about producing rice theoretically as well as practically. Uktam sell the rice in the local market. Being taught by his father that the storage of the rice is much easier when it is not separated from its husks, Uktam uses this practice also. Working hard, Uktam tries to make his business successful and stable as it generates the main income for the family. 

Uktam would like to purchase mineral fertilizer required for growing rice. He requests $600.00 US dollars for the term of 6 months. This is his first loan from IMON, but Uktam promises to manage the loan with accuracy and remit all payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer required for growing rice.

loans.name: Dany

texts.es:
Dany is a member of the "Winning Women" communal bank and lives in San Martín in the Bellavista region of Peru. She's dedicated to selling items for primary need at a store run out of in her home, which she has been doing for the past eight years.

With the $900 loan, which she plans to repay within six months, she hopes to purchase different kinds of products to add more variety to her store, like rice, sugar, oil, condensed milk and other brand-name items. She also has a photocopier in her store and wants to buy paper for it because it is a good part of her business since she is located in front of a school.

Dany is 29 years old and has two children — one boy and one girl — both of whom are still minors. Her husband helps her with her work and with the household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Dany G. R. es socia del Banco Comunal “ Mujeres Triunfadoras” , vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Bellavista, distrito de Bellavista se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en un local propio ubicado en su casa en la esquina de los Jirones Loreto y Moquegua sector del 3er Piso en la localidad de Bellavista, ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace 8 años. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500.el cual pagara en 6 meses desea comprar diferentes tipos de productos para surtir su negocio como arroz en ( 3 sacos ), azúcar ( 3 sacos ) 3 cajas de aceite en frascos, leche evaporada ( 3 cajas ) y de diferentes marcas, para que haya variedad de productos en su negocio, ella también en su mismo local tiene una maquina de sacar fotocopias, así que desea comprar también papel bond (3 millares ) ya que es un muy buen negocio ya que su local esta ubicado frente a una escuela. Ella tiene 29 años y tiene 2 hijos 1 varón y 1 mujer los cuales todavía son menores, es su esposo el que la ayuda en la atención y en las tareas domesticas del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase supplies (rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc.) for her store / Con el prestamo comprara mas productos para surtir su tienda

loans.name: Lena Karina

texts.es:
Lena belongs to La Familia Community Bank, located in the Calleria District, in Ucayalo. She is 40 years old and is the mother of 3 children. Her husband is a businessman. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Lena decided to begin selling merchandise. She relies on her business, for which she gets up at 7 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children, her husband, and afterwards works selling merchandise, distributing to clients until 5 p.m. With this loan of $600, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy women’s, men’s, children’s clothing, household accessories, shoes, etc. Lena is proud of herself; only with the initiative for self-improvement could she overcome many obstacles, and it is for this principle that she now works independently, managing her own income, and is very thankful for the loan from Manuela Ramos which has helped her to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lena pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en la Av. 16 de Noviembre No 340, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Lena con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de mercadería para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la venta de su mercadería, repartiendo a sus clientes hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,600 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ropas de damas caballeros y niños, accesorios para el hogar, zapatos, pasamanería, etc. Lena esta muy orgullosa de si misma, sólo con ganas de salir adelante y esfuerzo pudo vencer muchas barreras que se le presentaban, es por eso que ahora puede trabajar de manera independiente y manejar sus propios ingresos, y esta muy agradecida con la ayuda que le presta Manuela Ramos para salir adelante.

loans.use: Merchandise for sale

loans.name: Jose Dario

texts.es:
Mr. Jose Dario is requesting a loan so that it can be invested in improvements to his home. He is a responsible gentleman -- he is a partner of the CASCEPADE corporation. His line of production is well diversified. The property where he works is totally pastured. It has a continuing irrigation system plus it offers good basic conditions for grazing and livestock raising. His wife helps out by running a convenience store that covers some of the family's expenses. This client is a man of few financial resources and his dream is to improve his home and his quality of life. 

 Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Don José Dario está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda.  Es un hombre responsable, es socio de la cooperativa CASCEPADE,  su área de producción está diversificada, para el manejo del ganado, esta propiedad está  empastada, aguaje de todo tiempo, pasto en buenas condiciones básicas, para la explotación de ganado, también su esposa tiene una pulperia y le ayuda a solventar algunos gastos del hogar, este cliente es un hombre de pocos recursos economicos, sus mejores sueños es de mejorar su vivienda y obtener una vida mejor.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make home improvements.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang K. is a widowed garment worker who lives in Kampong Cham province with one of her children. Her sole means of support is a daily wage of $5 and the help she receives from her child, who is also a garment worker.

Inflation has caused prices in Cambodia to rise and times are difficult. Economic struggles have hit the poor hardest, and many are seeking new sources of income. Neang K. has applied to CREDIT for a loan of $1,000 to buy farmland on which to grow rice. She believes that the farm will produce extra income and be a valuable tool to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy farmland

loans.name: Qiyomiddin

texts.ru:
Qiyomiddin D. is a resident of Fayzabad district where he lives with his family. He is married and has two children. He has been in business for seven years. At this time, he would like to redecorate his store facilities and would like to take out a loan to do so. This would help him to create the conditions to draw in new customers. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Давлатов Киемиддин житель района Файзабад. Живет вместе со своей семьей . Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Бизнесом занимается уже 7 лет. В данный момент хочет сделать ремонт помещения. Но для этого он должен получить кредит. Это поможет создать условия , которые смогут привлечь новых клиентов.Погасить кредит он планирует в течегнии 12 месяцев

loans.use: Redecoration

loans.name: Zakia's Hakia Na Lawama Group

texts.en:
Zakia S. is 45 years old and is married with a 10-year-old child. She started a business selling snacks in 2000. Every day she works from 8 a.m. to 1 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35  from her sales.

Zakia now hopes for a loan to improve her business by increasing her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have  businesses dealing with clothes sales, oil sales and tailoring.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Emerita Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Emerita es una madre soltera de 34 años de edad, tiene 3 hijas mujeres las cuales están estudiando, después de la separación de su compañero ha tenido que trabajar duro para sacar adelante a sus hijas, buscando alternativas de trabajo para poder sobrevivir, comenzó alquilando un pequeño terreno que tiene y de esos ingresos  invirtió en la comercialización de productos cosméticos por encargos, apoyándose en pequeños catálogos que suministran las casas distribuidoras de cosméticos, solicita este crédito para mejorar las condiciones en la que se encuentra su vivienda por lo que su plan de inversión es la compra de Zinc y cuartones de madera para levantar un cerco en su casa, una de sus metas es incrementar su clientela para obtener mejores beneficios y seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Emerita is a 34 year old single mother, she has 3 daughters who are students. After separating from her husband she ha shad to work hard to help her daughters get ahead, looking for alternative work in order to survive. She began renting a small plot of land that she has and with this income she invested in selling cosmetic products by order, supporting herself with small catalogues that the cosmetic distributors supply to her. She is asking for this loan to improve the living conditions of her home, her plan is to buy zinc and wood to build a fence around her home. One of her goals is to increase her clientele in order to obtain better income and continue improving her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall around her home

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn P., 49, is a widow with six children; three sons and three daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home. Two sons do farming and one daughter is a garment factory worker. The youngest daughter studies in the local school. The family lives along national road number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Yorn has been farming for thirty years. She grows papayas, bananas, and other crops in her farmland. Now, she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticide for her farming business.

loans.use: Yorn would like to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for farming.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es madre de 4 hijos de 5, 9,12 y 7 años. Ella inició el negocio debido a la falta de empleo, siendo madre soltera y teniendo un bajo nivel escolar era difícil encontrar un empleo fijo que le permitiera tener un ingresos suficiente para solventar los gastos de sus pequeños, por lo que comenzó hace 10 años con  la venta de frituras y dulces y poco a poco fue haciendo crecer su negocio, incorporando abarrotes hasta establecer su tienda.

Ella necesita un préstamo por 3,000MXN que pagara en 6 meses para mejorar su local y  comprar  más productos para su  negocio y así tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Elena is the mother of four children, ages 5, 9, 12 and 7. She started the business due to lack of employment, as she is a single mother and doesn’t have a lot of education. This made it difficult for her to find stable employment that would provide enough income to meet the expenses of her small children. For this reason, ten years ago she started by selling fried foods and candies and little by little she made her business grow. She incorporated groceries until she established her store.

She needs a loan of 3,000 MXN, to be repaid in six months, to make improvements to her location and purchase more products for her business so she can attract additional customers.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her location.

loans.name: Milder Antonio

texts.es:
Milder C. es originario del municipio de Condega de la ciudad de León donde se dedica a laborar en su actividad económica de ganadería y agricultura por medio de la siembra de hortalizas y la crianza de terneros para luego sacarles el máximo provecho y de esta forma subsistir junto con su familia la cual se compone por su esposa e hijo.

Es de relevancia mencionar que este caballero es muy esforzado por lo que hoy en día ha duplicado sus esfuerzos debido a que desea obtener mejores ingresos para suplir las necesidades de su hogar en estos momentos en los cuales se acerca el fin de año. Por esta razón es que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de insumos para las hortalizas y además para invertir en la compra y crianza de terneros en su municipio.
texts.en:
Milder C. is from the Condega area of the city of Leon, where he works in livestock and agriculture by planting vegetables and raising cattle. Later he reaps the benefits of this, thereby surviving with his family - his wife and son. It should be mentioned that this young man is a hard worker and has now doubled his efforts because he wants to have better income to fulfill the needs of his home since the end of the year is approaching. Therefore, he has asked for the support of Kiva partner Ceprodel and a loan that will allow him to buy materials for planting his crops as well as to invest in purchasing and raising cattle in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural materials

loans.name: Karina Ysabel

texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Las Golondrinas (The Swallows) Village Bank. She is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two young children. Karina has a store, where she sells car parts and accessories. The store is located in a rented space in an area with many mechanics’ shops; mechanics are her main customers. Karina works at the shop by herself seven days a week. She has been running her store for the past three years; prior to that she sold clothing. Her husband works in construction.

Karina is requesting a loan of 1200 to buy more car parts, like shock absorbers and timing belts. Her goal for the future is to open her own auto repair shop next door to her store.

loans.use: Buy shock absorbers and timing belts

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men S. K., 35, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband work collecting palm juice, refining it to sugar, and then selling it to the market to earn approximately US$5 every day. This couple together has two school-aged children.

Men S. K. would like to take out a loan to purchase farmland to grow rice for additional profits that she will use to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase farmland to grow rice.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun S., 38, married her second husband in 2006. She has three children: one son and two daughters. Two of her children are garment factory workers and another one is still young. Besides her children she also has an elderly mother living with her. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Savun has been growing lotus for two years, a skill she learned from her relative. She sells them in her village and at the market in Phnom Penh. Savun is requesting her first loan of US$ 500 to use for repairing her motorized hand tiller.

loans.use: To use for repairing her motorized hand tiller

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes G. is a 46-year-old widowed mother of seven.  Two of her children are still in primary school, and three attend high school.  She applied for this loan to raise the capital to start a hog raising business.  Lourdes plans to install a pen to hold the pigs in her backyard, and will buy three piglets to start.  In the past, Lourdes has been a food vendor but she hopes this new business will provide her with greater income as she needs money to pay for her children's education.  She dreams of having all her children finish high school and wants them to attend college if possible.

loans.use: To buy three piglets, six sacks of feed, and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov K. is 25 years old and has a business making and selling mats in the TaK. province. She has been operating this business since 2006 and is able to earn about $10 every day. Her husband sells mosquito nets and makes approximately $10 per day. The couple has two young children.

Pov would like to take out a loan of $700 to purchase mats, mosquito nets and other materials to sell. Pov K. (right) is pictured with her husband and their young child.

loans.use: Purchase mats, mosquito nets and other materials to sell.

loans.name: Vineta

texts.en:
Vineta V. F., 51, is married with six children. She has four years of experience in the sewing business and sells to the village people and the public six days per week. This is her first loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145).

SPBD loans are Vineta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She needs the loan to buy another sewing machine and more fabric for puletasi and kids' clothes.

loans.use: Purchase to buy material and another sewing machine, and to continue her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian O. is thirty-seven years old and married with five children. She sells drinks and hopes for a loan to purchase more drinks to sell. She sends her thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is a mother of three children, and with her goal to pursue the education of her children, she tries to bring out her best in developing her business in order to earn higher income. They live in San Manuel, Isabela, and her husband is Reynaldo.

She owns and operates a small store in their village. She is really working hard to become successful in the future.  And for her to achieve this, she would like to borrow a loan so that she can use it as additional business capital for her store.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosemarie E. has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since March 23, 2004. She is 38 years of age, married, and blessed with three children who are now adults.

Rosemarie has been engaged in nipa-thatching and selling since she got married, earning Php 7,000 per month from her business (the nipa is a palm tree, the leaves of which are used for thatching roofs).

She has good standing in terms of payments on her previous loans. Now, she's obtaining her 8th loan in the amount of Php 8,000 for the purpose of additional capital including buying other materials needed for her business. Her plan for her business is that it will grow and continue to support her family in the future. And for her family, that her children will finish studying until college and are able to find a decent and stable job someday.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her nipa business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Jocelyn B. is a bona fide resident of Barangay Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old with four children. Her husband is a farmer.

Her rice production project is still in the growing phase. She requests a Php 5,000 loan to meet farm expenses such as fertilizers, pesticides and labor expenses. She hopes and prays that her business will increase its yield to pay for their children’s education. She is thankful for the continued assistance and support of Paglaum MPC, especially now that Kiva is helping micro-finance entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her rice field

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 40 year old woman. She is married and has three kids that she has managed to send to school. She lives with her husband and the children. She is a resourceful mother to her family. Her daily dream is to be able to work hard to provide her kids with a quality education and better future careers. She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets. She sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk etc. With the loan, she wants to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc. to increase her stock. She takes delivery of stock from the Kumasi central market. She hopes to save more to finance her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more grocery inventory

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: Elmer es un hombre de 21 años, vive en su propia casa hecha de abobe, junto a su esposa Micaela de 18 años y su querido hijo Ton de 6 meses, a quienes desea dar un buen futuro. Los días como ladrillero de Elmer son muy largos y duros, se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para realizar el amasado y moldeado de los ladrillos, los cuales posteriormente meterá en su horno para coserlos y así estén listos para la venta. Los pedidos que tiene por lo general son muy grandes, por lo que muchas veces pide ayuda de sus vecinos ladrilleros para cumplir con el pedido, con la promesa de ayudarlos cuando ellos necesiten de él. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hacer los ladrillos, ya que siente que juega con el barro y no tanto que trabaja, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es acomodar los ladrillos en el horno, ya que tiene que ponerlos de forma que todos cosan por igual. Para el futuro espera que su negocio progrese y pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el tercer préstamo de Elmer con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya esta haciendo contactos para vender ladrillos, él es el único varón de su banco comunal por lo que siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos moldes para hacer ladrillos y así incrementar la cantidad que produce diariamente.
texts.en:
Elmer is a 21 year old man who lives in his own adobe home along with his 18 year old wife Micaela and their beloved 6 month old son, Ton. He wants to provide his family with a good future. Elmer works long, hard days as a brickmaker: he wakes up at 6am each day to mix and mold the bricks, which he later puts in the oven to fire so that they will be all ready to sell. He usually receives very large orders, so he often asks for help from his neighbors (who are also brickmakers) in order to fill the orders. He always promises to help them when they need the help. His favorite part of the job is making the bricks, since he feels like he's just playing with clay, it doesn't feel like work to him. He has had his business for the past five years, and says that the hardest part is fitting all the bricks in the oven, since he has to arrange them so that they all cook through evenly. For the future, he hopes to expand his business and improve his income. This is Elmer's third loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and he doesn't want to miss any payments due to lack of money, so he is already making contacts to sell more bricks. He is the only man in his village bank, so he always tries to be responsible and respectful of his female group members. With the requested loan of 2,000 soles, he will buy new brick molds and thus increase the number of bricks he can produce in a single day.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy molds to make bricks

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Ana es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Ana tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende verduras al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza todos los días desde la madrugada.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebolla y culantro.
Los sueños de Ana son construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Sarita Community Bank. She is a 25-year-old mother of one son and lives with her common-law husband. Ana has a post in the Nery García market where she sells vegetables at wholesale and retail every day starting at dawn. She is requesting a loan of 1200 soles (approximately $425), which she plans to invest in the purchase of onion and coriander. Ana's dreams are to build a home and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase onion and coriander

loans.name: Ransford

texts.en: Ransford A. is a fisherman who catches and sells fresh fish. He goes to the seashore to buy fresh fish to sell at Elmina near the seashore. Ransford has junior high school education. He is married and has two children. His wife is a fishmonger. Ransford has been selling fresh fish since 2004. He is responsible for paying school fees and the settlement of bills. His loan will be used to buy fishing equipment to enhance the quality of his work. He hopes to save the new profits from his business to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet tiene 38 años, vive con su pareja, Efraín, y sus 2 hijas: Soraya de 19 y Claudia de 17 años, en su casa propia. Desde hace un año ha incursionado en la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que le gusta mucho ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos, además este trabajo le ha ayudado a ser independiente y generar sus propios recursos económicos, además de los que provee su pareja. Yanet quiere brindarles a sus hijas estudios superiores y que se puedan forjar un futuro profesional, es por ello que le pone mucho empeño a su trabajo, siendo muchas veces baja la venta. Pese a ello, no se amilana y trata de ponerle muchas ganas, ya que en el futuro quiere instalar un negocio más rentable y para ello ha pensando comprar un motocarro para que con éste pueda brindar el servicio de taxi.
Es su sétimo préstamo con MFP y por ser una persona muy puntual en sus pagos se ha ganado el respeto y cariño de su grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock, también invertirá en el pago de una letra del motocarro que quiere comprar a plazos.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim Y., 49, is married and lives with six of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$2 each day and are supported by three children working in the garment factory. Kim’s husband also raises chickens to have an additional income to help the standard of living. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Kim Y. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1200 to purchase fertilizer and feed for chickens. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and feed for chickens.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn S. is from the village of Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Evelyn owns and operates a cross-stitch business, selling cross-stitch products. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cross-stitch products and to expand her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cross-stitch products

loans.name: Asoono

texts.en:
Asoono P. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu Tualesolo. She is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Asoono owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food products in the local community. Asoono has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Asoono joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asoono is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Asoono plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina H. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old. Severina is widowed and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Severina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Severina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In October 2008, Severina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Severina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. Severina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Its Severina's discretion to maintain her loan amount. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Severina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dielika

texts.fr:
Madame Dielika C. a 38 ans, marié et mère de cinq enfants, elle réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants au quartier Noumouso de la ville de Kadiolo (dans la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Dielika C. fait la commercialisation de céréales (graines) il y a environ dix  ans. Elle jouie d’une grande affluence pour la qualité de ses produits et est très sollicitée dans la ville de Kadiolo et environ. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant deux ans.  Après trois  prêts tous remboursés sans difficulté, elle est à son  quatrième prêt pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter, 1 tonne de  céréales.
 Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de kadiolo. Les marchandises sont vendues à domicile journalièrement en détail, souvent à crédit et le jour de foire au marché de la ville de Kadiolo en gros et  au comptant  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de forains( venant de Sikasso, Ségou, Bamako).
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 37.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts du prêt.
texts.en:
Mme Dielika C. is 37, and lives with her husband and their five children in the Noumouso neighborhood of Kadiolo, a town in the third administrative region of Mali. She has been selling grain for about 10 years. Because of the quality of her produce, she has a large customer base and is well regarded in Kadiolo and the surrounding area. To meet the needs of her growing clientele, she has worked with Soro Yiriwaso (a microfinance institution) for two years. She has repaid three loans with no problems, and is asking for a fourth to increase her capital and buy one tonne of grains from villages near Kadiolo. She sells her merchandise every day at retail from her home, frequently giving credit. On the days of the fairs in the Kadiolo market, she sells her merchandise at wholesale prices, mostly to stallholders who come from Sikasso, Ségou and Bamako. With this loan, she believes she can generate a monthly net income of 37,000 FCFA, which she will use to enlarge her working capital, to help pay family expenses, and to pay interest on her loan.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains.

loans.name: Latifatou

texts.fr: A. Latifatou est née le 25 Juin 1976 à Parakou, au Nord du Bénin. Mariée à ADJANBAO Moumouni, un tailleur, Latifatou est mère de sept enfants. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Latifatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Finagnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a environs deux ans que la famille vit dans ce quartier. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Latifatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Latifatou vend des bijoux et divers autres produits (savons, bombons, cigarettes, lait, sucre, dentifrices, thé lipton, etc.) à son domicile, afin de subvenir à ses besoins. Il y a environs 10 ans que Latifatou mène cette activité. Latifatou s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés à ALIDé. Latifatou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour renforcer son activité et accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Latifatou A. was born on June 25, 1976 in Parakou in northern Benin. She is married to Moumouni Adjanbao, a tailor, and the mother of seven children. Some of her children attend school. Latifatou has been living for approximately two years with her children and husband in the neighborhood of Finagnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The parents provide together for their family. Latifatou did not attend school.

Latifatou runs a convenience store from her home to provide for her needs. She sells jewels and various other items, such as soap, candy, cigarettes, milk, sugar, toothpaste, Lipton tea, etc. She has been in this business for about ten years. Latifatou gets her supply in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a long-standing client with Alidé, since she got already three loans which she repaid on schedule. She came now to Alidé and applied for her fourth loan to boost her activity and expand her clientele.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, milk, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
La Sra.  Camila,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia del San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 70 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, ya independientes.

Camila, se dedica a la venta D. comidas preparadas hace 08 años atrás, donD. poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo D. actividad, y nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, hoy ya es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes, por la rica sazón que le pone a sus comidas.  En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y es ella quien personalmente les atienD., con el carisma y amabilidad que siempre le ha caracterizado. 

Con este préstamo D. S/ 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios D. cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Camila, se siente muy segura y con ganas D. seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Camila, 70, is a member of the "Las Golondrinas II" communal bank, which is in Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has 3 adult children. Camila has sold prepared meals for the last 8 years and has been acquiring work experience bit by bit. She relates to us that she's done well with her sales; she is well-known and well-liked by her customers, thanks to the great flavor she puts into her dishes. She continues to this day in her work and it is she, herself, who tends to her customers with the good-humor and charm that have always characterized her. She will use this 3000 sol loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar, various vegetables, crates of eggs and chickens. She will also buy some kitchen utensils to replace some of the ones she has so that she can offer better customer service. Camila feels sure of herself and with the desire to continue working to get ahead and secure for herself a peaceful life. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Kabingo Group, Rukungiri

texts.en: K. Oliver who appears in the small photo is also part of the big photo and she is the leader of her lending group in Rukungiri. She is 54 years old and married with children, although most of them are now grown up. She helps to take care of her grandchildren. Oliver is a businesswoman with a grocery store in Kabingo trading center that she has run for 20 years. She buys and stocks fresh produce such as vegetables, matooke (a plantain dish), Irish potatoes, and so on, and from her transactions she is able to make 100,000 UGX as weekly profit. This enables her to take care of her family, with her husband's help. Oliver needs a loan to buy more produce for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Mrs. Sina P. is 45 years old and lives in Thlok Doung Tum village, Takeo province. She is a widow with four children; one of them works in a local garment factory, while the other three are students. All four of her children support her silk-weaving business. Mrs. Sina P. and her family work hard but earn only a small income. That is why Mrs. Sina P. has applied to AMK for a loan for 8,000,000 Riel to buy more silk and supplies. Her goal is to use the loan to increase her output, earn more money, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more silk and supplies
